description: Jasmine Hay Man Chan and Graham William Jenkins were married May 6 at the Arts Club of Washington. Mike Naple, a friend of the couple who was designated a civil marriage officiant for the event by the District of Columbia Marriage Bureau, officiated.

title: Deprina Godboldo, Khristopher Brooks
description: Deprina Lashana Godboldo and Khristopher Jajwuan Brooks are to be married May 7 at Clearwater Beach in Clearwater, Fla. Gayle Liteheart, a minister of Heartlight Ministries, is to officiate.

title: Evelin Chabot, John Griffin
description: Evelin Margaret Chabot, a daughter of Elizabeth A. Chabot and Kelly G. Chabot of Saratoga Springs, N.Y., was married there May 6 to John Gordon Griffin, a son of Mary A. Griffin and John P. Griffin of Menands, N.Y. The Rev. Kate S. Forer, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony at the Presbyterian-New England Congregational Church, where she is the senior pastor.

title: Janelle Duyck, Dino Bovell Jr.
description: Janelle Renee Duyck and Dino Alexander Bovell Jr. were married May 6 at the Sandals Royal Bahamian resort in Nassau, the Bahamas. The Rev. Roy Burrows, a marriage officer licensed by the Bahamian government, officiated.

title: Annie Liu, Naveen Gulati
description: Annie Yuan-Yuan Liu and Naveen Gulati were married May 6 at the Lanikuhonua Cultural Institute, an events space in Kapolei, Hawaii, on the island of Oahu. The Rev. Mark S. Kurnow, a minister of the Evangelical Christian Church in Honolulu, officiated.

title: Aisha Muharrar, Benjamin Epstein
description: Aisha Imani Muharrar and Benjamin Marc Epstein were married May 6 at the Sunstone Villa in Santa Ynez, Calif. Josh Halloway, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Michelle Jang, Christopher Park
description: Dr. Michelle Yongkyong Jang and Christopher Lim Park were married May 6 at Riverside Church in Manhattan. The Rev. Kevin Wright, a United Methodist minister and the church's minister of education, performed the ceremony.

title: Melissa Marcial, Stavros Katsetos
description: Melissa Marcial and Stavros Anastasios Katsetos are to be married May 7 at the Garrison, an event space in Garrison, N.Y. Norma Moutal, an interfaith minister, is to officiate.

title: Corrections: May 7, 2017
description: ARTS & LEISURE

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Major League Soccer and The Salesman
description: The New York City F.C., led by the Spanish striker David Villa, takes on Atlanta United at Yankee Stadium. And two Oscar-winning foreign films put great American plays to brilliant use.

title: Highlights of the French Presidential Vote
description: The independent centrist Emmanuel Macron defeated Marine Le Pen and will become the next president of France, according to preliminary results on Sunday, ending a bitter campaign to determine the countrys future participation in a united Europe.

title: Morning Joe and Kellyanne Conway Are Mocked on Saturday Night Live
description: Having spent many months locked in a contentious relationship with President Trump and his administration, Saturday Night Live took a rare opportunity this week to celebrate love: the romance between the Morning Joe hosts Joe Scarborough and Mika Brzezinski, who confirmed on Thursday that they are now engaged.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $450,000
description: 633 East 11th Street, No. 19, East Village

title: The French Election, in Pictures
description: In cities and villages, small towns and suburbs, young and old voted on Sunday in one of Frances most important presidential elections in memory, with the starkest of choices.

title: France, Kentucky Derby, Trump: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Tempers Flare Over Removal of Confederate Statues in New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS  For Malcolm Suber, the Confederate monuments that dot this Deep South city stand for white supremacy, pure and simple. Instead of just taking them down, Mr. Suber, an African-American activist and organizer, would like to see the city pass out sledgehammers and let everybody take a whack  just like the Berlin Wall.

title: Angela Merkels Party Wins Unexpectedly in German State Elections
description: BERLIN  Voters in Germanys northernmost state, Schleswig-Holstein, handed Chancellor Angela Merkels party an unexpected victory in a state election on Sunday, suggesting that Germans were willing to back the center-right in a year when the chancellor is seeking a fourth term.

title: Hindu Temple in Queens Joins Sanctuary Movement
description: When the Shaanti Bhavan Mandir in Queens became the first Hindu temple in the nation to publicly declare itself a sanctuary congregation, part of a network of houses of worship that will support and shelter undocumented immigrants, its leaders hoped other local Hindu temples would join, too.

title: North Korea Detains Another American, State Agency Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea has detained another American citizen on charges of committing hostile acts against the country, the Norths official news agency reported on Sunday.

title: Trump Looms as Kushner Companies Courts Investors in China
description: SHANGHAI  Like many American firms that come to China looking for money, Kushner Companies tried to woo a Shanghai audience with promises of big returns and a path toward living in the United States.

title: A Monument to Jesus in the City of Mao
description: CHANGSHA, China  Sweeping heavenward like an enormous glass-and-metal ski jump, a new Protestant church dominates the crumbled earth, freshly planted trees and unfinished water features of a suburban park under construction in Changsha.

title: A Travel Bans Foe: A Young Firebrand and Her Pro Bono Brigade
description: Tipped off by her Washington sources that an executive order blocking refugees was coming, Becca Heller fired off messages to her vast network of law students and pro bono lawyers:

title: Collecting Fares Is Latest Problem for New Jersey Transit
description: New Jersey Transit, one of the nations busiest commuter railroads, has been flogged by riders who have suffered through a brutal stretch of travel upheavals. The railroads safety record is under scrutiny after a fatal derailment last year.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: In a Fight for Land, a Womens Movement Shakes Morocco
description: OULAD SEBATA, Morocco  For most of her life, Saida Soukats days were filled with the routines of the farm, working the fields and minding the cattle. A recent Tuesday found her doing something far different, though, speaking before a group of women during their biweekly protests to demand a halt in the state-sanctioned privatization of traditional tribal collectives, called the Sulaliyyate lands.

title: Analysis of the French Election
description: Our foreign correspondents in France and in key European cities analyzed the final round of the French presidential election.

title: After Matt Harvey Is Disciplined, Mets Fill-In Is Punished by the Marlins
description: Adam Wilk, a Mets left-hander who had not pitched in the major leagues for two years, started Sundays game at Citi Field on short notice, backed by an offense that would reach the sixth inning without a hit. The result  a 7-0 loss to the Miami Marlins and the end of a three-game winning streak  was insignificant when compared with the reason Wilk took the mound.

title: The Coda to a Career: Barbara Cook Has Retired
description: Adam LeGrant answered the phone and said that, contrary to the arrangements that had been made, his mother was not going to come on the line to talk.

title: How France Voted
description: Detailed maps of the French presidential election show how Emmanuel Macron decisively beat right-wing nationalist Marine Le Pen.

title: Paris Braces for Election Result
description: In the Marais, in the heart of Paris, Emmanuel Macron far outpolled Marine Le Pen in the first round. With the final round of voting underway, feelings there were unsettled.

title: On Health and Welfare, Moral Arguments Can Outweigh Economics
description: When Representative Mo Brooks said it was unfair that healthy people who lead good lives should have to subsidize the insurance of unhealthier ones who presumably dont, he bluntly raised an often unspoken question that runs through policy debates in Washington: Who deserves government aid and who does not?

title: Macron Decisively Defeats Le Pen in French Presidential Race
description: PARIS  Emmanuel Macron, a youthful former investment banker, handily won Frances presidential election on Sunday, defeating the staunch nationalist Marine Le Pen after voters firmly rejected her far-right message and backed his call for centrist change.

title: Sinclair Is Said to Be Near a Deal for Tribune Media
description: The Sinclair Broadcast Group may not have much name recognition outside its home base near Baltimore, but the company is poised to cover most of the countrys television households.

title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 Gives Summer Box Office a Big Start
description: LOS ANGELES  The raccoon Rocket and his fellow Guardians of the Galaxy misfits kicked off Hollywoods crucial summer season over the weekend with a predictably brawny $145 million in domestic ticket sales.

title: In South Korea, Election Looms as Ex-President Sits in Jail
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Just a few months ago, Park Geun-hye was the president of South Korea. Now she is Inmate No. 503.

title: Yale Drama Series Prize Announces 2017 Winner
description: This years Yale Drama Series Prize has been awarded to Jacqueline Goldfinger for her play Bottle Fly. She will receive $10,000, and her play will receive a staged reading in London.

title: San Diego Police Find Suicide Note on Teenager Shot After 911 Call
description: The call came into the San Diegos 911 system around 3:30 a.m. Saturday: Could officers check on the safety of a teenage boy standing outside Torrey Pines High School in the affluent Carmel Valley neighborhood?

title: Always Dreamings Story Starts With 2 Brooklyn Boys Trips to the Track
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Has there ever been a more appropriate name for a Kentucky Derby winner than Always Dreaming? It was bequeathed on him by a band of New Yorkers whose dreams first took flight from Brooklyn stoops.

title: Trump Visit Barely Rustles the Hedgerows of Bedminster
description: BEDMINSTER, N.J.  The country road rolls through a landscape that resembles a pastoral painting come to life, passing stately houses sitting at the end of winding driveways and horses behind white wooden fences, grazing in unblemished green fields. A little farther down, in an area shrouded by trees, another road sprouts off by a short stone wall with placard that says Private.

title: Emmanuel Macron, Boko Haram, Jared Kushner: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: A Venice Biennale About Art, With the Politics Muted
description: VENICE  In 2015, the Venice Biennale with Okwui Enwezor as curator sometimes felt more like a political manifesto, with readings from Marxs Das Kapital and work that touched on climate change, colonialism and the refugee crisis in the Mediterranean. The curator of this years Biennale, Christine Macel, had a different vision: to put artists and artistic practice at the center.

title: Review: Anglique Kidjo Takes Remain in Light Back to Africa
description: Africa rapturously reclaimed rock when Anglique Kidjo, from Benin, performed all the songs from Talking Heads album Remain in Light on Friday night at Carnegie Hall, along with a few of her own. She plans to tour with Remain in Light, and is recording the songs as a studio album with a top pop producer, Jeff Bhasker. From the stage, she declared, I always as an artist want to try to find a way to create bridges between cultures.

title: Review: New York Class Clowns Are Now Musical Old Masters
description: The class clowns who merrily threw spitballs at New Yorks artistic landscape three decades ago are now, in more ways than one, seniors. Thats true at the Whitney Museum of American Art, where the exhibition Fast Forward: Painting From the 1980s makes a persuasive case for the maturity of a generation of supposed bad boys (and girls).

title: Don Gordon, Steve McQueens Sidekick Onscreen and in Life, Dies at 90
description: Don Gordon, an Emmy-nominated character actor who often starred alongside his close friend Steve McQueen, died on April 24 in Los Angeles. He was 90.

title: Lawsuit Presses the Issue of Lower Pay for Female Law Partners
description: By all accounts, Mary T. Yelenick had a stellar career at Chadbourne & Parke, the New York law firm where she spent 35 years, rising to the position of chairwoman for the product liability practice.

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: China Miville on the Russian Revolution
description: China Miville is one of those fiction writers whose multivalent imagination  with its monsters, cityscapes of the future, and battles between good and evil  is capable of making readers heads explode. In The New York Times, Sarah Lyall once wrote that his novels skitter among genres, magpie-ing elements from science fiction, fantasy, urban fantasy, traditional fairy tales, steampunk, horror. So perhaps the weirdest thing Miville could do at this point is write about the real world, which is what he does in October, his new nonfiction book about the Russian Revolution in 1917. Below, he tells us about his interest in the subject, why he chose to write about it a century after the events he describes, and more.

title: Review: Vanessa Returns, With a Dreamier Side
description: Its not surprising that Mannes Operas new production of Samuel Barbers Vanessa focuses on the dreamier elements of the 1958 work. This is almost inevitable when student singers (here those of the Mannes School of Music) portray its tortured characters. And there is certainly a nostalgic element in the piece, which tells the story of a rich, beautiful woman who has spent 20 reclusive years clinging to the hope that the lover who left her will return.

title: House Health Care Bill Is Us Keeping Our Promises, Paul Ryan Says
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker Paul D. Ryan said on Sunday that criticism of the way the House passed its health care bill  no hearings were held on the final version, and it has yet to receive an evaluation from the Congressional Budget Office  was kind of a bogus attack from the left.

title: Steven Holcomb, Gold Medal Bobsledder Who Beat Vision Problems, Dies at 37
description: Steven Holcomb, a brawny three-time Olympic medalist who overcame a disease that threatened his vision, and then in 2010 piloted a four-man bobsled team to the United States first gold medal in the event in 62 years, was found dead on Saturday. He was 37.

title: Hackers Find Celebrities Weak Links in Their Vendor Chains
description: In December, hackers impersonating an executive at Interscope Records, the record label owned by Universal Music Group, managed to bypass all the latest in digital defenses with a simple email.

title: France Elects Emmanuel Macron
description: The decisive election of Emmanuel Macron, a 39-year-old political neophyte committed to the European Union, economic reform and traditional liberalism, as president of France offered powerful relief to everyone who had feared that France could become the next country to succumb to the wave of populism, nationalism and anti-globalism sweeping through Western democracies.

title: Modern Movement Initialism
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  A very cute idea by Zhouqin Burnikel today, where she uses words that sound like letters to create an initialism.

title: Trumps Wall Faces a Barrier in Texas: Landowner Lawsuits
description: LOS EBANOS, Tex.  One of the principal barriers to President Trumps border wall begins in Aleida Garcias expansive backyard.

title: 13 Reasons Why Will Return for a Second Season
description: The highly popular, highly debated Netflix series 13 Reasons Why will return for a second season. The series, which follows the aftermath of the teenager Hannah Bakers suicide, will return with 13 episodes in 2018.

title: Cleveland Cavaliers Finish Another Playoff Sweep, Earning More Precious Rest
description: TORONTO  The Raptors approached the end with resignation. Too many injuries. Too much LeBron James.

title: Candid, Comedic and Macabre YouTube Stars Feel an Advertising Pinch
description: Tim Wood sat on a chair inside a house in Hinsdale, N.Y., long rumored to be haunted. He had a Ouija board in his lap and was livestreaming the experience to a group of fans on YouTube.

title: Why Macron Won: Luck, Skill and Frances Dark History
description: PARIS  The French presidential runoff transcended national politics. It was globalization against nationalism. It was the future versus the past. Open versus closed.

title: In Discover, Snap Sees a Bright Spot as It Tries to Fend Off Facebook
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When Snapchat unveiled Discover, a place in the messaging app where media companies can publish original stories, one of the publishers that jumped to get onto the platform was the website Mashable.

title: Videos Show Palestinian Hunger Strike Leader Snacking, Israel Says
description: JERUSALEM  As Palestinian prisoners ended the third week of a mass hunger strike, Israel released videos that it said showed the strike leader, Marwan Barghouti, sneaking snacks in his cell.

title: French Election: The Moment Macron Won
description: In 360, witness the moment Emmanuel Macron was declared the next president of France. Mr. Macron, a centrist who supports the E.U., handily beat Marine Le Pen, the National Front's far-right leader.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of May 8
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Leader of Afghanistan Branch of ISIS Killed in Special Forces Raid
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The leader of the Islamic State affiliate in Afghanistan who orchestrated audacious attacks that further upended the countrys deteriorating security situation was killed in a special forces raid last month, the president of Afghanistan said in a statement on Sunday.

title: Strangers, and Cookies, on a Train
description: Dear Diary:

title: Camaraderie of Wrigley Field Bullpens Is Tangled Amid the Ivy
description: CHICAGO  In 1969, when the Chicago Cubs found themselves in a pennant race for the first time in decades and the games at Wrigley Field suddenly began to matter, pitcher Dick Selma would ritually rise from his seat in the bullpen down the left-field line and wave a white towel over his head, rallying the fans in the bleachers to make some noise.

title: Supporters Elated by Macrons Election
description: French citizens hoping the centrist candidate would become Frances next president were overcome with joy and relief as the final result came in.

title: By Suspending Matt Harvey, Mets Call Attention to Drastic Times
description: The event at Citi Field on Sunday was billed as a major league baseball game. Unofficially, though, it was something closer to consumer fraud. After announcing a sudden suspension for pitcher Matt Harvey on Sunday morning, the Mets essentially conceded a game and turned it into batting practice for Giancarlo Stanton.

title: Hedge Fund Leaders Will Gather, and Uber May Learn Fate in Europe
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: Trump to Announce Slate of Conservative Federal Court Nominees
description: WASHINGTON  Having filled a Supreme Court vacancy, President Trump is turning his attention to the more than 120 openings on the lower federal courts. On Monday, he will announce a slate of 10 nominees to those courts, a senior White House official said, the first in what could be near monthly waves of nominations.

title: A Republican Principle Is Shed in the Fight on Health Care
description: WASHINGTON  As they take their victory lap for passing a bill that would repeal and replace much of the Affordable Care Act, President Trump and congressional Republicans have been largely silent about one of the most remarkable aspects of what their legislation would do: take a step toward dismantling a vast government entitlement program, something that has never been accomplished in the modern era.

title: E.P.A. Dismisses Members of Major Scientific Review Board
description: WASHINGTON  The Environmental Protection Agency has dismissed at least five members of a major scientific review board, the latest signal of what critics call a campaign by the Trump administration to shrink the agencys regulatory reach by reducing the role of academic research.

title: After Boko Haram Releases Nigerian Girls, an Anguished Wait for Parents
description: DAKAR, Senegal  The father of two girls kidnapped by Boko Haram was suspicious when friends told him that dozens of girls had been freed, because he had heard similar rumors countless times during the three years the schoolchildren have been missing.

title: Quotation of the Day: Confederate Monuments Fall, and Tempers Rise
description: Theyre putting that image right in our face and saying, Blacks at the bottom, whites at the top.

title: The Leftovers Season 3, Episode 4: Disappearing Act
description: It doesnt take long before a sense of queasy dread creeps into this weeks episode of The Leftovers and takes a permanent hold. The mood darkens in the opening scene when Nora Durst abandons her traveling partner, Kevin Garvey, at the Austin airport, blithely leaving him to slog his way through the regular security line while she zips through Global Entry.

title: Ad Buyers Have a Say in Whether Real News Survives
description: PHILADELPHIA  Hey, Americas Advertisers: You got some good news last week, didnt you?

title: Texas Governor Signs a Ban on Sanctuary Cities
description: Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas signed into law on Sunday a bill banning so-called sanctuary cities, a loosely defined term for jurisdictions that limit the authorities from collecting or sharing an individuals immigration status.

title: Billions Season 2 Finale Recap: Alien vs. Predator
description: These last two weeks of Billions have been such an ornate symphony of strategies and counterstrategies that it can be easy to forget the base motives of the two conductors waving their wands. The first season ended with Chuck and Axe squaring off in the ruins of Axe Capital. The second season ends in much the same way, with Chucks triumph over Axe coming at a steep personal price and the threat of devastating blowback. No matter. The two words Chuck keeps repeating are these: Worth it.

title: European Markets Swing Upward, Then Settle, in Wake of French Election
description: LONDON  Markets breathed a sigh of relief on Monday after Emmanuel Macron secured the French presidency in the second round of elections, but investor enthusiasm quickly waned as the focus shifted to the scale of the challenge facing him.

title: No Corrections: May 8, 2017
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, May 8, 2017.

title: Obama Defends Affordable Care Act, but Leaves Trump Out of It
description: WASHINGTON  Days after President Trump boasted in the White House Rose Garden about the Houses vote to dismantle the Affordable Care Act, the laws biggest champion, Barack Obama, left the jibes virtually unanswered Sunday night during his first major address since leaving the presidency.

title: Emmanuel Macron, Boko Haram, Angela Merkel: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Whats On TV Monday: Tilda Swinton in A Bigger Splash and Rachel Weisz in The Deep Blue Sea
description: A rock star and her lover see their vacation go awry in A Bigger Splash, starring Tilda Swinton and Matthias Schoenaerts. And Rachel Weisz plays a titled British woman who chooses to follow her heart in The Deep Blue Sea.

title: Life and Combat for Republicans at Berkeley
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  On this famously liberal campus, it is easy to dismiss Berkeley Republicans as an oxymoron. Being a Republican at the University of California, Berkeley, is hard, conservative students say, a crucible of ideological combat. Some said they had been mocked, spat on and punched.

title: First African to Play in the Major Leagues Is a Pinnacle for Baseball
description: CINCINNATI  Every promotion to the major leagues is a triumph. The rookie has ascended to the top of his profession, realized his dream, validated his toil and sacrifice. He deserves the support that awaits him.

title: Rikers Tumult Rises: Prison Official Accused of Spying on Investigator
description: New York Citys Department of Investigation has picked apart practically every facet of the troubled Rikers Island jail complex in recent years, including abuses committed by guards and inmates and the misuse of official cars by the commissioner and his staff.

title: In Milan, Prada Holds Its First Solo Cruise Show
description: MILAN  From the creation of Fondazione Prada to underwriting creative exhibits across the globe, Miuccia Prada has long made a point of walking the line between fashion and art. So it was fitting that her first stand-alone cruise collection show was held in the Osservatorio, the foundations new photography gallery nestled under the glass and iron domes of the Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II, where Prada opened its first store in 1913. And that the show was held on Sunday, just before the glamorous whirl of the opening parties for the Venice Biennale this week.

title: Looking at New Generations of African Photographers
description: A new generation of African artists, inspired by their predecessors and helped by technology, has been redefining how Africans look at themselves.

description: To the Editor:

title: Mr. Zinke, Keep Channeling Teddy Roosevelt
description: On his first day on the job, Ryan Zinke, President Trumps secretary of the interior, rode a horse to work, in plain imitation of Teddy Roosevelt, who as president used to gallop around Washington, and whose admirable record as a conservationist Mr. Zinke says he hopes to emulate. By all accounts, Mr. Zinke, a former Navy SEALs member and congressman from Montana, is not a dope. He therefore knows that he cannot possibly match Mr. Roosevelt if he embraces the dismaying anti-environmental agenda Mr. Trump has saddled him with.

title: How 13 Reasons Why Depicts Teenage Suicide
description: To the Editor:

title: Seersucker and Civility
description: HAMPDEN SYDNEY, Va.  On the first day of his freshman year, each student at Hampden-Sydney, the mens college we attend in southern Virginia, is given a slim rule book.

title: John McCain: Why We Must Support Human Rights
description: Washington, D.C.  SOME years ago, I heard Natan Sharansky, the human rights icon, recount how he and his fellow refuseniks in the Soviet Union took renewed courage from statements made on their behalf by President Ronald Reagan. Word had reached the gulag that the leader of the most powerful nation on earth had spoken in defense of their right to self-determination. America, personified by its president, gave them hope, and hope is a powerful defense against oppression.

title: Republicans Party Like Its 1984
description: There have been many bad laws in U.S. history. Some bills were poorly conceived; some were cruel and unjust; some were sold on false pretenses. Some were all of the above.

title: Take the A Train, as in Audubon
description: Of all the primal habitats he infiltrated, John James Audubon, the great illustrator of nature, opted to retire to the upper reaches of Manhattan in the 1840s. He had spent decades roaming the fledging nations woodlands to paint the beauty of Americas wild birds that he shot on the wing. He finally couldnt resist the city, or at least its verdant fringe.

title: Republican Death Wish
description: The obscene spectacle of House Republicans gathering last week in the Rose Garden to celebrate the Houses passage of a bill that would likely strip insurance coverage from tens of millions of Americans, while simultaneously serving as a massive tax break for the wealthy, had the callous feel of the well-heeled dancing on the poors graves.

title: A Disaster Wrapped in Victory
description: WASHINGTON  After voting to repeal and replace Obamacare last week, House Republicans rode up Pennsylvania Avenue to celebrate with President Trump in the Rose Garden. The reveling was premature: The bill still has to go to the Senate and back to the House, and analysts have already highlighted the immense electoral risks that come with rushing through an overwhelmingly unpopular bill.

title: Looking at New Generations of African Photographers
description: On a continent where same-sex relations are illegal in most countries, and where being gay is punishable by death in some states, homosexuality is widely considered un-African.

title: Giving The Philanthropist an Infusion of Youth
description: LONDON  If youre going to revive a young mans play, why not cast it with young people? That seems to be the thinking behind the peculiar new West End production of The Philanthropist, the Christopher Hampton play that was written when its author, now age 71, was 23. The director Simon Callows revival is at Trafalgar Studios through July 22.

title: Akzo Nobel Rejects 3rd Offer From PPG Industries, a U.S. Rival
description: LONDON  Akzo Nobel, the Dutch chemicals company best known for making Dulux paint, rejected on Monday a merger offer from its American rival PPG Industries, its third such rejection since early March, saying it preferred to go it alone.

title: A Familys Journey Home to Afghanistan and Uncertainty
description: Hundreds of thousands of Afghan refugees are being pushed to return to Afghanistan after living in Pakistan for decades. Witness one familys journey back to Kabul.

title: Why You Should Learn to Say No More Often
description: Humans are social animals who thrive on reciprocity. Its in our nature to be socially obliging, and the word no feels like a confrontation that threatens a potential bond. But when we dole out an easy yes instead of a difficult no we tend to overcommit our time, energy and finances.

title: 6 Takeaways From Mondays Senate Hearing on Russia
description: WASHINGTON  When did the White House know  and exactly who knew  about conversations that Michael T. Flynn, the former national security adviser, had with the Russian ambassador? That was the focus on Monday at a Senate hearing where Sally Q. Yates, the former acting attorney general, testified about Russias interference in the presidential election.

title: Patrick Buchanan Reveals Himself to Be the First Trumpist

title: Arts Groups on Edge as New York City Re-evaluates Cultural Funding
description: The elite, majestic museums of Manhattan never had to worry about competing for city money with the small-fry arts groups of Brooklyn, Queens, Staten Island and the Bronx. Those organizations, hardly world famous or well connected, had to accept scraps while the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Lincoln Center and other giants enjoyed a relative feast of resources under the citys century-old formula for financing cultural institutions.

title: He Wanted to Close the Export-Import Bank. Now He May Run It.
description: WASHINGTON  Less than two years ago, Scott Garrett, then a Republican congressman from New Jersey, took to the floor of the House of Representatives and laced into his colleagues for resurrecting an institution that embodies the corruption of the free enterprise system.

title: Sanctuary Bills in Maryland Faced a Surprise Foe: Legal Immigrants
description: ELLICOTT CITY, Md.  When lawmakers in Howard County, Md., a stretch of suburbia between Washington and Baltimore, declared their intention to make the county a sanctuary for people living in the country illegally, J. D. Ma thought back to how hard he had worked studying English as a boy in Shanghai.

title: South Koreas Presidential Election: A Look at the Pivotal Issues
description: South Koreans began the process of selecting a new president on Tuesday, in a vote that will turn on several crucial issues: relations with North Korea and the United States; economic inequality; and the enduring power of the countrys family-controlled conglomerates, known as chaebol. Heres how these issues are playing out in the election.

title: A 2016 Review: Theres Reason to Be Skeptical of a Comey Effect

Politicians, analysts and journalists are still debating whether the letter cost Mrs. Clinton the presidency. Its certainly possible. But I am not at all sure, in part because of the final Upshot/Siena College poll in Florida.

description: CHICAGO  When Aaron Hicks slid across home plate, ahead of an errant throw from Chicago Cubs shortstop Addison Russell, he was tugged at by competing emotions.

title: Emmanuel Macron Will Take Over as President of France on Sunday
description: LONDON  Emmanuel Macron will take office as Frances next president on May 14, President Franois Hollande announced on Monday, a day after Mr. Macron, an independent centrist, defeated Marine Le Pen in a battle for the countrys leadership.

title: Comcast and Charter Communications Forge Wireless Alliance
description: As more consumers cut the cord on traditional cable television, businesses selling those services are responding by offering a wider range of products, hoping to retain customers.

title: Keith Olbermann Was Once Cable Newss Liberal Standard-Bearer. Now Hes Missing Its Boom Times.
description: Keith Olbermann doesnt look much like a warrior. His gray hair is giving way to white, his midsection threatens the buttons of his sport coats and he walks gingerly, with a gnarly limp from an aging knee. When I visited him in late January, he was ill, hoarse and racked with fits of coughing. But when he hobbles into his studio and sits, a table shields his less flattering proportions, accentuating broad shoulders and an icy blue gaze. And when he starts to speak  confidently, quickly, alternately gesticulating or pretending to read from a stack of papers  he looks more like the man he used to be: the broadcaster who helped not only revolutionize sports news, but also invent a new mode of liberal cable-news political commentary.

title: Why the Macron Hacking Attack Landed With a Thud in France
description: PARIS  Maybe it was the suspect timing of the leaked documents. Or the staggering amount and possibility that some were fake. Or a feeling among the French that, having witnessed how hacking may have altered the American election, they would not fall for the same ploy.

title: Emma Watson Wins MTVs Gender-Neutral Acting Prize
description: Emma Watson made a potent call for breaking down gender categories as she scooped up the gender-neutral film acting prize at the MTV Movie and TV Awards, in a speech that was broadcast on Sunday night.

title: Emmanuel Macron Embraces E.U. to Put France Back in the Picture
description: LONDON  It was a striking moment when Emmanuel Macron, newly elected president of France, torchbearer of a new politics, strode onto a courtyard of the Louvre to celebrate his victory: As the crowd cheered, waving the tricolor French flag, the choice of music was Ode to Joy, the anthem of the European Union. Some people even waved the blocs flag, with its circle of golden stars.

title: White Nationalism Gets Thumped
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Coachs $2.4 Billion Kate Spade Deal Aims at Weak Middle of Fashion Market
description: Coach and Kate Spade have long been the affordable luxury brands of choice for the aspirational shopper. From Coachs embossed logo and leather handbags to Kate Spades kitschy, colorful accessories, their products lured buyers who wanted a taste of fashion without the sharpest edges  or the highest cost.

title: A New Age in French  Modeling
description: All that talk about changing the shape  literally  of modeling has finally been put into action. At least in France.

title: Watch Dmitri Hvorostovskys Surprise Return to the Met Opera
description: It was a return to the stage that some feared would never happen again.

title: Dead Rivers, Closed Beaches: A Water Crisis on Long Island
description: OAKDALE, N.Y.  The Great South Bay, flanked by Fire Island and the South Shore of Long Island, once produced half the shellfish consumed in the United States, and supported 6,000 jobs in the early 1970s.

title: Celtics Stretch of Futility Gives Wizards Reason to Believe
description: When Amir Johnson sank a 3-pointer early in the third quarter, the Celtics were looking fairly good in their playoff game against the Washington Wizards on Sunday night. Boston was up by 5 and appeared to be on the way to stealing a road win to take a three-games-to-one lead in the N.B.A. playoff series.

title: A Rose Is a Rose Is a Doughnut
description: Fresh off his turn fashioning hundreds of mini-doughnuts for the Met Gala last week, Mark Isreal, the owner of Doughnut Plant, turned to what was next on his calendar: Mothers Day. He has created big yeast Doughflowers shaped like roses and available in a choice of glazes: strawberry, made from fresh berries; rose, richly perfumed with rose water and crushed edible petals; and Italian blood orange, sweet and tart with orange blossom water. They will be sold indefinitely starting Wednesday at his shops on the Lower East Side and in Chelsea in Manhattan, and in Long Island City, Queens, and Prospect Heights, Brooklyn: Doughflowers, $5 each, Doughnut Plant stores, doughnutplant.com.

title: Conquering Machu Picchu, the Cheap and Quick Way
description: Was it worth it? Thats the most common question Ive fielded since I visited Machu Picchu, the ruins of a 15th-century Incan estate that sit almost 8,000 feet above sea level. Thrust back into prominence when the American explorer Hiram Bingham discovered it in 1911, it was used, by some accounts, as a palace, a retreat for the wealthy, a religious sanctuary or all three. Today, the photo-friendly ruins (popular with tourists and Obamas alike) receive thousands of visitors daily and are the engine that drives Perus tourism industry.

title: A Mozart Melody for the Master Chef
description: Banish the insistent oven buzz. A new cooking timer alerts the cook when the cake is done with a few bars of Mozart. The gadget, topped with a bust of the composer, bursts into the lilting Rondo alla Turca, the third movement of his Piano Sonata No. 11, when the time is up; it should cheer a highbrow cook for Mothers Day: Mozart Kitchen Timer, $17.50, Kikkerland Shop, 493 Avenue of the Americas (13th Street), 212-262-5000, kikkerland.com.

title: Baking Conversions at Your Fingertips
description: Having conversions all in one place is a treasure for a cook. In her concise little guide, Jessica Reed includes Fahrenheit to Celsius, ounces to grams, tables that show relative sizes of eggs, and the equivalent volumes of various baking pans. She lists the weight of ingredients like a cup of flour, and even helps with the kinds of measurements, like a glass of wine, that you are likely to find in historic recipes. The only thing missing are equivalents in weight and volume for grated cheeses: The Bakers Appendix by Jessica Reed (Clarkson Potter, $18.99).

title: Geniuses Wanted: NASA Challenges Coders to Speed Up Its Supercomputer
description: Are you a computer programmer with an eye for aeronautics? Get in touch with NASA. They could use your help.

title: Tart Flavors From a New Soup Company
description: Sandy Khorrami was 12 when she and her mother arrived in the United States from Iran during the revolution and settled in Great Neck, N.Y., where her sister and her family lived. Now, nearly 40 years later, Ms. Khorrami has gone into the soup business. Her signature soup, a deep ruby blend of pomegranate juice and beets, reflects her Iranian heritage. The tart soup, bolstered with rice and herbs, can be served cold, and benefits at any temperature from a dollop of yogurt. Her other soup flavors are Tuscan vegetable with buckwheat, lightly spiced mushroom with lemongrass and quinoa, and butternut squash with quinoa: $51.91 for four 25-ounce jars, one variety or assorted, somethinggoodtoeatnyc.com.

title: Eat Your Vegetables
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Same Speedy Omakase Chef, Now on the West Side
description: The chef David Bouhadana has left Sushi on Jones to open a similar Tokyo-style omakase sushi counter in the Gansevoort Market. Like his previous stand, this one will offer 12 pieces for $50 to eat in 30 minutes. Its a version of what Sukiyabashi Jiro, the famous chef in Jiro Dreams of Sushi, and others do for a few more bites and a lot more money. When he opens on May 15, Mr. Bouhadana will have four seats at his counter in the rear of the market, along with an area for takeout. He will also welcome guest chefs in his open kitchen: Sushi by Bou, Gansevoort Market, 353 West 14th Street, text reservation requests to 917-870-1587, sushibybou.com.

title: The Building Blocks of Cataracts
description: Q. What are cataracts made of and what causes them to form in the eyes?

title: An Alfredo Sauce Straight From the Source
description: New approaches to pasta have pushed old-school classics like fettuccine Alfredo to the sidelines. But this sumptuous indulgence, first served in 1914 by Alfredo di Lelio and still featured at his namesake restaurant in Rome, Ristorante Il Vero Alfredo, has not been forgotten. Russell Bellanca, who served it at his Alfredo 100 restaurant in New York, has worked with the Roman restaurant to produce an authorized Alfredo sauce for home cooks. Its made from Parmigiano-Reggiano, butter, extra-virgin olive oil and skim milk, and sold fresh, in 14-ounce containers. But the recipe on the label is somewhat off base. Unless youre Charlize Theron bulking up for Monster, figure a pound of pasta with the whole container of sauce to serve up to eight, not four: The Only Original Alfredo Sauce, $68.28 for four containers, jerseyitaliangravy.com.

title: South Koreas Powerful Family Business Ties Could Be Tough to Cut
description: Forget Machiavelli, or Game of Thrones. When it comes to staying in power, South Koreas richest business clans have the game plan down.

title: Building a Vision of Heaven for Thailands God
description: BANGKOK  On a broad parade ground not far from the Grand Palace, Thai masters are constructing a vision of heaven  an elegant, nine-spired funeral pyre for King Bhumibol Adulyadej that will send his soul into the afterlife later this year.

title: Internal Investigator Is Removed Over Rikers Spying Claim
description: The commissioner of New York Citys Correction Department, Joseph Ponte, removed his agencys head of internal affairs on Monday and placed him on modified duty, a spokesman for Mayor Bill de Blasio said.

title: A Parable From Down Under for U.S. Climate Scientists
description: HOBART, TASMANIA  John A. Church, a climate scientist, did not look or sound like a man who had recently been shoved out of a job.

title: Obama Warned Trump About Hiring Flynn, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  President Barack Obama warned Donald J. Trump against hiring Michael T. Flynn to be part of his national security team when Mr. Obama met with his successor in the Oval Office two days after the November election, two former Obama administration officials said on Monday.

title: How We Beat the House  in Tallying the Health Care Vote
description: All your keystrokes are live, typed Wilson Andrews, a graphics editor, at 2:08 p.m. Two software engineers and three graphics editors sat up a little straighter. Everything we entered into the Google sheet in front of us was going directly to The Timess live tally of the House vote on the American Health Care Act. No backup, no editing, no second source.

title: A Hotel for Every Traveler, Sometimes Several Under One Roof
description: The name Marriott has come to mean many types of lodgings  a full-service hotel in a big city, basic low-cost hotels with free Wi-Fi that are aimed at the business traveler, a newly renovated beach resort. Through acquisitions of other hotel companies, including Starwood Hotels & Resorts last year, and introductions of its own new hotel groups, Marriott International now manages 30 brands under its corporate umbrella.

title: Watchdog Group Sues Trump Administration, Seeking Legal Rationale Behind Syria Strike
description: WASHINGTON  A month after President Trump ordered a military strike on the Syrian regime as punishment for using chemical weapons, his administration has yet to offer a rationale for what lawful authority he had to carry out the attack.

description: TEHRAN  Angry miners grieving the deaths of dozens of co-workers trapped after an explosion blocked the convoy of President Hassan Rouhani over the weekend, an extraordinary display of public anger two weeks before presidential elections.

title: Satanic Temple Sponsors a Veterans Memorial in a Minnesota Town
description: The Veterans Memorial Park in Belle Plaine, Minn., includes a walkway with rows of American flags on either side, a UH-1 Huey helicopter and a granite monument with the engraved names of residents who died in the Indian War of 1862, the Civil War, World Wars I and II, and the Korean and Vietnam Wars.

title: Blocked by China, Taiwan Presses to Join U.N. Agencys Meeting
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  Taiwan will continue to seek inclusion in the World Health Assemblys annual meeting this month in Geneva, government officials said on Monday, pushing back against the latest in a series of efforts by China to block the self-ruled island from participating in international organizations.

description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art announced Monday that it is organizing the largest exhibition of Michelangelo works in its history, opening in November.

description: LONDON  The three-story mural showing a workman chipping away at one of the 12 stars of the European Union flag appeared mysteriously in Dover, England, over the weekend, at once banal and symbolically poignant.

description: The salt equation taught to doctors for more than 200 years is not hard to understand.

title: A Global Trump Movement? France Election Signals No

But instead of being joined by like-minded counterparts across the Atlantic, Mr. Trump finds himself facing a European leadership that has repudiated his fiery brand of politics.

description: BEIJING  Before the Chinese human rights lawyer stood trial for subversion, he wrote a letter saying he would confess to such charges only if he was tortured.

title: Prosecutors Explore Options With Uber
description: There was a time when privately held companies largely avoided scrutiny by the government because they were usually small-scale operations. The explosion of Silicon Valley unicorns worth billions of dollars has changed that dynamic by bringing much greater attention from prosecutors and regulators, as Uber and Theranos have learned.

title: Mark Rylance to Return to Broadway in Farinelli and the King
description: Mark Rylance is returning to Broadway. This December, that three-time Tony Award winner will star in Farinelli and the King, in his first Broadway appearance since he won an Oscar for Steven Spielbergs Bridge of Spies last year.

title: Yes, Numbers Matter in Money Decisions, but So Do Emotions

description: The MTV Movie and TV Awards took place Sunday in Los Angeles. Here are some of the nights most striking looks.

title: Review: He Can Cook, Too, So Why Not Marry Harry?
description: At first, the musical Marry Harry seems to be about name-dropping. Theres even an entire song dedicated to Lidia Bastianich, the celebrity chef. It made me long for the Ed Sullivan number from Bye Bye Birdie.

title: Coach Acquires Kate Spade, but Overpays
description: Coach is paying luxury prices to catch up with the Europeans.

title: The Frightful Five Arent So Scary, as Long as Theyre Competing
description: There is a growing drumbeat that the five leading tech behemoths have turned into dangerous monopolies that stifle innovation and harm consumers. Apple, Alphabet, Microsoft, Amazon and Facebook  what the tech columnist Farhad Manjoo calls the Frightful Five  have a combined market capitalization of more than $2.7 trillion and are an increasing part of everyday life.

title: Heinz Kessler, Who Led East Germanys Military, Dies at 97
description: BERLIN  Heinz Kessler, a former head of East Germanys armed forces and a die-hard Communist to the last, died on May 2 in eastern Berlin. He was 97.

title: Tundra May Be Shifting Alaska to Put Out More Carbon Than It Stores, Study Says
description: As global warming continues, a big unknown is what will happen to the carbon balance between the atmosphere and the land, especially in the far north. Will Arctic and near-Arctic regions continue to take more carbon dioxide from the atmosphere through plant activity than they release, or will they release more than they store?

title: James Patterson and Bill Clinton Team Up to Write a Novel
description: As one of the countrys most prolific authors, James Patterson has maintained a constant presence on the best-seller list in part by relying on a stable of lesser known co-authors.

title: They Voted to Repeal Obamacare. Now They Are a Target.
description: For months, protesters have been rallying outside Senator Cory Gardners offices in Colorado, urging him not to join fellow Republicans in their push to repeal the Affordable Care Act. When he refused to hold town hall meetings, protesters staged them in his absence, asking questions to a cardboard cutout of him.

title: Duterte Ally Denies Extrajudicial Killings, Calling Figures Alternative Facts
description: GENEVA  Reports of thousands of people killed by the police in the Philippine governments crackdown on drug use are alternative facts, a Filipino senator and ally of President Rodrigo Duterte said on Monday, brushing off accusations of extrajudicial killings as a way to discredit Mr. Duterte.

title: Montreal Flooding Displaces Thousands
description: Flooding across Quebec inundated Montreal and surrounding areas on Sunday and Monday, driving thousands of people out of their homes and washing away at least two people, who remain missing.

title: Forget Taxes, Warren Buffett Says. The Real Problem Is Health Care.
description: OMAHA  The tax system is not crippling our business around the world.

title: Pepe the Frog Is Dead, or So His Creator Hopes
description: After a brief and tumultuous life, Pepe the Frog is dead.

title: Tiffany Trump Will Attend Georgetown Law
description: WASHINGTON  Another Trump is on her way to the capital.

title: Blade Runner 2049 Trailer: The Gorgeous New Spot Has More Questions Than Answers
description: Your story isnt over yet. Theres still a page left.

title: Sinclair Pays a Rich Premium to Challenge Fox
description: Sinclair Broadcast Groups $3.9 billion deal for Tribune Media is putting Fox in a hole.

title: Emmanuel Macron, Afghanistan, South Korea: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Syria Rejects U.N. Monitoring Role in De-Escalation Zones
description: The Syrian government said on Monday that the de-escalation zones negotiated by Russia, Iran and Turkey, which took effect this weekend, could not be monitored by others, including the United Nations.

title: Brand to Know: The Mens Wear Line Made Out of a High Schoolers Room
description: In the course of a single hour, Taofeek Abijako describes 23 different things as insane. The list includes the feeling of graduating high school last spring, a really good summer  and the emergence of his fashion collection without a big budget or any formal training. Hes right: The past year has brought the 18-year-old Nigerian fashion designer a series of successes that do seem, well, unbelievable. Hes gone from doodling designs in the margins of his notebooks to showing his collection at the Capsule trade show in Manhattan and selling in stores internationally.

title: Review: Could a Long-Gone Antarctic Explorer Be Mr. Right?
description: Roald Amundsen? Not exactly a babe. Robert Falcon Scott? Bedroom eyes, yes, but he ate his own ponies. Robert E. Peary suffered from an excess of mustache. And can you really picture yourself canoodling with James Clark Rosss mutton chops?

title: Capturing the Aftermath of a Star Collision 1,900 Years Ago
description: About 1,900 years ago and 1,350 light years away, stars in a giant gas cloud behind the Orion constellation collided, ejecting two other young stars.

title: An American View of the French Vote
description: To the Editor:

title: Former Dewey & LeBoeuf Executive Convicted in Split Verdict
description: Nearly five years after the collapse of Dewey & LeBoeuf, and roughly 20 months after a mistrial in an earlier criminal proceeding, prosecutors got a split decision on Monday in an accounting fraud case against two former executives of the once-mighty New York law firm.

title: Heng on Revising Japans Pacifist Constitution
description: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan last week proposed revising the countrys pacifist Constitution that has been in place since 1947. Japan has faced escalating security threats from North Korea, and Mr. Abe said he wants to make explicit the status of Japans self-defense forces and amend the Constitution by 2020.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio Impersonators and a $40,000 Radio at Frieze
description: Two men stand inside the Gavin Browns Enterprise booth at the sixth edition of the mammoth Frieze New York art fair on Randalls Island. The walls are hung with Instagram-worthy canvases by the Swedish artist Karl Holmqvist. Written on each is a jaunty phrase like Hug a Hippie, Theyre All That! Or Hug a Hustler, Hell Like It and Hug a Hooker You Know!

title: Help Him Up!: A Witnesss Account of Panic on a Subway Platform
description: The man stood bent at the waist, but sideways, as if he were doing some kind of deep stretching. He was incoherent and filthy, his pants around his ankles, but boxer shorts intact. Asleep on his feet with his head buried in his puffy coat, he leaned with an arm outstretched against a metal pillar.

title: Review: Opera Matters, and the Met Just Threw a Party to Prove It
description: Every once in a while, an institution gets a chance to hit a reset button. In the midst of myriad challenges  struggling attendance, changing entertainment habits, donor fatigue, looming labor negotiations  thats what the Metropolitan Opera did on Sunday evening.

title: Chelsea Moves to Verge of Premier League Title
description: LONDON  Chelsea will be crowned Premier League champions for the second time in three years by the end of the week, provided the Blues  English soccers runaway leader  can beat West Bromwich Albion on Friday.

title: In Dennis Lehanes Since We Fell, a Troubled Woman Seeks Answers
description: SINCE WE FELLBy Dennis Lehane418 pages. Ecco. $27.99.

title: Review: Debussys Pellas, but This Time All Boxed In
description: CLEVELAND  How beautiful it is in the shadows, Pellas sings in the climactic fourth act of Debussys Pellas et Mlisande. How beautiful, indeed, for the lovers in the operas title, as well as for lovers of Debussys score: murky, wispy and allusive, yet somehow also touching, penetrating and direct. The opera takes its unearthly power from metaphors of blindness, from the Symbolist taste for leaving things half-said, for making things only half-clear. No wonder that productions of it so often feel half-baked.

title: Maple, the New York Start-Up, Has Delivered Its Last Meal
description: Maple, the New York City service that has been delivering restaurant-quality food made in its own kitchen, has ceased operations after a little more than two years in business.

title: Emmanuel Macron, Republicans, Michael Flynn: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: An Everyman Museum to Celebrate American Writers
description: CHICAGO  Enter the new American Writers Museum, which opens here on May 16, and you find yourself standing under a canopy of dead trees, in the form of a rippling, color-coordinated cloud of books bolted to the ceiling.

title: Tunnels Arent the Only Vision for New Jersey Transit in the Governors Race
description: Philip D. Murphy, a Democratic candidate for governor of New Jersey, stood in front of the Trenton train station, with a New Jersey Transit train that had been delayed 30 minutes behind him, and offered a starkly candid assessment: The state has a transportation crisis, and a new tax might be the only way to tackle it.

title: Man Whose Boat Mangled an 8-Year-Old Is Convicted of Manslaughter
description: QUEENSBURY, N.Y.  After deliberating for 12 hours over two days, a jury on Monday convicted a local man of manslaughter in a horrific boat crash on Lake George in July that killed an 8-year-old girl visiting from California as she slept in her mothers lap.

title: How the New York Times Express Team Covers Its Digital Beat
description: When initial reports of a gunman at North Lake College in Texas began coming in last Wednesday, Christine Hauser put down the story she had been working on, started a new article file, and began writing, just in case. You dont want to be caught with a blank screen, she said, at the time you need the story most.

title: Correction Chief Says Ex-Officials Advised Him on Maine Trips. Never, They Say.
description: Who told New York Citys embattled Correction Department commissioner that he was allowed to use his city-issued vehicle for extended trips to his home on the coast of Maine?

title: Rangers Fight Best When Put in a Corner
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The Rangers have squandered three late leads during this years N.H.L. playoffs, including two in their current series against the Ottawa Senators.

title: Bus Pass
description: Dear Diary:

title: Trump Walks Back Threat to Defund Black Colleges
description: WASHINGTON  When President Trump signed a $1.1 trillion spending bill on Friday, he zeroed in on a tiny sliver of it, suggesting that he might disregard $20 million in funding for loan subsidies and other aid to historically black universities.

title: President Buharis Prolonged Absences Put Nigeria on Edge
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Nigerias ailing president, Muhammadu Buhari, had been seen in public so rarely that some Nigerians were convinced he was dead. Some of his supporters have called on him to step down, at least until his health improves.

title: Edwin Sherin, Theater and Law & Order Director, Dies at 87
description: Edwin Sherin, who directed James Earl Jones on Broadway in The Great White Hope and enjoyed a successful career in television, most notably as a director and executive producer of Law & Order, died on Thursday at his home in Lockeport, Nova Scotia, Canada. He was 87.

title: Updated N.Y.P.D. Anti-Crime System to Ask: How We Doing?
description: It was a policing invention with a futuristic sounding name  CompStat  when the New York Police Department introduced it as a management system for fighting crime in an era of much higher violence in the 1990s. Police departments around the country, and the world, adapted its system of mapping muggings, robberies and other crimes; measuring police activity; and holding local commanders accountable.

title: Eugenie Bouchard, a Critic of Maria Sharapovas, Defeats Her in Madrid
description: MADRID  Maria Sharapova had no shortage of critics on the WTA Tour during her recent 15-month suspension. But no one has been louder or more forceful than Eugenie Bouchard, who called Sharapova a cheater and criticized the tour for shortening what was originally a two-year suspension.

title: Express Scripts to Offer Cheaper Drugs for Uninsured Customers
description: It is one of the most acute indignities of being uninsured in this country: Those with the least ability to pay are asked to spend the most for their prescription drugs.

title: Twin Peaks Season 2, Episodes 2-7: There Will Be Bob
description: In the run-up to the new season of Twin Peaks, Noel Murray is helping to refresh our memory with a series of recaps covering the first two seasons. (Its only been 26 years!) The new season debuts on May 21 on Showtime.

title: Giants Battling Misery and Misfortune in Rough Season
description: The bus carrying the players with the worst record in the National League caught fire on Sunday. Yes, this really happened to the San Francisco Giants, on their way from the ballpark in Cincinnati to the airport in Kentucky. It has been that kind of season.

title: Sinclair Unveils Tribune Deal, Raising Worries It Will Be Too Powerful
description: In an era of information saturation, when cable news seems ubiquitous and Twitter posts stream forth uninterrupted, local television still holds a powerful grip on the American consciousness. And the Sinclair Broadcast Group just tightened its grasp.

title: The Yankees Won a 6-Hour Marathon. Then the Real Race Began.
description: CINCINNATI  When Kyle Hendricks swung through Chasen Shreves split-finger fastball in the dirt at 1:13 a.m. Central on Monday, the Yankees were relieved to have survived the 18 innings and 6 hours 5 minutes that were required for a 5-4 victory over the Chicago Cubs.

title: The Kushners and Their Golden Visas
description: The Kushner family has been caught in a shameless act of name-dropping. It has been highlighting its White House connections to entice wealthy Chinese investors and promising them green cards in return under a special government visa program. Thats pretty bad. But its also a scandal that Congress allows real estate developers to use the American immigration system to pad their profits.

title: Prosecutors Taking Tougher Stance in Fraternity Hazing Deaths
description: After downing a dangerous amount of alcohol and suffering severe internal injuries during a fraternity hazing, a 19-year-old college sophomore died. Not long ago, the story might have ended there, except for some hand-wringing and litigation.

title: Sally Yates Tells Senators She Warned Trump About Michael Flynn
description: WASHINGTON  Less than a week into the Trump administration, Sally Q. Yates, the acting attorney general, hurried to the White House with an urgent concern. The presidents national security adviser, she said, had lied to the vice president about his Russian contacts and was vulnerable to blackmail by Moscow.

title: Man Arrested in 9 Serial Street Shooter Killings in Phoenix
description: It was a crime spree that killed nine people, stumped the police for months and left residents of Phoenix unnerved.

title: Kushner Family Stands to Gain From Visa Rules in Trumps First Major Law
description: WASHINGTON  It was the first major piece of legislation that President Trump signed into law, and buried on Page 734 was one sentence that brought a potential benefit to the presidents extended family: renewal of a program offering permanent residence in the United States to affluent foreigners investing money in real estate projects here.

title: Filled With Tiny Bubbles
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Some time ago, Peter A. Collins was able to dream a theme. Thats not my best writing, but it does fit the pattern in Mr. Collinss grid.

title: Corrections: May 9, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Terry Collins Supports Matt Harveys Suspension: We Had to Do Something
description: Here is the state of relations between the Mets and their onetime ace: On Saturday evening, the team sent two security officials to check on Matt Harvey, a beleaguered right-hander, after he failed to report for work that afternoon at Citi Field. According to the team spokesman Jay Horwitz, the visit was out of concern for Harveys welfare.

title: Quotation of the Day: White House Knew Flynn Lied, Ex-Official Testifies
description: To state the obvious: You dont want your national security adviser compromised with the Russians.

title: Trump Advisers Call for More Troops to Break Afghan Deadlock
description: WASHINGTON  Senior Trump administration and military officials are recommending sending several thousand additional American troops to Afghanistan to try to break a military deadlock in the 15-year war there, in part by pressuring the Taliban to negotiate with the Afghan government.

title: Better Call Saul Season 3, Episode 5: The Long Con
description: Ladies and gentlemen, a big round of applause for Mr. Huell Babineaux. Greet your public, Huell (played with deadpan, adenoidal perfection by Lavell Crawford). You will remember this singular gent as Saul Goodmans imposing, bullet-headed bodyguard in Breaking Bad, a guy as big as a mountain but with hands deft enough for a career as a wallet snatcher. He returned in Chicanery, as this episode is called, to provide the trick that we all knew Jimmy McGill had up his sleeve for the disbarment hearing.

title: Richard Simmons Says Tabloids Defamed Him by Saying He Had a Sex Change
description: Richard Simmons, the celebrity health and fitness guru, sued two tabloid publications on Monday, saying they defamed him by publishing stories claiming that he had had a sex change.

title: Well-Rested Masahiro Tanaka Buoys Sleep-Deprived Yankees
description: CINCINNATI  One pick-me-up for the groggy, sleep-deprived Yankees when they rolled into Great American Ballpark on Monday was the coffee dispenser in the visitors clubhouse. The other was pitcher Masahiro Tanaka.

title: Emmanuel Macron, Michael Flynn, Syria: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Mets Top Giants in Ninth Inning After Effective Start by Jacob deGrom
description: If the Mets were looking for excuses for poor play on Monday night, there was no shortage of them at their fingertips.

title: Warrant Details How Officers Fatal Encounter With Texas Teenager Escalated
description: New details in the fatal shooting last week of a black Texas teenager offer fresh insight into how the encounter unfolded and escalated, culminating with a police officer firing at a car full of teenagers.

title: South Koreas Election: What We Know So Far
description: Here is what we know about the election in South Korea, where voters were choosing a successor to former President Park Geun-hye, forced from office in a corruption scandal. Polls closed at 8 p.m. Tuesday local time (7 a.m. Eastern time).

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: The Moorside and Valkyrien
description: Two new critically acclaimed foreign series  The Moorside, from Britain, and Valkyrien, from Norway  arrive for streaming in the United States. And Brooklyn Nine-Nine parties down.

title: Christian Governor in Indonesia Found Guilty of Blasphemy Against Islam
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  An Indonesian court found the Christian governor of the countrys capital, Jakarta, guilty of blasphemy against Islam on Tuesday, sentencing him to two years in prison in a case widely seen as a test of religious tolerance and free speech.

title: Word + Quiz: hirsute
In Atltico Madrids Ramshackle Home, an Underdogs Spirit Thrived
description: MADRID  On a warm spring day outside Estadio Vicente Caldern, home of Atltico Madrid, a couple of workmen in fluorescent yellow vests are attending to a large steel door. One has the easier job, languorously holding the door in place as his colleague strains to tighten a dozen studded bolts in turn. After a few minutes of grunting and heaving, the two men swing it open and shut, open and shut, to test that it is firmly fastened.

title: Fidget Spinners
description: Has the fidget-spinner fad come to your school? Are you a fan? Why or why not?

title: Right and Left React to Frances Election
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: Hiroshi Sugimoto: Illuminating Opera Houses and Abandoned Movie Palaces
description: Hiroshi Sugimoto is continuing his surreal Theater series, a meditation on the nature of time that captures the splendor of cinema and the majestic opulence of Italian opera houses.

title: Johnson, Westmoreland and the Selling of Vietnam
description: By early 1967, American and allied forces appeared stuck in the morass of Vietnam. Publicly, military commanders talked about progress; off the record, Army officers told journalists that they werent anywhere near the mopping up stage. Moreover, the press increasingly noted Lyndon B. Johnsons own frustrations. One report even suggested that the president was tormented by the slow progress of the war effort.

title: The Business Case for the Paris Climate Accord
description: President Trump faces a choice that will echo across his presidency and beyond: whether to remain in the Paris climate agreement. Although most Americans, his own secretaries of state and energy, and heads of state from around the globe are urging the president to stay, he remains undecided. Let us hope that a newly invigorated pro-Paris campaign by many of Americas top C.E.O.s will sway him.

title: The Problem With Linking Abortion and Economics
description: IN recent days, Senator Bernie Sanders has come under fire for appearing at a campaign stop with Heath Mello, a mayoral candidate in Omaha who voted for anti-abortion legislation as a Nebraska state senator. Mr. Sanders said he supported Mr. Mellos progressive economic positions, but critics said abortion and economics were inextricable  that women on the margins need abortion so that they can scramble up the economic ladder without children holding them back.

title: Monuments of White Supremacy
description: The Confederate-flag-waving white supremacist who murdered nine African-Americans in a Charleston, S.C., church two years ago made it impossible to evade the fact that the banner  and Confederate ideology generally  had been a rallying point for white supremacy and racial terrorism for more than 100 years.

title: A French Lesson for the American Media
description: The hacked emails from Emmanuel Macrons French campaign appear to be spectacularly mundane, according to people who have read them. They include briefings on issues, personal exchanges and discussions of the weather. No doubt they also include some embarrassing thoughts, but so far they are notably lacking in scandal.

title: In Kenya, Phones Replace Bank Tellers
description: Pauline Kimari is a pharmacist in Ndaragwa, Kenya, a small town several hours drive north of Nairobi. She moved there from rural Muranga, several hours away, to open a small shop, Ndaragwa Joy Chemist. It is white with blue and green doors and a blue bench inside. She sells medicine and cosmetics.

title: Hiroshi Sugimoto: Illuminating Opera Houses and Abandoned Movie Palaces
description: Growing up in 1950s Tokyo, Hiroshi Sugomoto sometimes was brought to tears by the movies he saw with his mother. He still remembers feeling ashamed by those public displays of emotion. Above all, he remembers the emotional connection he felt being inside the theaters.

title: Questions for: Americas Tap Water: Too Much Contamination, Not Enough Reporting, Study Finds
description: Article: Americas Tap Water: Too Much Contamination, Not Enough Reporting, Study Finds

title: G.O.P. Bill Could Affect Employer Health Coverage, Too
description: If it becomes law, the American Health Care Act will have the biggest effects on people who buy their own insurance or get coverage through Medicaid. But it also means changes for the far larger employer health system.

title: Are You the Same Person on Social Media as You Are in Real Life?
description: Do you ever suspect people are posting images on social media that show them in a one-dimensional way, to make others think they are perfect, with a perfect life?

title: The Intimacy Behind Jazzs Seminal Image
description: Its quite easy to tell the story of how certain photographs were taken, to link whats going on within the frame to the situation or circumstances around it. In the case of Robert Capas gray, sea-drenched images of soldiers struggling to shore on D-Day, we know the precise historical moment they depict, what happened before and after. In other instances, photographs contain an implied narrative that can be expanded and expounded upon. Here all we have are two faces in tight close-up, so slurred and dimly lit that the picture barely succeeds in the most basic task of photographic portraiture: to enable us to identify whom we are looking at. Would you be able to see that this is John Coltrane and Ben Webster without being told? Given the uncertainty, it makes sense to begin by mentioning what the photograph is not.

title: How Privacy Became a Commodity for the Rich and Powerful
description: Recently I handed over the keys to my email account to a service that promised to turn my spam-bloated inbox into a sparkling model of efficiency in just a few clicks. Unroll.mes method of instant unsubscribing from newsletters and junk mail was trusted by millions of happy users, the site said, among them the Scandal actor Joshua Malina, who tweeted in 2014: Your inbox will sing! Plus, it was free. When a privacy policy popped up, I swatted away the legalese and tapped continue.

title: New Sentences: From Nicotine, by Nell Zink
description: What do you love best? Your son, your daughter, your dog, your mother, your work, your country, your planet, your life?

title: How Homeownership Became the Engine of American Inequality
description: The son of a minister, Ohene Asare grew up poor. His family immigrated from Ghana when he was 8 and settled down in West Bridgewater, Mass., a town 30 miles south of Boston, where he was one of the few black students at the local public school. It was us and this Jewish family, Asare remembered. It was a field day. His white classmates bullied him, sometimes using racial slurs. His father transferred Asare when he was 14 to Milton Academy, which awarded Asare a scholarship that covered tuition and board. His parents still had to take out loans worth about $20,000 for his living expenses. But the academy set Asare up for future success. He and his wife, Rgine Jean-Charles, whom he got to know at Milton, are in their late 30s. She is a tenured professor of romance languages and literature at Boston College, and Asare is a founder of Aesara, a consulting and technology company.

title: Vivid Memories of Tule Lake Internment Camp
description: A survivor of a maximum-security Japanese internment camp recalls his experience at Tule Lake in Northern California. See what remains of the camp in this 360 video.

title: Stephen King on Paul Therouxs Portrait of a Truly Horrible Mother
description: MOTHER LAND By Paul Theroux 509 pp. An Eamon Dolan Book/ Houghton Mifflin Harcourt, $28

title: A Chinese Giant Is on a Global Buying Spree. Whos Behind It?
description: During his first state visit to Britain, President Xi Jinping of China heralded the great economic opportunities between the two countries, in energy, infrastructure and finance. He finished off the late 2015 trip at Manchester Airport, unveiling a new direct flight to Beijing on the Chinese carrier Hainan Airlines.

title: Misty Copeland, a Ballerina With Real Acting Chops
description: Misty Copeland isnt one of those principals who step onstage a few times a season. She dances. A lot.

title: New Veterans Affairs Chief: A Hands-On, Risk-Taking Standout
description: WASHINGTON  A gray-haired Vietnam veteran sat rustling on the paper of an examining table at the small veterans clinic in Grants Pass, Ore., on a recent afternoon when his doctor for the day appeared on a screen in front of him, wearing a white lab coat and bulbous headphones.

title: The Bloomsbury Bohemians in the British Countryside
description: In the early decades of the 20th century, Virginia Woolf and her friends, the artists, intellectuals and writers known as the Bloomsbury Group, left London and went  to work, to spend summers, to wait out the German bombing raids and to conduct their tangled romances  into the bucolic countryside of Sussex and Kent, now two hours by car southeast of the city. Quite a few of these brilliant bohemians were avid gardeners, and in the spring, when this gorgeous region bursts into flower, one can visit the houses they decorated, the gardens they planted and the homes of the artists and celebrated horticulturists who lived nearby, with whom they exchanged ideas about art and landscape design.

title: Jimmy Kimmel Responds to Critics Over Health Care
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: The South Korean Election, in Pictures
description: Voters in South Korea elected Moon Jae-in on Tuesday, turning out in large numbers to pick a new president after the ouster in March of Park Geun-hye, who was forced from office in a corruption scandal.

title: Michael Flynn, Afghanistan, Jimmy Kimmel: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)
