title: The Not-Quite-Royal Wedding: A Guide to Pippa Middletons Big Day
description: LONDON  This Saturday, the closest thing to a British royal wedding for 2017 (unless, of course, Prince Harry suddenly pops the question to his new girlfriend) will take place in Berkshire, England, when Pippa Middleton  younger sister of the Duchess of Cambridge, Britains future queen  marries James Matthews.

title: Pig Bleecker
description: The chef Matt Abdoo cooks regional favorites in Greenwich Village.

title: Pork Is Only the Starting Point at Pig Bleecker
description: Pig Bleecker takes the second half of its name from its Greenwich Village address and the first from Pig Beach, a beer garden and barbecue stand on the idyllic shores of the Gowanus Canal in Brooklyn. The two places share a chef, several owners, some sauces and recipes, and a fondness for wood smoke. They have pigs in their names for a reason, but one appealing thing about Pig Bleecker is how often it gravitates toward cooking that has nothing to do with barbecued pork.

title: Stifling Debate on Catalonia
description: To the Editor:

title: Only Two Goals in Two Games, but Penguins Say the Chances Are There
description: PITTSBURGH  On three occasions through the first two rounds of the N.H.L. playoffs, the Pittsburgh Penguins produced two goals in less than a minute.

title: Israel Said to Be Source of Secret Intelligence Trump Gave to Russians
description: WASHINGTON  The classified intelligence that President Trump disclosed in a meeting last week with Russian officials at the White House was provided by Israel, according to a current and a former American official familiar with how the United States obtained the information. The revelation adds a potential diplomatic complication to an episode that has renewed questions about how the White House handles sensitive intelligence.

title: Twin Peaks Is Back. Heres How to Catch Up.
description: Read on to learn how to get yourself up to speed on the surreal series, based on how many episodes you want to watch.

title: Maria Sharapova Is Denied a Wild-Card Spot in the French Open
description: The five-time major tournament winner Maria Sharapova will not be granted a wild-card entry into the French Open, the president of the French Tennis Federation, Bernard Giudicelli, announced Tuesday.

title: Trove of Forgotten Steichen Photos Heads for Auction
description: A basement in Newton, Mass., has yielded a trove of forgotten photos and blueprints by the photographer Edward Steichen and the Art Deco architect Eugene Schoen that were used to plan a worlds fair pavilion that promoted engineering marvels and natural wonders across New York state.

title: Kellyanne Conway Denies Morning Joe Claims of Secret Disloyalty to Trump
description: Kellyanne Conway on Tuesday denied claims by the hosts of MSNBCs Morning Joe that she had complained extensively about President Trump in private conversations with them before he was elected.

title: Why the Netflix-Cannes Clash Couldnt Be Avoided
description: CANNES, France  France is a paradise for moviegoers, with thriving cinemas and state subsidies for new productions. Netflix is a global streaming giant founded on the concept that movie theaters are a thing of the past. So it was perhaps inevitable that the two worlds would collide over the Cannes Film Festival, which begins here on Wednesday.

title: Ian Brady, Unrepentant Killer of British Children, Dies at 79
description: LONDON  Ian Brady, whose murders of five children in the company of his lover horrified Britons and were viewed by generations as the distillate of evil, died on Monday night at a high-security psychiatric hospital in Liverpool, England. He was 79.

title: On Succession, ValueAct Hedge Fund Practices What It Preaches
description: Jeffrey W. Ubben has long been a different kind of activist investor. Mr. Ubben, a founder of ValueAct Capital, largely avoids the limelight and mostly works with companies behind the scenes to improve performance, often focusing heavily on corporate governance.

title: At a Besieged White House, Tempers Flare and Confusion Swirls
description: WASHINGTON  The bad-news stories slammed into the White House in pitiless succession on Tuesday, leaving President Trumps battle-scarred West Wing aides staring at their flat screens in glassy-eyed shock.

title: From Horses to Whiskey
description: Kevin Plank, Under Armours founder and chief executive, has drawn inspiration from Sagamore Farm, spreading its colors across Baltimores harbor.

title: Remaking Baltimores Waterfront, With a Splash of Whiskey
description: BALTIMORE  Rising high above the new Sagamore Spirit distillery in South Baltimore is a white water tower with three maroon diamonds on each side, a nod to the jockey silks of the thoroughbred farm that provides the spring water for the companys rye whiskey.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
A Canadian Town Wanted a Transit System. It Hired Uber.
description: Uber, the global car-hailing service, has fought its way into resistant cities around the world, despite being hit by raw eggs and rush-hour roadblocks in Montreal and Toronto, fires in Paris and smashed windshields in Mexico City.

title: Designated Survivor Pivots From Thriller to Political Mirror
description: My daughter and her friends call them 24 and Weird 24. But, she says, theyre not sure which is which.

title: U.K.s Labour Party Pledges Broad Tax Increases to Pay for New Benefits
description: LONDON  Its election manifesto already leaked, Britains opposition Labour Party sought on Tuesday to explain how its pledges would be financed and in the process slew another sacred cow of the partys recent, centrist past: low taxes for the moderately wealthy, as well as for the rich.

title: Modern Mexican Cuisine
description: A new generation of chefs has remixed the flavors of Mexico in high-end restaurants around the world.

title: Modern Mexican Steps Into the Spotlight
description: TULUM, Mexico  Rosio Snchez, a Mexican-American chef who lives in Copenhagen, makes the best tortillas in Scandinavia.

title: Focus Turns to North Korea Sleeper Cells as Possible Culprits in Cyberattack
description: SEOUL, South Korea  They take legitimate jobs as software programmers in the neighbors of their home country, North Korea. When the instructions from Pyongyang come for a hacking assault, they are believed to split into groups of three or six, moving around to avoid detection.

title: Kitchen 21, Housing Several Restaurants, Opens in Brooklyn
description: KITCHEN 21 The fanciful arched Spanish revival building next to Ford Amphitheater on the boardwalk in Coney Island, once home to a Childs restaurant and now a city landmark, will serve summertime fare in a number of settings. Filling the sprawling space, anchored by a wood-burning oven, will be: Coney Island Caf, selling made-to-order takeout items; Community Clam Bar, offering seafood and beer; the 32-seat Parachute Bar, serving craft beer, wines by the glass and pub fare; Boardwalk & Vine, a rooftop wine bar; and Test Kitchen, a somewhat more formal restaurant with food by Joseph Raiola and guest chefs. The entire project, called Kitchen 21, is the work of Legends Hospitality, which is responsible for the food program at Yankee Stadium, and Craveable Hospitality Group, which runs restaurants, including David Burke Kitchen. (Opens Sunday): 3052 West 21st Street, Coney Island, Brooklyn, 718-954-9801, kitchen-21.com.

title: A Remote Pacific Island Awash in Tons of Trash
description: Henderson Island ought to be one of the most pristine places on earth: an uninhabited South Pacific atoll so remote that the nearest human settlement is the small island 120 miles away where the Bounty mutineers hid out.

title: Undue Burden
description: When actually getting an abortion is even harder than the decision to have one.

title: Shelby Shellz Suzie Q Felton, the Lady Professor of Flexing
description: Shelby Shellz Suzie Q Felton is a rarity in the flex world: a woman. However, as her name implies, shes not just one woman, but three, wrapped into a single, articulate body. There is the day-to-day Shelby, who is quiet but given to quick humor. Then theres Shellz, who is very smooth, very relaxed, Ms. Felton said.

title: Undue Burden: Trying to Get an Abortion in Louisiana
description: When I set out to make this film in late 2015, the battle over restricting access to abortions in Texas was a national news story. Coverage featured graphs charting the hours women had to drive to find an abortion clinic in the state and maps tracing their paths. Experts weighed in on both sides of a gaping moral divide  politicians made pleas, doctors wrote op-eds. But amid the debate I felt a critical perspective was missing  that of the women across the country who were actually experiencing the effects of these laws.

title: Donald Trump and the Spilled Secrets
description: To the Editor:

title: Cyberattack, Russia, North Korea: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Why White House Press Briefings Must Continue
description: To the Editor:

title: Would You Give a Stranger an Opioid Antidote?
description: To the Editor:

title: Free Advice to Trump Aides: Quit While You Can
description: On Monday night, Lt. Gen. H. R. McMaster, President Trumps widely admired national security adviser, held a hastily convened news conference to try to knock down reports that Mr. Trump had shared highly classified information with Russia  only to have Mr. Trump appear to confirm the reports in two Tuesday morning tweets.

title: John Cornyn Takes Himself Out of Running to Lead the F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON  Senator John Cornyn, Republican of Texas, lacking support from Senate Democrats and possibly several Republicans, on Tuesday took himself out of consideration to be the next director of the F.B.I.

title: Scott Turows New Thriller Investigates a Massacre in Bosnia
description: TESTIMONYBy Scott Turow 485 pp. Grand Central Publishing. $28.

title: Did Donald Trump Violate His Oath of Office?
description: WASHINGTON  In what is perhaps the gravest accusation of presidential misconduct in a scandal-ridden four months, news outlets have reported that President Trump disclosed highly classified information to Russian government officials during their visit to the Oval Office last week. These are among the most serious charges ever made against a sitting president, though there is much we do not yet know. As additional information emerges, there are important points to keep in mind.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were Reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: Q&A with the Frugal Traveler on Summer Savings
description: Looking to save on summer travel? Our Frugal Traveler columnist answered your questions on airfares, lodging, food and more.

title: Tituss Burgess: The First Time I Had to Parent My Mom
description: My mother was a single parent for much of my youth. She worked during the day, and so when I was about 5 to 12 years old I would spend the summer at my grandparents home in Georgia, with my mom bringing me back to Athens on the weekends. In my early years, I protested. You see, their home was large. I truly thought something would come and steal me in the night and that no one would hear my cry for help. The house sat on a farm off Highway 78, surrounded by trees and animals. Oh, the noises I would hear! If a small branch so much as dropped on the tin roof, I knew that was the end for me. But I learned to love being there as I got older and realized how special this time was with my grandparents.

title: Reviews: Summoning Spirits and Dancing in Latex Body Bags
description: KOMA, THE GHOST FESTIVAL

title: How Puerto Rico Is Grappling With a Debt Crisis
description: Puerto Rico is seeking what is essentially bankruptcy relief. This is whats happening and how the island got here.

title: Video of Teenagers Fatal Shooting May Contradict Initial Police Account
description: Legislators and victims advocates in Connecticut called on Tuesday for changes in how the state investigates police shootings, after a video revealed contradictions between the way a teenager was killed last week and what the police initially reported.

title: New Restaurants Pop Up in East End
description: The paint isnt yet dry, but a number of East End restaurants are ready for the season. More notable chefs and restaurateurs than ever are heading to the area, among them Galen Zamarra of Mas (Farmhouse), Frank DeCarlo of Peasant, Philippe Delgrange of Le Bilboquet, James Mallios of Amali and the company run by the celebrity chef Todd English. Some East End stalwarts like Wlffer Kitchen of Sag Harbor are expanding with branches in other villages.

title: Comey Memo Says Trump Asked Him to End Flynn Investigation
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump asked the F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, to shut down the federal investigation into Mr. Trumps former national security adviser, Michael T. Flynn, in an Oval Office meeting in February, according to a memo Mr. Comey wrote shortly after the meeting.

title: Woman Is Caught Trying to Scale White House Fence, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  A woman outside the White House jumped a protective bike rack and tried to scale the fence surrounding the secure grounds on Tuesday, prompting the Secret Service to clear the North Lawn.

title: Shake It Up Aims to Put Rock Writing in the Pantheon
description: SHAKE IT UPGreat American Writing on Rock and Pop From Elvis to Jay ZEdited by Jonathan Lethem and Kevin Dettmar601 pages. Library of America. $40.

title: Review: Jazzmeia Horn, a Jazz Vocalist on the Rise, Steps Up to the Microphone at Dizzys
description: The vocalist Jazzmeia Horn began her first set at Dizzys Club Coca-Cola on Monday night with Tight, a quick-stepping jazz standard that was a signature of Betty Carters repertoire. Ms. Carter is a big influence on Ms. Horn, who delivered the tune with the same playful persuasion as her forebear.

title: Babies From Skin Cells? Prospect Is Unsettling to Some Experts
description: Nearly 40 years after the world was jolted by the birth of the first test-tube baby, a new revolution in reproductive technology is on the horizon  and it promises to be far more controversial than in vitro fertilization ever was.

title: Vulnerable Voices Lash Out as Companies Sway Climate Talks
description: Developing nations and environmental groups are challenging some of the worlds biggest companies and wealthiest countries over the role corporate lobbyists play in United Nations climate change negotiations.

title: Trump Met Erdogan. Heres What Happened.
description: President Trump met with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey at the White House on Tuesday. Here are a few lines from the pool report.

title: Donald Trump, Israel, Erdogan: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Port Authority Wage Campaign Shifts as Union Takes Fight to Albany
description: Month after month, dozens of airport workers have rallied to pressure the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey for better pay, training and health benefits. Outfitted in matching T-shirts, they have demanded a minimum wage of at least $15 an hour  to no avail.

title: Big Changes Planned for Volksbhne Theater in Berlin
description: Chris Dercon, the new artistic director of the Volksbhne, a theater in Berlin, announced the 2017-18 season on Tuesday, the first under his leadership, and delivered on his promise to overhaul the theaters programming.

title: Trump May Have Shifted U.S. Intelligence Policy on Russia. Or Maybe Not.
description: MOSCOW  President Trumps acknowledgment that he shared intelligence on terrorism with Russia was something of a coup for President Vladimir V. Putin, whose mantra about forging a global alliance to fight violent extremists never gained much traction in the West.

title: Chelsea Manning Leaves Prison, Closing an Extraordinary Leak Case
description: WASHINGTON  Chelsea Manning walked freely out of the military prison at Fort Leavenworth, Kan., on Wednesday, bringing to a close one of the most extraordinary criminal cases in American history over the leaking of government secrets to the public.

title: Who Gets to Pay $57.4 Million? Inside Art Auction Bidding Wars
description: Its one thing to cover cultural institutions, which Ive done for nearly 20 years. Its another thing to cover the art world  in particular, the annual spring and fall auctions  which I added to my beat about two years ago.

title: A Times Exclusive: Trump, Comey and the Russia Investigation
description: Michael S. Schmidt, a New York Times reporter, explains new revelations from a memo written by James B. Comey, the fired F.B.I. director. The memo showed that President Trump may have tried to halt the agency's investigation into Michael T. Flynn.

title: Sudan President, Charged With Genocide, Is Invited to Saudi Summit with Trump
description: UNITED NATIONS  Sudans president, indicted by the International Criminal Court for crimes including genocide, has been invited to a summit in Saudi Arabia alongside President Trump, a Sudanese government spokesman said Tuesday.

title: Its Chicken or Fish
description: Since President Trumps firing of F.B.I. Director James Comey, one question has been repeated over and over: With Democrats lacking any real governing power, are there a few good elected men or women in the Republican Party who will stand up to the presidents abuse of power as their predecessors did during Watergate?

title: This Nervous City
description: Dear Diary:

title: Leading TBS and TNT Into the Fray of Great TV
description: Two and a half years ago, the cable channels TBS and TNT were going strong.

title: A Man on Trial in a Drug Shooting in Midtown, and an Actors Role
description: Quran Pender, a Queens native who moved to Los Angeles to pursue acting, ended up being the middleman between a drug ring in California and dealers in New York, arranging the shipment of more than 10 kilograms of drugs over five months, according to prosecutors.

title: The McMaster Press Conference, Decoded
description: President Trump's national security adviser, Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster, took questions about whether President Trump shared classified information with Russian dignitaries in an Oval Office meeting. How did he answer?

title: City Hall Stirs ICE Fears First, Gets Facts Later
description: When word came to City Hall on Thursday, it appeared to confirm the administrations worst fears: federal immigration agents had been to an elementary school in Queens to inquire about a fourth-grade student.

title: Duck Ramps Appear at U.S. Capitol, but Not Everyone Is Pleased
description: Political turmoil rocked the nations capital again on Tuesday evening as politicians from both parties responded to President Trumps  you know what, never mind. This is a story about ducks.

title: Jerry Canterbury, Whose Paralysis Led to Informed Consent Laws, Is Dead at 78
description: None of his neighbors were surprised when the only notice of Jerry Canterburys death was a terse three-paragraph notice published in The Canton Repository, his hometown newspaper in northeastern Ohio, on March 23, fully a week after he died at 78.

title: What Is Obstruction of Justice? An Often Murky Crime, Explained
description: WASHINGTON  Tuesdays report by The New York Times that President Trump asked James B. Comey, then the F.B.I. director, in February to drop the investigation into his former national security adviser, Michael T. Flynn, has fueled accusations that the White House is obstructing justice.

title: ESPN Is Betting on Big Personalities to Restore Its Fortunes
description: Just weeks after ESPN laid off about 100 journalists and on-air commentators, the Worldwide Leader in Sports unveiled a new programming slate on Tuesday filled with big personalities but short on the kind of highlight shows that for many years were the foundation of the network.

title: Can DNA Evidence Be Too Convincing? An Acquitted Man Thinks So
description: It has been about three months since Terrell Gillss release from jail, and there are still sleepless nights and days spent in his room as he contemplates the year and a half he spent on Rikers Island for a crime of which he was acquitted.

title: Seriously? This is Not News: Readers React to Trumps Disclosure of Classified Intelligence
description: President Trump disclosed highly classified intelligence to Russian officials in a meeting last week, a government official said on Monday. The disclosure was not illegal, since presidents have the power to declassify nearly anything, but the sharing of sensitive intelligence provided by Israel, one of the United States most important allies in the Middle East, was disclosed without their permission.

title: Representative Jason Chaffetzs Letter to the F.B.I.
description: In a letter sent to the F.B.I. on Tuesday night, Representative Jason Chaffetz, Republican of Utah and chairman of the House Oversight Committee, demanded all internal memos, notes, recordings or summaries of discussions between Mr. Trump and Mr. Comey.

title: Can Donald Trump Be Trusted With State Secrets?
description: On Monday, Americans learned that President Trump shared with the Russians highly classified intelligence about the United States fight against the Islamic State. Mr. Trump jocularly passed secrets obtained by Israel to Kremlin representatives in a White House meeting last week, blithely endangering Americas relationship with a vital counterterrorism ally and its national security.

title: Malware Case Is Major Blow for the N.S.A.
description: WASHINGTON  Since August, when a mysterious group calling itself the Shadow Brokers announced that it was auctioning off highly classified National Security Agency hacking tools, a low-grade panic has seized the nations largest intelligence agency.

title: Mets, Once in the Pitching Penthouse, Are Evicted Early
description: PHOENIX  Nearly a quarter of the way into the season, the identity of the Mets  the team with all those dynamic, young, hard-throwing pitchers  has been distorted beyond recognition.

title: N.B.A. Draft Lottery: Celtics, Already No. 1 in the East, Add Pick No. 1
description: When the Boston Celtics were announced as the recipient of the No. 1 overall N.B.A. draft pick Tuesday night, the owner Wyc Grousbeck did not celebrate wildly or pump a fist.

title: For Voting Rights Advocates, Court Decision Is Temporary Victory
description: It seemed like an important victory for voting rights advocates on Monday when the Supreme Court declined to reconsider an appellate decision striking down North Carolinas restrictive voting law. But those who follow the arcana of election law have another view  that the justices have merely postponed a showdown over what kind of voting rules are acceptable and how much influence partisanship should have over access to the ballot box.

title: Did Mr. Trump Obstruct Justice?
description: I hope you can let this go.

title: Wounded Troops Discharged for Misconduct Often Had PTSD or T.B.I.
description: Three-fifths of troops discharged from the military for misconduct in recent years had a diagnosis of post-traumatic stress disorder, traumatic brain injury or another associated condition, according to a report released Tuesday by the Government Accountability Office.

title: New York Senator Seeks Inquiry Into Apparent Abuse of Stipends
description: ALBANY  The State Senates top Democratic leader asked law enforcement on Tuesday to investigate how stipends were seemingly improperly awarded to eight senators aligned with that chambers rival, majority coalition.

title: Thomas A. Bolan, Understated Force in New York Law, Dies at 92
description: Thomas A. Bolan, who played the silent partner to the flamboyant Roy M. Cohn in their politically potent law firm for three decades but was a power broker in his own right, died on Friday at his home in Flushing, Queens. He was 92.

title: A New Goal for President Trumps First Foreign Trip: Damage Control
description: WASHINGTON  For months, President Trumps senior advisers had planned his first foreign trip with hopes of investing it with historic grandeur: a tour of the worlds three great monotheistic religions, capped by an address to the Muslim world in Saudi Arabia that will serve as Mr. Trumps answer to the speech former President Barack Obama gave in Cairo in 2009.

title: Amid Eavesdropping Accusations, City Fires Jail Agency Official
description: The New York City Correction Departments top internal affairs official, who was demoted last week amid accusations that he eavesdropped on telephone conversations between city investigators and their jailhouse informers on Rikers Island, was quietly fired this week.

title: The Paintings of Lee Hall
description: Ms. Hall was more than a painter. She also examined the art world in her books.

title: Lee Hall, Artist and de Kooning Biographer, Dies at 82
description: Lee Hall, an abstract landscape painter who served as president of the Rhode Island School of Design in the 1970s and 80s and wrote a hotly contested biography of the painters Elaine and Willem de Kooning, died on April 17 in Northampton, Mass. She was 82.

title: Review: Dont Bother Keeping a Secret With Derren Brown Around
description: The title Derren Brown: Secret, the enthrallingly baffling one-mentalist show that opened on Tuesday at the Atlantic Theater Companys Linda Gross Theater, turns out to have so many meanings that you soon stop counting. The most obvious and manifold secrets are the closely guarded tricks of Mr. Browns trade.

title: The Danger of Overthinking Things
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  When youve solved enough crossword puzzles, you begin to realize that youve been trained to think a certain way, and when Will Shortz and a constructor decide to change things up a bit, it can take you (and by that I mean me) by surprise.

title: Review: For Africans in America, a Temporary Stay Becomes a New Life
description: As seen onstage, the story of the arrival of blacks in America is almost always the story of slavery. Even immigrants who arrive willingly get here in despair, if not in chains, then in steerage. From Eugene ONeill to August Wilson, Fiddler on the Roof to In the Heights, the newcomers drama is usually one of distress and deracination, and, most of all, the impossibility of ever going home.

title: White House Fights a Familiar Enemy: The Press
description: As the White House reeled on Tuesday from a chaotic 24 hours, bookended by a pair of bombshell scoops raising serious questions about President Trumps comportment in the Oval Office, the administration and its surrogates quickly settled on a blunt message: Blame the press.

title: Quotation of the Day: Trump Appealed to Comey to Halt Inquiry Into Aide
description: I hope you can see your way clear to letting this go, to letting Flynn go. He is a good guy.

title: The 25th Amendment Solution for Removing Trump
description: It was just three days and a lifetime ago that I wrote a column about Donald Trumps unfitness for the presidency that affected a world-weary tone. Nothing about this White Houses chaos was surprising given the style of Trumps campaign, I argued. None of the breaking scandals necessarily suggested high crimes as opposed to simple omni-incompetence. And given that Republicans made their peace with Trumps unfitness many months ago, it seemed pointless to expect their leaders to move against him unless something far, far worse came out.

title: Corrections: May 17, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: The Americans Season 5, Episode 11: Youre a Monster
description: They told Elizabeth Jennings she could have it all  the husband, the kids, the challenging career, the greater cause.

title: Suffering for Your Art? Maybe You Need a Patron
description: In 2013, the editors of The Toast, an online magazine of feminist humor and commentary, asked Alexis Coe to write a regular column. Ms. Coe, a historian, was eager to accept, but couldnt. It was early in my career, she said. I couldnt do it for the nominal fee they were offering early writers.

title: Donald Trump, Russia, Cannes: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Moors Murders: A Notorious Couple and Their Young Prey
description: In the 1960s, Ian Brady, a slender 27-year-old stock clerk with sharp features and a pompadour, and his girlfriend, Myra Hindley, a 23-year-old typist with dyed blond hair, were suspected of killing five children. Grisly details of abduction, torture, beatings and sexual abuse were disclosed in court, turning the couple into the most hated in Britain.

title: Easy Win by Yankees Delays a Test of Dellin Betances
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Blown-up baseball cards depicting former players hang above the lockers in the visiting clubhouse at Kauffman Stadium. When the Yankees arrived Tuesday to begin a three-game series with the Kansas City Royals, reliever Dellin Betances was assigned the stall beneath an image of the Detroit Tigers great Jack Morris.

title: Forsaken Village on Italys Coast Tells Tale of a Paradise Lost
description: VILLAGGIO COPPOLA, Italy  When Villaggio Coppola was built in the 1960s along the western Mediterranean coast of Italy, just north of Naples, the aspiration was of a utopian residential area.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: The Handmaids Tale and I Am Heath Ledger
description: Serena Joy, the Commanders wife, unveils her back story on The Handmaids Tale. And I Am Heath Ledger provides glorious footage of that Australian actors life, but doesnt look deeply at what may have led to his 2008 death.

title: Word + Quiz: piquant
Warriors Take 2-0 Series Lead with a Blowout of the Spurs
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  On his drive to Oracle Arena on Tuesday afternoon to carry out his duties as acting head coach of the Golden State Warriors, Mike Brown was pulled over by police officers to make room for a bus. But it was not just any bus. It was the bus delivering the San Antonio Spurs to Game 2 of the Western Conference finals.

title: In a Time of Stress, Jewelry Becomes Armor
description: Since President Trumps inauguration in January, Pamela Love has received more requests for pieces from her Dagger jewelry collection than anytime since its introduction almost a decade ago. And Ms. Love, a New York-based designer, has no doubts about why her retailers and social media followers have renewed interest in the fierce-looking, but harmless, miniature daggers dangling from earrings and necklaces.

title: Water Escapes
description: The New York Times Travel section has published a collection called On the Water: 10 Favorite Places on European Rivers, Lakes and Coastlines full of photos and videos of fjords, hot springs and seasides.

title: Can Creativity Be Scheduled?
description: Listen to this short podcast from Behavior Gap Radio, and then think about what being a creative person means to you. Do you see yourself as a creative type? Why or why not?

title: Britains Young Muslim Men as They Want to Be Seen
description: Mahtab Hussain has photographed Asian Muslim men in England in a portrait series that counters simplistic narratives that portray Muslims as refugees or terrorists.

title: If Youre in a Wheelchair, Segregation Lives
description: ROCHESTER  Last year, the former chief of the Santa Fe, N.M., police department, Donald Grady II, said something that stuck with me. Theres a thing that we call freedom of movement, he said in an interview with The Atlantic, which is really revered in this country  that we should have the right to move freely without impingement from the police simply because. He was speaking as both a black man and a police officer about the ways racial discrimination can limit a basic right. But I related to this on more than one level.

title: Highway Robbery Targets the Poor
description: SACRAMENTO  Despite its status as one of the nations more progressive states, California is speeding backward by promoting what amounts to a highly regressive tax on motorists. It involves what critics call the Lexus Lanes.

title: A Protest in Virginia With Echoes of the Klan
description: The mayor of Charlottesville, Va., was on the mark when he compared the people who marched with torches on Saturday to protest the planned removal of a Confederate monument to Ku Klux Klansmen, who terrorized Southern nights with cross-burnings and violence. By embracing the symbols and rhetoric of racial terror, the demonstrators made clear that they valued the Confederate memorial not for civic or aesthetic reasons but as a testament to white supremacy.

title: With Sixth Straight Loss, Mets Sink to a Low Not Seen Since 2014
description: PHOENIX  At no point during the 2016 season were the Mets more than three games under .500. The low-water mark of the 2015 season was one game under .500. The Mets reached the playoffs both years.

title: Britains Young Muslim Men as They Want to Be Seen
description: Mahtab Hussain, a British artist of Pakistani descent, had grown tired of the simplistic narratives that portrayed Muslims as either refugees or terrorists. While in art school, and later at the National Portrait Gallery in London, he was irked that no one had done any projects about Asians and Muslims like him.

title: Questions for: An Everyman Museum to Celebrate American Writers
description: Article: An Everyman Museum to Celebrate American Writers

title: On the Ransomware Attack
description: The attackers based their weapon on vulnerabilities that were stolen from the National Security Agency.

title: Suicide Bombers Storm TV Station in Afghanistan
description: JALALABAD, Afghanistan  Suicide bombers besieged the state television offices in the eastern Afghan city of Jalalabad on Wednesday, officials said, fighting for three hours and leaving at least six people dead.

title: Instagram in Iran's Election
description: On May 19, voters in Iran select their next president. Facebook and Twitter have been blocked there since 2009. But the hard-liner Ebrahim Raisi and President Hassan Rouhani, a reformist, are both turning to Instagram to court young voters.

title: A Fading City Loses an Unlikely Lifeline
description: Cairo, Ill., has a population of fewer than 3,000 people. A plan to demolish two public housing developments would force many residents to leave and cut the school enrollment in half. Visit Cairo in this 360 video.

title: Luxury Trips for Less in Spain and Portugal
description: An upscale vacation to either Spain or Portugal is possible even if you dont have a big budget to spare, said Virginia Irurita, the founder of Made for Spain and Portugal, a company in Madrid selling trips to the two countries. The cost of living in both Spain and Portugal is lower compared with other popular European destinations, so your money goes that much further, she said.

title: What the D.J. Kaskade Cant Travel Without
description: Ryan Raddon, the Grammy-nominated dance music D.J. better known as Kaskade, spends at least two-thirds of every year on the road, playing to tens of thousands of people at gigs and festivals around the world. And he does it all with just a carry-on. He recently collaborated with Incase to design a line of travel bags and accessories, but nothing so big it has to be checked.

title: I Accidentally Killed a Child. May I Get in Touch With the Family?
description: Thirty years ago, I was in a car-and-moped accident. I was driving the car. The police determined that the moped driver, a preteen with no driving experience, was at fault. A passenger on the moped, also a preteen, died the next day from her injuries. At the funeral, the parents made clear that they would not accept my apology and condolences, and that they never wanted to hear from me again.

title: Review: Alien: Covenant Stays on Brand With Its Terror
description: When the larval alien at last explodes out of a human torso, you may experience, along with the expected jolt of fright, a curious sensation of relief, even affection. So much has changed in the world, and in movies, since the first Alien freaked out audiences in 1979, that the appearance of a chittering, scurrying, fast-spawning extraterrestrial predator feels like a visit from an old friend. Humanity may have lapsed into terminal tedium or hubristic stupidity, but that creature, with long, slender limbs and a cranium like a speedskaters helmet, remains interesting.

title: Charlamagne Tha God Loves Telling Middle America About Black Privilege
description: As co-host of the radio program The Breakfast Club, you call yourself the prime minister of pissing people off. But your new book, Black Privilege, is less about aggravation and more about sharing principles that you think are integral to success. Ive always been the person who, even in the hood, people would come to with their problems. At one point in my life, I thought I was going to be a psychiatrist.

title: Why Were This Mans Muscles Weak and His Body Covered With Pink Dots?
description: The woman woke to the sound of her 57-year-old husband sobbing. Theyd been married for 30 years, and she had never heard him cry before. I hurt so much, he wailed. I have to go back to the hospital.

title: The Rooster Attacked Me  and Yet I Loved Him
description: When I was growing up on a small farm in western New York State, my greatest thrill was gathering eggs from the nests in the coop and feeding our little flock of 40-odd chickens under the tutelage of my Hungarian grandmother. I most looked forward to seeing the barnyard roosters, whose belligerent, strutting, preening, aggressive macho behavior was a source of endless fascination and trepidation.

title: The Kites Are Leaving
description: My children live in the Lahore compound where I spent much of my own childhood, the fourth generation of my family to do so, with members of three of these generations presently alive and resident, including my parents, who built a house on part of the front lawn three decades ago, and my wife and me, who live in the old house, which was constructed three decades earlier. When I was a child, Lahore was home to three million people, and our neighborhood was a leafy, grassy expanse speckled with bungalows. Now Lahore is home to three times as many people, and our nearest neighbors are shopping malls, restaurants, apartment buildings, offices  crammed close together, with little green.

title: The Death of My Hermit Crab
description: With a kids hubris, I was certain I could take care of two hermit crabs into their spiny dotage. It was fascinating to watch a naked crab emerge from the fluted lip of a shell, looking for a new home. I filled a tank with large and midrange conchs. Construction sites opened up all over the tank. Conchs scraped around the sand, levitating on burnt orange claws. The hermits buried and exhumed themselves at unpredictable intervals. They outgrew and shed their bodies and each time this happened, it was magic. It made bodies seem fungible, an armature you could shuck and swap. They moved like a glacial version of the con mans shell game. They were master vanishers, digging down into the sandy substratum. Mine sometimes disappeared for days. Or they relocated at night, and I would spend a morning beaming affection at an empty shell. This was a little embarrassing. But it was also marvelous, to be so fooled.

title: The Mongoose and the migr
description: There were mongooses everywhere on the island, but in those years I only ever saw them in Azua, where my mother was from. When we visited that part of the country, which seemed to me as withered as Santo Domingo was lush, they never failed to appear  low-slung sweeps of light, streaking across a baseball field, vanishing into grass. Mongooses were irresistible to a kid like me. Even in that small place, their reputations preceded them: legendary ratters, breakers of serpents, lightning fast and smart like all get out. Naturally I wanted one for a pet, but my abuelo, who knew everything about every animal in Azua, just laughed. Jurones cant be tamed, he explained. Son guapo.

title: A Pet Tortoise Who Will Outlive Us All
description: Every morning, Fred takes a walk around my parents yard in suburban Honolulu. The yard, though small, around 600 square feet, is beautiful, green and cool and jungly, densely planted with lacy native ferns and heavy-headed crimson heliconia and fragrant with white flowers: gardenia, plumeria, ginger, night-blooming jasmine. Fred is 15 years old and 80 pounds, and since my parents adopted him two years ago, he has never left this yard. When he is dozing in the shade, the old shower trees outside the picket fence that surrounds the yard rain their pink and yellow petals down on him.

title: When the Lab Rat Is a Snake
description: As Amit Choudhary opened the package of snake blood, the first thing he noticed was its color. It looked like yogurt. The blood plasma, harvested from a Burmese python shortly after feeding, was so clogged with fatty acids that it was not clear but milky white. An oily mess like that should be toxic, Choudhary thought. Indeed, when he smeared the same amount of fatty acids on a plate of human pancreatic cells, the kind that supply the body with insulin, they self-destructed from the stress. Yet he knew the snake could somehow thrive, even as its plasma turned to yogurt after every single meal.

title: The Value and Virtue of Good Writing (Rule No. 7: Dont Be a Bore)
description: DO I MAKE MYSELF CLEAR? Why Writing Well Matters By Harold Evans Illustrated. 408 pp. Little, Brown & Company. $27.

title: Google, Not the Government, Is Building the Future
description: One persistent criticism of Silicon Valley is that it no longer works on big, world-changing ideas. Every few months, a dumb start-up will make the news  most recently the one selling a $700 juicer  and folks outside the tech industry will begin singing I-told-you-sos.

title: De Blasio Quietly Seeks Allies in Battle Over Homeless Shelters
description: Not long after Mayor Bill de Blasio announced his plan to open 90 homeless shelters across New York City, he heard from someone whose support was crucial.

title: Their Public Housing at the End of Its Life, Residents Ask: What Now?
description: CAIRO, Ill.  Residents hear mice rustling in the walls at night. Some occupants leave ovens on in the winter, their doors perched open, because furnaces fail. Ceilings droop from water damage, mold creeps across walls, and roaches scramble out of refrigerators.

title: How Uber and Waymo Ended Up Rivals in the Race for Driverless Cars

He thinks a cardiologist is someone who works at Hallmark, he quipped.

description: Presidential elections in Iran raise a puzzling contradiction: How can the government include both an unelected supreme leader and a president who is chosen in votes that are treated as serious contests?

description: Full-service apartment buildings in this Bronx neighborhood give an urban vibe, but historic homes and tidy yards suggest something quieter.

description: At the confluence of the Hudson and Harlem Rivers, Spuyten Duyvil, in the northwestern Bronx, can seem to be channeling two somewhat opposite experiences.

title: U.K. Government Sells Final Stake in Lloyds Banking Group
description: LONDON  Nearly nine years after a government bailout during the financial crisis, the Lloyds Banking Group is fully private again.

Why do I feel different from the people Im around? Those feelings can be the beginning of a journey of self-discovery that can be rewarding, but also extremely daunting.

description: Given the nasty legal battle between Uber and Waymo, the self-driving car unit of Googles parent, its easy to forget that once upon a time, Google and Uber saw each other as allies.

description: When young athletes sustain concussions, they are typically told to rest until all symptoms disappear. That means no physical activity, reading, screen time or friends, and little light exposure, for multiple days and, in severe cases, weeks.

description: In the past few years, a number of predictions have declared the end of the beard. Sorry guys, beards are over, said the website Mashable. Beards Arent Cool Anymore, said Vice.

description: Despite the temptation for parents to say yes to their childrens wishes, research shows theres an insidious side to chasing after the newest thing others have. It fosters a sense of deficiency that can never be fully satisfied. First they want the doll, then all of the accessories  and of course the four-story Barbie mansion.

description: TOKYO  A royal engagement typically unleashes breathless headlines and frenzied efforts by the press to learn of the wedding details. All that is happening in Japan, where Princess Mako, the eldest grandchild of Emperor Akihito, will soon be engaged to her college boyfriend.

description: TEHRAN  Irans supreme leader issued a warning on Wednesday, saying there was a chance that some individuals  he was not clear which  might interfere in Fridays presidential elections. title: How to Be Mindful Mowing the Lawn
description: Approach mowing the lawn as an adventure brimming with curiosity and wonder instead of just an ordinary, mundane task. Take time to intentionally make connections with your natural environment as you look at the sun, the earth, trees, the clouds, birds and animals. Notice the shift within you as you become aware of each of your senses being stimulated in your mindful mowing experience.  Kathleen Hall, founder and chief executive of The Mindful Living Network

title: The Criminal President?
description: After the revelations of the past 24 hours, it appears that President Trumps conduct in and around the firing of the F.B.I. director, James Comey, may have crossed the line into criminality. The combination of what is known and what is credibly alleged would, if fully substantiated, constitute obstruction of justice. It is time for Congress and a special counsel in the executive branch to conduct objective, bipartisan inquiries into these allegations, together with the underlying matters involving Michael Flynn and Russia that gave rise to them.

title: 2 Men in Indonesia Sentenced to Caning for Having Gay Sex
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Two men accused of having sex with each other were each sentenced on Wednesday to 85 lashes in public, the first case of people being punished for homosexuality in the Indonesian province of Aceh under a strict version of Shariah law.

description: SPRING RIDGE, Australia  Mark Coulton and his daughter, Claire, both believe there is a future in rural living. They are both active members of Australias National Party, which traditionally represents farmers and voters outside the main cities who lean conservative, and they agree on most things  but not on how to deal with climate change.

title: Return to Twin Peaks
description: After two and a half decades, the fog over the town of Twin Peaks may finally be lifting: The cult series, which ended on a cliffhanger in 1991, is set to return on Sunday. The new series, Twin Peaks:The Return, on Showtime, picks up with Special Agent Dale Cooper and the gang 25-plus years after the mysterious death of Laura Palmer. With the founding creators David Lynch and Mark Frost and much of theoriginal caston board, we can expect a trippy and addictive ride. The visuals, of course, will provide fertile ground for inspiration, particularly the fashion, which will come from Nancy Steiner, whose portfolio includes The Virgin Suicides and Lost in Translation. Here, looks inspired by the shows most seminal imagery to get you in the spirit for the premiere.

title: In Praise of Splatter-Painted Floors
description: The first time I saw splatter-painted floor was inside a simple shingled house atop a windswept dune on Nantucket. We lived there as a family only briefly, but my memory of the design is vivid. The wooden planks in the old-fashioned kitchen with its swinging door to the backyard were wide and knotty; they had been lacquered a stormy gray and dribbled with specks of turquoise, pale yellow and poppy red. Standing on those floors, we grilled blueberry muffins with butter in a cast-iron pan in the mornings; on our knees, we raced lobsters before they were tossed into a pot in the evenings. I ran the bottoms of my sunburned feet along the raised pattern of the splatter, imagining the aftermath of a rainbow-colored rainstorm or the detritus of a birthday piata. It seemed as magical as the scallop shells I painted with glitter nail polish each day after the beach.

title: Andrea Constand Was the Linchpin of the Bill Cosby Case
description: Bill Cosby was found guilty of sexually assaulting Andrea Constand.

title: What Israel Makes of Trumps Intel Gaffe
description: TEL AVIV  On Monday, The Washington Post reported that President Trump had disclosed highly classified intelligence to senior Russian officials in a meeting at the White House last week. The intelligence had come from an American ally in the Middle East that had not given permission for such sharing, breaching a cardinal rule of intelligence cooperation among allies. On Tuesday, we learned that this ally was Israel, and that the intelligence reportedly involved information about Islamic State plots to blow up airliners with bombs planted in laptops.

title: As Hurricane Season Approaches, Review Your Insurance
description: The Atlantic hurricane season is a little more than two weeks away, so now is a good time for homeowners along the coast to check their insurance coverage.

title: Eugene ONeill, Brought to Life in Bright Colors
description: The bank of stadium seats rose up and up and up, a mass of lemon yellow so bright it shocked the retina. It seemed entirely the wrong color for Eugene ONeill, yet here it was at the Park Avenue Armory, part of the production design for his play The Hairy Ape.

title: How the Murder of a D.N.C. Staff Member Fueled Conspiracy Theories
description: The murder last July of an employee of the Democratic National Committee received renewed attention from news media outlets on the right this week when a private investigator and longtime Fox News contributor said that there was tangible evidence that the employee, Seth Rich, had contacted WikiLeaks before his death.

title: Whos at the Controls on KLM? Sometimes, the Dutch King
description: For two decades, the king of the Netherlands has been putting the royal in KLM Royal Dutch Airlines.

title: Chelsea Manning, Russia, North Korea: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: They Made the Meatpacking District Fashionable. Is Sunset Park Next?
description: Over a garage on 36th Street in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, a faded sign announced Three Generations Metal Maintenance, with the dings and peeling paint that only generations can confer. A bit farther down the block, lunchtime lines were forming at Avocaderia, which bills itself as the worlds first avocado bar.

title: Suit Alleges Past Sexual Abuse at Connecticut Boarding School
description: A former student at the Kent School, a private boarding school in Connecticut, sued Kent on Wednesday, alleging that administrators did not do enough to protect her from a teacher who she said sexually abused her in the late 1980s.

title: Review: Bryan Cranston Is a Dad in Suburban Exile in Wakefield
description: The title character in Wakefield  we learn in due course that his first name is Howard  commutes home every evening to his handsome suburban house from the Manhattan law firm where hes a partner. One night, aided by the serendipitous convergence of a delayed train and a dead cellphone battery, he slips out of his routine and into an odd kind of exile. Instead of walking in the front door to greet his wife, Diana, and their twin daughters, Wakefield betakes himself to a storage room above the garage, where he can observe his own absence through a small window.

title: Review: Three Must Become Two in The Survivalist
description: Impressively lean and rigidly controlled, The Survivalist achieves, at times, the primitive allure of a silent movie. And thats not simply because of the characters reticence (the entirety of the dialogue could probably fit on a single page), but because the films Irish writer and director, Stephen Fingleton, has an intensity of purpose that infects his characters every move and gesture.

title: Aldous Hardings Songs Wont Be Pinned Down. Nor Will Her Voice.
description: Aldous Harding shies away from explaining the quiet, cryptic, utterly arresting songs on Party, her second album and first American release, due on Friday. Conversing in a stark basement conference room at the New York City office of her American label, 4AD, Ms. Harding said, I dont really like to talk about what my songs are about.

title: A Disgraced and Re-elected Connecticut Mayor Eyes the Statehouse
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.  A decade ago, the story of Joseph P. Ganim was that of a young mayor and gifted politician with a promising future undone by corruption. He had been convicted of accepting hundreds of thousands of dollars from people and companies doing business with the city. He resigned, and political observers here believed that the legal ordeal was a setback from which he would never recover.

title: The End of Eddy Captures a Savage Childhood and a Global Movement
description: THE END OF EDDYBy douard LouisTranslated by Michael Lucey192 pages. Farrar, Straus and Giroux. $23.

title: Trumps Urging That Comey Jail Reporters Denounced as an Act of Intimidation
description: During a private meeting in February with the former F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, President Trump floated a proposal that, even by the standards of a leader who routinely advertises his disdain for the news media, brought editors and reporters up short.

title: We Settle a Big Fashion Rivalry: Nashville vs. Columbus
description: A hot fashion rivalry is underway thousands of miles from the runways of Milan and Paris. It has nothing to do with couture houses or red carpets. It does not involve a luxury brand poaching the designer du jour from a competitor. The clash arises from recent claims made by boosters for Nashville and Columbus. Each city, it seems, considers itself the fashion capital of the United States, with the very notable exceptions of New York and Los Angeles. Each city, in other words, is vying for third place.

title: Review: 56 Years Presenting the Best of Young Artists
description: Nothing reveals the talent of an emerging musician better than an intimate recital. For 56 years, Young Concert Artists has fostered the careers of gifted performers by presenting them in small solo concerts.

title: Modern Love Podcast: Gideon Glick Reads Just Dont Call Me Mom
description: On this weeks podcast, the actor Gideon Glick reads Just Dont Call Me Mom, about a Mothers Day gift that makes a stay-at-home dad reconsider the meaning of his role in the family.

title: Why Texans Are Fighting Anti-Immigrant Legislation
description: Austin, Tex.  Im a member of the Austin City Council, and this month Texas State Troopers arrested me for refusing to leave Gov. Greg Abbotts office during a protest against the anti-immigrant Senate Bill 4.

title: Review: A Mythic Force Rages in the Welsh Iphigenia in Splott
description: Effie, the human firestorm raging through Gary Owens Iphigenia in Splott, at 59E59 Theaters, knows that if you saw her coming down the sidewalk, you would probably cross the street. A part of her resents this. But she also savors it; your discomfort confirms her strength.

title: Alex Jones Retracts Chobani Claims to Resolve Lawsuit
description: Alex Jones, a high-profile conspiracy theorist and the host of a right-wing radio show, said Wednesday that he had mischaracterized the yogurt company Chobani in statements on social media that led to a lawsuit.

title: Harry Styles Fights the Spotlight on His Debut Solo Album
description: The first rule about being in a successful boy band is understanding that one day you will no longer be in a successful boy band. The baggage of that life will be removed, but so will the perks. If, underneath all that, you have a beating heart, a robust sense of self and a modicum of taste, the potential for growth is great. Your future may take on a shape of its own, rather than just the shape of the shadow of the past.

title: With Ransomware, Its Pay and Embolden Perpetrators, or Lose Precious Data
description: Robert Gren was working from home on Friday when, all of a sudden, his laptop stopped working.

title: At Cannes, le Booing Isnt Just Reserved for Bad Films
description: Many things set the Cannes Film Festival apart: world-class cinema, glamorous stars, Mediterranean sun. And dont forget le booing.

title: Author Is Sued Over Book on Campus Sex
description: A graduate student at Northwestern University is suing the author Laura Kipnis and her publisher, HarperCollins, over her new book, Unwanted Advances: Sexual Paranoia Comes to Campus, which tackles the thorny subject of sexual politics in academia.

title: Why Its Hard to Have an Independent Russia Investigation
description: A special counsel does not ensure that the F.B.I. investigation will be free from political interference.

title: After Fox, Its Podcast Time for Bill OReilly and Glenn Beck
description: Two of the most well-known conservative commentators in the United States  both of whom made high-profile departures from top-rated shows on Fox News  will be podcasting together.

title: Lost in the Digital Swamp, Link by Link
description: I was on my phone, reading an article from a respectable news outlet, when I came across an ad tempting me toward a seedier corner of the web. It featured a photograph of an anonymous woman leaning over the bathroom sink, her head cut out of the frame, backside front and center, iPhone gleaming on the counter nearby. Husband Divorced His Wife After Looking Closer at This Photo, the headline read.

title: Where to Shop for Summery Bits This Week
description: On Thursday at 7 p.m., stop by the Collective, the trend-merchandized shopping experience on the newly renovated fifth floor of Saks Fifth Avenues New York flagship. You can pick up a Public School long lace dress ($895) or a Tanya Taylor embroidered military jacket ($695) and meet the designers. Ten percent of proceeds from sales through Saturday will be donated to the NewYork-Presbyterian Phyllis and David Komansky Center for Childrens Health.

title: Indias Lost Party Mansions
description: Driving on the main roads in the South Indian state of Tamil Nadu, the barely there villages that materialize every few miles take on a comforting rhythm: a handful of stucco cottages in mildew-stained pink, marigold and teal; a shrine to Ganesha on a tall white pole; a cluster of tiny thatched-roof stores, like packed closets flung open. On shaded porches in front, women in saris, shiny with perspiration, slice pineapple beside a glass-door cooler of Fanta.

title: How Basquiat Became the $60 Million Man
description: How did a young graffiti rebel go from selling drawings for $50 in 1980 to having a painting come up for auction this week at a staggering $60 million?

title: Review: Recalling an Electric New York in Radicals in Miniature
description: There was John Sex, the python-hugging entertainer who credited his sky-high hairdo to Dippity-do, Aqua Net, egg whites, beer and semen. And David, a No-Wave obsessive who cataloged every band that played the late-night clubs. And Elaine, a dancer and baby sitter and house sitter and artists model.

title: Robert Mueller, Former F.B.I. Director, Is Named Special Counsel for Russia Investigation
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department appointed Robert S. Mueller III, a former F.B.I. director, as special counsel on Wednesday to oversee the investigation into ties between President Trumps campaign and Russian officials, dramatically raising the legal and political stakes in an affair that has threatened to engulf Mr. Trumps four-month-old presidency.

title: Trumps Version of Keeping Us Safe
description: Wow, Donald Trump cant even give a commencement speech to the military without making it all about him.

title: Donald Trump, Jimmy Fallon, Google: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Rod Rosensteins Letter Appointing Mueller Special Counsel
description: The deputy attorney general, Rod J. Rosenstein, appointed former F.B.I. Director Robert S. Mueller III as the special counsel to oversee the investigation into Russian tampering in the 2016 presidential election.

title: Irritus Carne y Arena Virtual Reality Simulates a Harrowing Border Trek
description: CANNES, France  After weeks in the desert, dehydrated and afraid, refugees and migrants who are apprehended crossing the United States-Mexico border are regularly locked in what are called las hieleras: the freezers. They are meant to be short-term holding cells  they have no beds  but they also exact a kind of extrajudicial punishment. As revealed by a Freedom of Information Act request in 2015, migrants are trapped there for nearly two days on average. Children are separated from their families; detainees are deprived of food. Sometimes their lips split. Sometimes their skin turns blue.

title: Review: 4th Wimpy Kid Has New Faces in a Familiar Story
description: The Diary of a Wimpy Kid movie franchise has been dormant for five years, so the new installment, subtitled The Long Haul, was an opportunity to rejuvenate this never very good series with some recasting. Unfortunately, the fresh blood has been saddled with a tired story, the family road trip that goes outlandishly awry, and the result is another forgettable film.

title: Nearly a Decade Nursing? Study Pierces Orangutans Mother-Child Bond
description: Elizabeth Hunt Burrett, a mother from Australia, experienced a moment with an orangutan while breast-feeding her son at Melbourne Zoo last year.

title: Polarizing Sheriff David Clarke Says Hell Take a Top Homeland Security Job
description: David A. Clarke, the Milwaukee County sheriff who once claimed that ISIS and Black Lives Matter activists were forming an alliance to destroy America, said on a radio show Wednesday that he would accept a senior position at the Homeland Security Department.

title: U.S. Admiral in Fat Leonard Navy Scandal Sentenced to 18 Months
description: Rear Adm. Robert Gilbeau, the first admiral ever convicted of a federal crime while on active duty, was sentenced on Wednesday to 18 months in prison for lying to investigators about his involvement in a bribery scandal that has ensnared numerous Navy officers.

title: How the Impeachment Process Works
description: WASHINGTON  The account from the former F.B.I. director James B. Comey of President Trump pressing him  to drop an investigation into Michael T. Flynn, the former national security adviser, has escalated talk among the presidents critics that his actions may amount to obstruction of justice and grounds for impeachment.

title: Joseph Lieberman and 3 Others Interview to Be F.B.I. Director
description: President Trump, hoping to nominate a new F.B.I. director before leaving on a long foreign trip on Friday, interviewed four potential candidates on Wednesday, including Joseph I. Lieberman, the former senator from Connecticut.

title: Macrons Cabinet Gives Glimpse of How He Plans to Govern France
description: PARIS  The cabinet announced on Wednesday by the government of Frances newly elected president, Emmanuel Macron, is made up of a carefully chosen cast of characters meant to signal how he plans to govern.

title: Teenager Set Manhattan Synagogue Ablaze, Police Say
description: For eight generations in the life of a city that changed constantly around them, the twin towers on Norfolk Street beckoned the faithful on Manhattans Lower East Side: first, Baptists, whose congregation was the forerunner of the Riverside Church; then Methodists; and then, for 122 years, Orthodox Jews from Eastern Europe, who called the synagogue Beth Hamedrash Hagodol  the Great House of Study.

title: Its Back to the Future for the Celtics, the Sixers and the Lakers
description: On stage, perched between envoys from the rival cities Philadelphia and Boston, Magic Johnson flashed the smile that illuminated basketball arenas across the 1980s. Suddenly, it was as if the Manhattan hotel ballroom, transformed into a glitzy television studio on Tuesday night, were hosting a time-travel drama starring three historically intertwined teams.

title: Jean Fritz, Who Wrote History Books for Children, Dies at 101
description: Jean Fritz, an award-winning writer whose work helped transform historical biographies for children from leaden recitals of battles and dates into warm, human narratives full of quirks and crotchets and satisfyingly strange facts, died on Sunday at her home in Sleepy Hollow, N.Y. She was 101.

title: Australia? Yes, I Know; Off the Coast of New Zealand
description: Damien Cave, our Australia bureau chief, shares insights on global news, local recommendations and feedback from readers in this weekly newsletter. To receive it in your inbox, sign up here.

title: Review: Andrzej Wajdas Vividly Rendered Last Film, Afterimage
description: In an early scene in Afterimage, the artist and theoretician Wladyslaw Strzeminski sits on the floor of his studio as he looks at a canvas. The camera then reverses angles, and viewers see the white canvas suddenly turn vivid red. Indeed, the entire studio is soon suffused with red, because a giant banner celebrating Stalin is being hoisted up the front of the building. Strzeminski crawls over to his window  he lost an arm and a leg from injuries suffered in World War I  and pokes at the banner with one of his crutches, rending the fabric somewhat, which attracts the attention of the apparatchiks in charge of the operation. And so Strzeminskis latest troubles begin.

title: Spurs Get Gregg Popovichs Message, to Their Detriment
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Manu Ginobili could see it coming.

title: Upstreamed While Hailing a Cab on West End Avenue
description: Dear Diary:

title: Chicago Police Adopt New Limits on Use of Force
description: CHICAGO  The Chicago Police Department announced new rules on Wednesday that restrict when officers can fire their guns or use other forms of force. The policy instructs officers to defuse tense situations, requires them to seek aid for wounded suspects and limits the circumstances under which a fleeing person can be shot.

title: Review: Legion of Brothers on Secret Missions in Afghanistan
description: Youll have to wade through several topics to get to the heart of Legion of Brothers, but once youre there, some intense stories make the effort worthwhile.

title: Japans Economy Is Growing, but Dont Call It a Hot Streak
description: TOKYO  Japans economic engine may not exactly be roaring, but there is a definite hum in the air.

title: U.S. and E.U. Confer on Possible Laptop Ban on Trans-Atlantic Flights
description: BRUSSELS  American and European officials met on Wednesday in Brussels to discuss aviation security after the United States Department of Homeland Security said it was considering a ban on laptop computers and tablets in the cabins of trans-Atlantic flights.

title: The Handmaids Tale Episode 6 Recap: Trade Delegation
description: Within the first few pages of Men Explain Things To Me, her essay collection on modern gender politics from a feminist perspective, Rebecca Solnit elucidates the ways that physical brutality works as a means of control. Violence is one way to silence people, to deny their voice and their credibility to assert your right to control over their right to exist, Solnit writes. This is exactly how Gilead thrives. Violence and silence work in tandem to keep women like Offred in line. But the bodies of handmaids speak volumes even when they dont open their mouths. Hands lopped off. Eyes plucked out. Bruises. Burns. These marks speak of the high price women pay to survive.

title: Denying Maria Sharapova, Inviting a Debate
description: In the wake of the French Tennis Federations decision on Tuesday not to give Maria Sharapova a wild card into the French Open, a debate arose within the sport about whether denying Sharapova was also further penalizing her.

title: Murray and Kerber Are No. 1, but Not at the Top of Their Games
description: ROME  Andy Murray and Angelique Kerber, the top-ranked mens and womens professional tennis players, have charted largely parallel wayward courses in 2017, struggling to summon the form that earned them their top rankings last year.

title: Immigration Arrests Rise Sharply as a Trump Mandate Is Carried Out
description: Immigration arrests shot up 38 percent in the first three months of the Trump administration compared with the same period last year, according to figures released Wednesday, one of the first clear indications that the presidents hard-line policies are being carried out on a grand scale.

title: Lloyd Cotsen, Collector of the Ordinary and the Odd, Dies at 88
description: If you had called Lloyd Cotsen a collector, he might have corrected you and said that he was really an accumulator. With an eclectic eye, he accumulated Japanese bamboo baskets, small pieces of textiles, bronze Chinese mirrors and illustrated childrens books.

title: Alex Rodriguez, Still Tied to the Yankees, Will Now Analyze Them on TV
description: Of all the words Alex Rodriguez is likely to utter when he makes his debut as an in-game analyst Thursday night for Fox Sports 1, there is one he is clearly trying to avoid. I just hope I dont say we, Rodriguez said. But it will be hard. It will be hard not to be a homer.

title: Matt Harvey Makes Progress, but Mets Beleaguered Bullpen Falters Again
description: PHOENIX  Facing a full count, Rafael Montero fired a 95-mile-per-hour fastball down the middle of the plate, the last place it should have gone. Chris Herrmann, the Arizona Diamondbacks catcher, swung hard and sent it over the center-field fence. Montero watched it land, turned and walked off the field with his equally dejected teammates.

title: De Blasio Says Stick to Subway (but Dont Blame Him if You Run Late)
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio has a message for New Yorkers fed up with subway delays, crowded train cars and the general sense that the aging system is edging closer to meltdown.

title: Google Wants to Be Everywhere With Everyone
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  Sometimes you just need to have a party, even if theres nothing special to celebrate.

title: Payoffs From Putin to Trump? McCarthy Says No, He Was Just Kidding
description: WASHINGTON  Did you hear the one about the Russians paying off the future president of the United States? It seems House Republicans have.

title: Foreign Trip Comes at Crucial Time, but Trump Is a Reluctant Traveler
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump leaves on Friday for a nine-day, five-city foreign excursion, his first trip outside the United States as the countrys leader and top diplomat.

title: Republicans Pivot and Make Comey the Capitols Most-Wanted Man
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans on Wednesday abruptly pivoted and rushed to call on James B. Comey, who was fired as F.B.I. director by President Trump last week, to testify before several committees, produce memos and provide greater detail of his encounters with the president.

title: Trump Team Knew Flynn Was Under Investigation Before He Came to White House
description: WASHINGTON  Michael T. Flynn told President Trumps transition team weeks before the inauguration that he was under federal investigation for secretly working as a paid lobbyist for Turkey during the campaign, according to two people familiar with the case.

title: Robert Mueller, New Special Counsel, Is Known for Independence
description: WASHINGTON  During one of the searing moments that Robert S. Mueller III proved his willingness to stand up to the power of a president, he had his friend, James B. Comey, by his side.

title: Puerto Rican Day Parade to Honor a Long-Jailed Militant
description: Parades should be uncomplicated affairs: floats, marching bands and baton twirlers. In New York City, few things are that simple  especially for the Puerto Rican Day Parade, an annual event that has seen its share of violence, graft and mismanagement.

title: Quotation of the Day: Putin Butts In to Claim There Were No Secrets, and Says Hell Prove It
description: I think Putin gets personal pleasure from exploiting the vulnerable position Trump has found himself in.

title: Corrections: May 18, 2017
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Washington Is Abuzz With Surround Sound of Scandal
description: WASHINGTON  On Day 118 of the Trump administration, a special counsel was appointed. The word impeachment was uttered on the floor of the House of Representatives. And the president of the United States contemplated how to go forward with the next 1,343 days.

title: Heres What a Special Counsel Means in the Russia Investigation
description: Updated Oct. 30, 2017

title: Puerto Rico Faces Humbling Scope of Its Woes in First Court Hearing
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  Puerto Ricos first day in federal court to reduce its $123 billion in bond debt and unfunded pensions got off to a cordial enough start on Wednesday, but after a few hours, the gloves started to come off.

title: Dangerous Times for Trump and the Nation
description: The Trump presidency may now be disintegrating, tumbling toward entropy.

title: Robert Mueller: The Special Counsel America Needs
description: If President Trump thought that by sacking the F.B.I. director, James Comey, he could kill off the investigation into his associates ties to the Russian government and its attempt to deliver him the White House, he was wrong.

title: Question Raised
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  There are many different kinds of jokes, but one of the first ones that children learn to tell is, Why did the chicken cross the road?

title: The Flight 93 Election Crashes Again
description: In case youve had the pleasure of forgetting, The Flight 93 Election was the title of a portentous essay, published last September under a Roman pseudonym in The Claremont Review of Books, that declared the stakes for the United States in 2016 thus: Charge the cockpit or you die.

title: 300,000 Child Refugees and Migrants Traveled Alone in 15 and 16, U.N. Says
description: UNITED NATIONS  The number of children traveling by themselves among documented refugees and migrants has nearly quintupled to the highest on record, and many of them are at risk from smugglers, sex traffickers and other predators, the United Nations said in a report published on Wednesday.

title: The Antarctica Series
description: Four virtual-reality films take you on, above and below the Antarctic ice.

title: White Tulsa Officer Is Acquitted in Fatal Shooting of Black Driver
description: TULSA, Okla.  Jurors on Wednesday found a white police officer not guilty in the fatal shooting of an unarmed black man last year, one in a string of law enforcement killings of black men that have prompted a national debate about race relations and the use of force.

title: Brazil President Endorsed Businessmans Bribes in Secret Tape, Newspaper Says
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  A food company executive secretly recorded President Michel Temer of Brazil endorsing the executives payment of hush money to a once-powerful politician jailed for corruption, a Brazilian newspaper reported Wednesday night.

title: A Power Player and Her Sons Disappear Off the Bahamas
description: Rescue workers on Wednesday continued to collect debris from an MU-2B aircraft that went down about 15 miles east of Eleuthera, the Bahamas, said Eric Woodall, a spokesman for the Coast Guard.

title: Las Vegas Officer Uses Stun Gun and Choke Hold on Man Who Dies
description: A Las Vegas police officer involved in a fatal weekend chase used a stun gun seven times and held a man in a neck hold for more than one minute before the man lost consciousness and was later pronounced dead, the authorities said on Wednesday.

title: 15 Black Lives Ended in Confrontations With Police. 3 Officers Convicted.
description: What happened in prominent cases in which blacks were killed by the police or died in police custody.

title: Fargo Season 3, Episode 5: Once Upon a Time ...
description: This is how it feels to be alone at the top of the hill, tryin to figure out why.

title: How a Projector Can Substitute for a Television Set
description: I have fantasized about turning a part of the basement into a media room where Id play The Godfather, The Wizard of Oz and The Best Years of Our Lives on continuous loop. But where to start? Chris Heinonen, the audio visual staff writer at The Wirecutter, The New York Times site for evaluating products, has tested all the options.

title: James Corden Will Return as Grammys Host in 2018
description: Prepare for another awards show rendition of Carpool Karaoke. James Corden, the host of The Late Late Show on CBS, will be returning as host of the Grammy Awards next year, the Recording Academy announced Wednesday.

title: Contemporary Art Buyers Cautious After Wall Street Dips
description: A substantial fall on Wall Street cooled demand Wednesday night at a Christies auction of contemporary works that was regarded by many as the first serious test of the art market in the Trump economy.

title: JARs Light in the Darkness
description: There are a number of things Joel Arthur Rosenthal, the reclusive Bronx-born, Paris-based Faberg of our times more commonly known as JAR, who is also the only living jeweler to have a solo show at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, will not do.

title: Paul Pogba Cant Save Manchester United Alone. Nobody Can.
description: MANCHESTER, England  In normal circumstances, it would have been a bad day, no more than that. When Manchester United hosted Liverpool in January, Paul Pogba missed an inviting early chance. He gave away a penalty. Only the late intervention of Zlatan Ibrahimovic spared him the guilt of costing his team defeat in English soccers closest equivalent to Spains Clsico.

title: Miles of Ice Collapsing Into the Sea
description: Some scientists fear that West Antarcticas immense ice sheet may have entered the early stages of an unstoppable disintegration.

title: Racing to Find Answers in the Ice
description: Scientists are sprinting to understand what is happening in West Antarctica as the planet warms around it.

title: Looming Floods, Threatened Cities
description: Antarcticas potential collapse could damage coastal cities across the globe.

title: Yankees Add Speed to Their Power and Throttle the Royals
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Speed has not traditionally been a Yankees trademark. But in their transition from an old, plodding team to a younger, more vibrant one, the Yankees have added that element, and it has contributed significantly to their encouraging start.

title: Donald Trump, Emmanuel Macron, Google: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: In an Aside to Trump, Homeland Security Chief Suggests He Use Sword on the Press
