title: The Daily: More Comey Memos, More Revelations
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Cool Cruises Around Iceland
description: A summer cruise around Iceland is an ideal way to appreciate the countrys landscape, which includes geysers, waterfalls and glaciers. Diane Eide, an Iceland specialist at Travel Experts, said such a trip was a convenient way to see much of the country because driving from place to place takes a lot of time. An Iceland cruise is also relatively affordable, with good values to be had between June and September.

title: Race Spectators Behaving Badly
description: Race spectators can be a mixed blessing. From your parents waiting for you at the finish line of your local 5K to the million plus fans who line the New York City Marathon route, they can give you a boost when your legs and brain feel too tired to go on.

title: How Much Weight Do I Need to Lose to Prevent Diabetes?
description: Q. How can a blood test determine if I have prediabetes? How much weight do I need to lose to bring my numbers down?

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Mindfulness, Measles and Sports Safety
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: He Showed Up Dressed as Reba McEntire. That Seemed to Work.
description: Michael Moeller is movie-star handsome and always impeccably dressed, and has designed rooms for fashion icons, TV shows and magazines. But his affinity for what looks best didnt stop him from falling for a man who showed up on his East Village doorstep one night dressed as the country singer Reba McEntire.

title: New York Today: How Safe Is Times Square?
description: Updated, 8:44 a.m.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Lisa Su on the Art of Setting Ambitious Goals
description: This interview with Lisa Su, chief executive of AMD, a semiconductor company, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: The American Revolution: A History of Violence
description: SCARS OF INDEPENDENCE Americas Violent Birth By Holger Hoock Illustrated. 559 pp. Crown Publishers. $30.

title: Why Does a Young Writer Fall in Love with a Misogynist Bully?
description: FIRST LOVE By Gwendoline Riley 166 pp. Melville House. Paper, $16.99.

title: Fleeing a Fictional World of Despots and Drones
description: THE GOLDEN LEGEND By Nadeem Aslam319 pp. Alfred A. Knopf. $27.95.

title: How Daniel Garodnick, a New York Councilman, Spends His Sundays
description: Daniel R. Garodnick, 44, serves on the New York City Council, representing District 4 in Manhattan  a huge swath of the East Side. Since the presidential election, the activity around Trump Tower in Midtown has created headaches for Councilman Garodnicks constituents, he said, including snarled traffic and a downturn in business for nearby shops. Mr. Garodnick, a Democrat, lives farther south in the district, in Stuyvesant Town-Peter Cooper Village, where he grew up and where he helped forge a major housing preservation deal in 2015. He is married to Zoe Segal-Reichlin, 38, a senior associate general counsel at Planned Parenthood Federation of America; they have two sons, Asher, 6, and Devin, 3. He is also a runner, and trained for the Brooklyn half marathon this weekend.

title: Stories
description: THE TEETH OF THE COMB And Other Stories By Osama Alomar Translated by C. J. Collins with Osama Alomar102 pp. New Directions, paper, $13.95.

title: Washington Post, Breaking News, Is Also Breaking New Ground
description: Since The Washington Posts Watergate-era glory days, my need to read that paper has waxed and waned. I already pay for and scour The New York Times (of course), The Wall Street Journal and The New Yorker, which is a lot to manage before I even get to the books on my night stand and Kindle. So I havent been looking for more to read, let alone another monthly expense.

title: Before Drivers Times Square Crash, a Descent Into Paranoia and Harassment
description: Richard Rojas did not speak much about his three years in a Navy uniform, but when he returned to the Bronx from a naval base in Jacksonville, Fla., in 2014, he was a different man.

title: Insect Mysteries
description: The GIF above comes from a recent article from the Science Times headlined Ladybugs Pack Wings and Engineering Secrets in Tidy Origami Packages, and describes how this insect has hind wings four times its size which it folds and unfolds many times a day.

title: Chinese Jets Flew Dangerously Close During Intercept, U.S. Says
description: BEIJING  Two Chinese fighter jets flew too fast and too close to an American military aircraft patrolling the East China Sea, prompting a formal protest to the Chinese government, the United States Air Force said on Friday.

title: We Arent Built to Live in the Moment
description: We are misnamed. We call ourselves Homo sapiens, the wise man, but thats more of a boast than a description. What makes us wise? What sets us apart from other animals? Various answers have been proposed  language, tools, cooperation, culture, tasting bad to predators  but none is unique to humans.

title: Preakness 2017 Picks: Experts Predictions to Win, Place and Show
description: BALTIMORE  One down, two to go. After a 2 3/4-length victory in the Kentucky Derby, Always Dreaming will try to pick up the second jewel of the Triple Crown on Saturday in the Preakness Stakes. Nine horses are set to line up against him, including some he beat in the Derby, and some new contenders. Always Dreaming will be the favorite, but will he win? The New York Timess experts are skeptical.

title: In Iran, Heavy Voter Turnout Seen as a Plus for President Rouhani
description: TEHRAN  Iranians lined up at polling places in such numbers on Friday that Iranian election officials extended the voting three separate times, first by two hours, then four hours and finally five hours.

title: Sudans President Will Skip Saudi Meeting With Trump
description: President Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan  indicted by the International Criminal Court on charges including genocide, war crimes and crimes against humanity  will not attend a meeting in Saudi Arabia alongside President Trump, the Sudanese state news agency said on Friday.

title: Acrimony and Accusations in G.O.P. Debate for New Jersey Governor
description: NEWARK  Visibly angered by weeks of negative campaign fliers and a new television ad attacking him, Jack Ciattarelli repeatedly fought back against his opponent in the Republican primary for New Jersey governor Thursday night, criticizing Kim Guadagnos plans for auditing the state government and questioning her political tactics in a fiery debate defined by interruptions and accusations.

title: Anthony Weiner Pleads Guilty to Federal Obscenity Charge
description: Anthony D. Weiner, the former Democratic congressman whose sexting scandals ended his political career and embroiled him in a tumultuous F.B.I. investigation of Hillary Clinton before the election, pleaded guilty to a felony on Friday, crying openly as he admitted to conduct that he knew was as morally wrong as it was unlawful.

title: California Today: Silicon Valleys Secret Sauce
description: Good morning.

title: The Young Flee the G.O.P.
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: 1967: U.S. and Russia Stall on Nonproliferation
description: GENEVA  The United States and the Soviet Union told the resumed disarmament conference today they are still at odds on a treaty to prevent the further spread of nuclear weapons. Both nations promised, however, to do all they can to introduce a joint draft treaty for universal negotiation and acceptance.

title: They Could Buy, but Why? Meet the High-Renters
description: Since moving to New York City 16 years ago, Timothy Brown has lived in seven rentals, a succession of studios and one-bedrooms in Brooklyn, Chelsea, Murray Hill and now Kips Bay, where he has been subletting in a postwar high-rise condo for the last three years.

title: Scots on the Rocks and Jo Nesbos Latest: The Best New Crime Fiction
description: Theres no point waiting for Denise Minas two dependable series sleuths, Alex Morrow and Paddy Meehan, to appear in THE LONG DROP (Little, Brown, $26), which is a drastic departure from her brilliant contemporary studies of criminals who prey on Glasgows social underclass. This new novel takes its story from the Burnside murders, a true crime spree that horrified the city in the late 1950s. William Watt, the owner of a string of bakery shops, is innocent of the murder of his wife, his sister-in-law and his daughter, but although the police cant prove otherwise, theyre convinced of his guilt. So Watt sets out to convince them that the real killer is Peter Manuel by  wait for it!  taking him out on a bender and jollying him into a confession.

title: Theres More Than One Way to Shave a Cat
description: Cats arent easy to groom. They have sharp teeth and claws, and an outsize estimation of their own dignity. Nevertheless, if theyre longhaired, and the hair gets matted, something must be done.

title: Glenda Jackson to Return to Broadway in Albees Three Tall Women
description: LONDON  Glenda Jackson, the Oscar-winning actress and former member of the British Parliament who returned to the stage last fall at the age of 80 as King Lear, will star on Broadway next year in Edward Albees play Three Tall Women, the producers announced on Thursday.

title: Black Judge Refuses to Recuse Himself in Shooting by White Officer
description: An Alabama judge who once complained on Facebook of being racially profiled by the police refused on Thursday to recuse himself in a case involving a white police officers fatal shooting of a black man.

title: Saturday Night Live: The Most Memorable Moments This Season
description: Alec Baldwin pursing his lips, squinting his eyes, saying Jina. Melissa McCarthy plowing a podium into a crowd of reporters. Kate McKinnon pivoting from a self-absorbed Hillary Clinton to a deer-in-the-headlights Kellyanne Conway.

title: Japanese Transgender Politician Is Showing I Exist Here
description: IRUMA, Japan  In addition to his name and title, the business card of Tomoya Hosoda, a city councilman in a suburb of Tokyo, bears a unique description.

title: The Irresistible Cavaliers. The Immovable Warriors.
description: Ever since the Cavaliers came back to beat the Warriors in last years N.B.A. Finals, just about everyone has been counting the days until the expected rematch this season.

title: Q&A: A Smarter Way to Clean Your Home
description: Every home  big, small, apartment or vacation home  gets dirty. And while theres not just one way to clean your living space, there is a smarter way to get the job done.

title: The Red Shoes and Brigadoon: City Centers New Season
description: Sara Mearns, the New York City Ballet principal dancer, will star in Matthew Bournes ballet adaptation of The Red Shoes, which had its premiere in Britain last year and will have its New York premiere this fall as part of the coming season at New York City Center.

title: The Little-Known Statistician Who Taught Us to Measure Teachers
description: Students enroll in a teachers classroom. Nine months later, they take a test. How much did the first event, the teaching, cause the second event, the test scores? Students have vastly different abilities and backgrounds. A great teacher could see lower test scores after being assigned unusually hard-to-teach kids. A mediocre teacher could see higher scores after getting a class of geniuses.

title: Live on Instagram at 3 a.m.: Iranian Presidential Candidates
description: It was 3 a.m., and I was at a bar in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, when I first got the notification on my phone. President Hassan Rouhani of Iran, who is seeking a second term, was broadcasting a live video on Instagram. Its impossible to get Instagram videos once they are no longer live, so this was my one chance to catch Mr. Rouhanis speech. I ducked into the bathroom to listen in. Then, about 20 minutes later, Ebrahim Raisi, the hard-liner candidate, started a live stream of his own. The bartender and people sitting at the bar watched as I went back and forth to the bathroom wearing my headphones, clutching my phone and whiskey.

title: Maurizio Pollini to Play Chopin at Carnegie Hall
description: At 75, the pianist Maurizio Pollini may no longer be the guarantor of crystalline precision he was for much of his storied career. In recent years, bouts of illness have cut holes in his concertizing schedule, and reviewers of his solo recitals almost always mention the odd fudged run or transition. But the adoring fans who continue to seek him out, and who will almost certainly muster at Carnegie Hall on Sunday, May 21, dont just attend to pay tribute to a memory. Mr. Pollini continues to be a master of unmannered elegance and cleareyed storytelling, especially so in the music of Chopin, to which this recital made up principally of nocturnes and ballades is dedicated.

title: Bloodline Returns With Murder and Madness in the Florida Keys
description: Were not bad people, but we did a bad thing. Or so John Rayburn (Kyle Chandler) has been reassuring viewers  and himself  since the dawn of Bloodline, when he morphed from the keeper of his menacing older brother, Danny (Ben Mendelsohn), into his murderer.

title: Mark Rydens Stage Confections at Paul Kasmin Gallery
description: Painters and choreographers have a history of collaboration; Marc Chagall designed the sets and costumes for Adolph Bolms Firebird at Ballet Theater in 1945, and Marcel Dzama did the same for Justin Pecks The Most Incredible Thing with City Ballet last year.

title: 6 Essential Things to Know as Iran Votes for President Today
description: Hassan Rouhani, the incumbent, favors engagement with the West and greater personal freedom. He is responsible for the nuclear deal that relaxed economic sanctions on the country.

title: Afghan Whigs: 90s Alternative Rockers, With Strings and Horns
description: On In Spades, the second album of the decade from the reunited 90s alternative rock band Afghan Whigs, the singer and unlikely sex symbol Greg Dulli cant help but be his carnal, brooding self.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Mike Trout: Baseballs Best, Without the Brand
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  It was Mike Trout bobblehead night at Angel Stadium on Tuesday, but if you missed it, dont worry. There are three more on the Angels schedule. Trouts face appears on billboards throughout greater Los Angeles, and you can also find him pitching sandwiches, sports drinks, SuperPretzels and shoes. A recent Twitter post, to 2.25 million followers, promoted a video-game app he endorses.

title: Copy Edit This! Quiz No. 6
description: The Timess standards editor, Philip B. Corbett, invites readers to correct grammatical errors in recent New York Times articles.

title: On the Frivolities of Ballet, the Contradictory Art
description: Is ballet a serious art or a frivolous one? Very often, its both at the same time. Since frivolous means lacking in seriousness  also lightweight, flippant, of little weight or importance  that would seem a contradiction in terms.

title: The Caan Film Festival? Yes, Caan.
description: Cant make it to the south of France to catch a movie this week? The Museum of the Moving Image in Queens provides a puckish alternative: the Caan Film Festival. James Caan.

title: DanceAfrica at BAM Explores a Diasporas Traditions
description: Every May for the past 40 years, the streets around the Brooklyn Academy of Music in Fort Greene have been vibrant with the sights and sounds of DanceAfrica, which is billed as the nations largest festival of African dance. Founded by Chuck Davis and now directed by Abdel R. Salaam, the event brings together dancers, musicians and artists representing many traditions of Africa and its diaspora.

title: Grime Sets Todays Music Agenda in Britain, and Tomorrows
description: In England, few musicians have a higher profile than the grime star Stormzy: Adele recently acknowledged him from the stage during a performance; he vocally supported the Labour politician Jeremy Corbyn; and it was national news when a neighbor called the police on him as he was returning to his home in a well-to-do West London neighborhood. He makes a cameo on the current season of the tastemaking British TV hit Chewing Gum and appears on Good Goodbye, a song from the new Linkin Park album, and on an official remix of Shape of You, Ed Sheerans global pop hit, which the two performed together at the Brit Awards in February, a year after Stormzy publicly criticized the event for its lack of recognition of grime.

title: W. Kamau Bell on Being a Semi-Prominent Black Comedian
description: THE AWKWARD THOUGHTS OF W. KAMAU BELL Tales of a 64, African-American, Heterosexual, Cisgender, Left-Leaning, Asthmatic, Black and Proud Blerd, Mamas Boy, Dad, and Stand-Up Comedian Written and read by W. Kamau Bell 10 hours. Penguin Audio.

title: Fairy Tales, Gently Fractured
description: FROGKISSER! By Garth Nix Read by Marisa Calin 11 hours. Listening Library. (Middle grade; ages 10 and up)

title: Uncovering Missing or Deleted Photos
description: Q. I recently tried to move vacation photos from my cameras SD card to an external hard drive, via my Mac. It seemed as if everything had been transferred, so I deleted the content from the cards so I could reuse them. However, when I plugged my external hard drive in to look at the photos, the pictures werent there and I still havent found them! Any ideas as to how to get them back?

title: Stanley Greene, Teller of Uncomfortable Truths, Dies at 68
description: Stanley Greene, a founding member of Noor Images who covered global conflicts with unblinking honesty, has died in Paris.

title: Stanley Greene, Teller of Uncomfortable Truths, Dies at 68
description: Stanley Greene, who started as a music and fashion photographer and later became one of the leading international conflict photographers, died Friday in Paris at age 68. A founding member of the photographer-owned agency Noor Images, he had been ill with liver cancer for several years, associates said.

title: Russia and Syria Denounce U.S. Airstrike on Pro-Assad Militia
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Russian and Syrian officials on Friday strongly condemned an American airstrike on pro-Syrian government forces in southern Syria a day earlier, calling it an act of aggression and rejecting the United States justification for the attack.

title: Fiat Chrysler to Modify 100,000 Vehicles After Accusations of Emissions Cheating
description: Fiat Chrysler said on Friday that it would modify around 100,000 diesel vehicles to try to reach a settlement with United States regulators, as separate academic studies provided mounting evidence that the carmaker had installed software meant to evade emissions standards.

title: Duterte Says Xi Warned Philippines of War Over South China Sea
description: MANILA  Chinas president warned the Philippines that it would go to war if Manila insisted on enforcing an international arbitration decision rejecting Chinas claims over disputed areas of the South China Sea, the Philippine president said in a televised speech on Friday.

title: Beloved Burrata Finds a Springtime Match
description: Fresh Italian cheeses, such as mozzarella di bufala, fior di latte and ricotta, are best eaten as soon as they are made, when they taste utterly pure, sweet and milky. Or at least thats the wished for, if seldom experienced, ideal.

title: Daily Report: Europe Gets Tough on Facebook
description: It has been some time since a technology company ran afoul of antitrust investigators in the United States. But in Europe, its an entirely different story.

title: On the Donald Trump Investigation
description: How the tables have turned.

title: Rent Too High? Try the Next Subway Stop
description: In New York City, the rents are high, but the subway provides access to many neighborhoods  and housing in a range of prices. To help prospective renters find the best deal, RentHop, a real estate website, recently created a subway map with information on the median rent for a one-bedroom in the area immediately around each station. The site calculated these numbers by looking at apartment listings in an eighth-of-a-mile radius, using data from the first quarter of 2017.

title: A Ukrainian Comes to Washington, Urging His Nation Not Be Forgotten
description: WASHINGTON  It had been a long day for Arseniy P. Yatsenyuk by the time he finally sat down at a sidewalk table outside his hotel and sipped a glass of wine one evening this week. He had been to the White House and the State Department, stopped by Congress and visited a think tank.

title: Freezing Temperatures, Glacial Winds, Volcanic Dust: All in a Days Work for Times Team in Antarctica
description: In this Times Insider piece, Jonathan Corum explains how a team of four reporters and videographers were able to shoot a series of virtual-reality films in Antarctica, without seeing any of the footage.

title: 10 Things to Do in NYC Now
description: For over a decade, Mr. Scott, 34, has carried his precise and restless vision across shifting terrain. Most recently, hes been fusing new developments in hip-hop with the linguistics of contemporary jazz and the West African-derived music of New Orleans. All the while, he has maintained a core group of musical associates, working up a productive tension between his fastidious vision and the will of his allies. This year, Mr. Scott will release three albums (Ruler Rebel is already out), and on Saturday night hell perform some of that new material alongside the flutist Elena Pinderhughes, the alto saxophonist Logan Richardson, the keyboardist Lawrence Fields, the bassist Luques Curtis, the drummer Corey Fonville and the percussionist Themba Mkhatshwa. GIOVANNI RUSSONELLO

title: James Comey to Testify in Public Senate Hearing About Russia Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director, will testify publicly about his role in the investigation into Russian meddling in the election and any possible connections to the campaign of President Trump, the Senate Intelligence Committee announced Friday.

title: Listen to a Twin Peaks Fantasy for String Quartet
description: Diane, its 9:07 a.m., Ive just listened to some music inspired by Angelo Badalamentis score for Twin Peaks, played by a string quartet. The Dover Quartet. The piece, Twin Peaks Fantasy, is a work in progress by the composer Daniel Schlosberg. Gather the others at the Bureau, get that morning cup of coffee, and listen here:

title: Steer Clear of This Bad Idea: Cash Advances on Credit Cards
description: Everyone hits an unexpected bill or expense now and then  a car breaks down, an air-conditioner fails during a heat wave, a relative needs medical care.

title: How the Wealthy Talk to Their Children About Money
description: Ron Weiner remembers sitting his two girls down to discuss the amount of money they stood to inherit. One was in college and the other in high school at the time, and they wanted nothing to do with the conversation.

title: Amber Tamblyn Rallies Her Troops to the Red Carpet
description: The actress and poet Amber Tamblyn has just added director to her rsum, with the new indie film Paint It Black, which opened on Friday. Still, theres multitasking and theres multitasking.

title: N.A.A.C.P., Energized by Liberal Activists, Dismisses Its President
description: WASHINGTON  The national board of the N.A.A.C.P. voted Friday to dismiss the organizations president, Cornell William Brooks, after only three years, pledging a systemwide refresh at the nations largest and most storied civil rights group in order to confront President Trump more vigorously.

title: Joshua Ferris on The Dinner Party
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music

title: From Condoleezza Rice, Tales of Diplomacy and Unrequited Love
description: MUSE OF MUAMMAR: Condoleezza Rices Democracy is new on the hardcover nonfiction list, at No. 4, and plenty of observers have already commented on its sober, high-minded rhetoric about Americas role in the world. So Ill dish instead. Who knew that during Rices days as secretary of state, the former Libyan strongman Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi was besotted with her? I support my darling black African woman, he said of Rice during a 2007 interview with the network Al Jazeera. I admire and am very proud of the way she leans back and gives orders to the Arab leaders. He added: Yes, Leezza, Leezza, Leezza.  I love her very much. So when Rice included Tripoli on a visit to the Middle East the following year, there were some decidedly uncomfortable undercurrents in her meeting with Qaddafi. It had been a really strange trip, she writes, setting aside her usual diplomacy. I awoke with that sensation one has after a bizarre dream. Did I really just sit in his kitchen and have dinner with his female security guards who many believe are also his daughters? Did he really give me a video  with pictures of me set to music  called Black Flower in the White House? O.K. Whatever his weird affection for you, thank the Lord, that visit is over. Time to move on.

title: When Power Makes Leaders More Sensitive
description: Ive long heard the old warning about leaders who rise too high. Power tends to corrupt, and absolute power corrupts absolutely, Lord Acton once said.

title: Ryan Fitzpatrick Signs With Tampa Bay Buccaneers
description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers signed the veteran quarterback Ryan Fitzpatrick to back up their starter, Jameis Winston.

title: Harry Styles and John Mayer, Teardrops on Their Guitars
description: The Popcast is hosted by Jon Caramanica, a pop music critic for The New York Times. It covers the latest in pop music criticism, trends and news.

title: A Guide to Writing Guides
description: If I had to guess, Id say there are about 85 million books about how to write well. (This week, Jim Holt reviews Harold Evanss Do I Make Myself Clear?) If you tried to read them all youd never get around to writing, so I asked some of my most bookish colleagues for their favorites in the genre.

title: The Zen of Dying
description: Anthony Valentine, 72, is a hospice nurse at the nonprofit Zen Hospice Project in San Francisco.

title: An Adventurous First Season for Skirball Centers New Director
description: When Jay Wegman announced last year that he would leave his post as artistic director of Abrons Arts Center to lead N.Y.U.s Skirball Center for the Performing Arts, he said he would want to embrace the Broadway-like scale of his new theater and make it a place where uptown meets downtown.

title: Monicas 3 Movies to Stream or Rent This Weekend
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation newsletter and website.

title: In the Stock Market, International Is Actually First
description: In his first speech as president of the United States, Donald J. Trump declared, From this day forward, it is going to be only America first, America first.

title: A Toothy Strongman Gets a Role at the Met Opera
description: Performers who dreamed of appearing at the Metropolitan Opera have tried many things over the decades, but until this week none have ever used their teeth to lift a director off the floor.

title: Review: A Quartet With Sunny Energy and Grunge-Band Grit
description: Each year the movie industry gives out Oscars for the best performances in supporting roles. Its too bad that theres no similar award in chamber music. If someone would kindly fund one, Id like to nominate Estelle Choi, the cellist of the Calidore String Quartet.

title: Roll Call Reporter Says F.C.C. Security Pinned Him to a Wall
description: A reporter said he was pinned against a wall by two security officials in a public hallway at the Federal Communications Commission in Washington on Thursday after he tried to ask a question of a commissioner.

title: Strawberry and Pistachio Galette
description: Pistachio frangipane and strawberry compote give a subtle sophistication to this casual tart.

title: A Galette That Lets Early Strawberries Shine
description: Galettes are generally casual desserts, made with just a rolling pin, a baking sheet and an oven. These free-form tarts can be filled with any fruit and will bake up bubbling and golden, no matter how slapdash you think youve been when folding them up.

title: Maria Sharapova Will Play in Qualifying Rounds for Wimbledon
description: ROME  Three days after being denied entry to the French Open by the French Tennis Federation, Maria Sharapova announced she would not ask for a wild card into the main draw at Wimbledon. Sharapova will instead play in the qualifying rounds, which are held the week before the tournament in the suburb of Roehampton.

title: Planning to Age in Place? Find a Contractor Now
description: All the carpets are coming up, so they wont be a trip hazard, said Ernie MacNeill, walking through the split-level house in Fair Lawn, N.J., that he is remodeling for a client who struggles to walk.

title: Anne R. Dick, Memoirist and Writers Muse, Is Dead at 90
description: Philip K. Dick was a writer of modest accomplishment when he met Anne Rubenstein in late 1958. By the time the couple broke up less than six years later, Dick had written more than a dozen novels and was well on his way to eminence as one of the most influential of postwar American writers.

title: Steven Cohen Makes a Comeback at Premier Hedge Fund Conference
description: LAS VEGAS  The billionaire investor Steven A. Cohen may be barred from managing outside money until next year, but he has already hinted that he plans to get back into the hedge game.

title: Angry About Subway Delays? De Blasio Says Blame Cuomo, and Vice Versa
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio, with delay-fatigued transit riders as his latest backdrop, lashed out with a fury at Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo during a radio interview on Friday, opening a new front in the yearslong public feud between the Democratic leaders.

title: Petra
description: A 1991 performance with Maryanne Amacher and Marianne Schroeder.

title: Anthony Weiners Plea Agreement
description: Anthony D. Weiner, the former Democratic congressman, pleaded guilty to transferring obscene material to a minor, ending a federal investigation into sexually explicit pictures and messages that he sent last year to a 15-year-old girl.

title: An Unfortunate Record for Congo: Thousands Flee Cells in Biggest Jailbreak
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Long plagued by corruption and inept government, people in the Democratic Republic of Congo were confronting a new problem on Friday: thousands of prisoners on the lam, including hard-core felons and possibly war criminals.

title: Afghan Vice President Flies to Turkey Amid Torture and Rape Allegations
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  In the dark of night and amid a criminal investigation into rape accusations against him, Afghanistans embattled vice president, Gen. Abdul Rashid Dostum, left for Turkey on Friday in what Afghan and Western officials suggested could be another long exile for the former warlord.

description: A convicted robber in Colorado was granted a full pardon by Gov. John Hickenlooper on Friday, two days after he was detained by immigration officials upon his release from state custody by a judges order.

title: New York City Landlords Are Offering Deals
description: New York Citys rental season kicks into high gear this month, as college graduates start looking for apartments, along with anyone else hoping to move when the weather is warm and school is out. Most years, apartment hunters see rents rise with the temperature. But this season, as the rental market enters its third slow year, renters may instead see some deals.

The New York Philharmonic held its spring fund-raiser on May 11 at Lincoln Center, with a Breakfast at Tiffanys performance. El Museo del Barrio held a gala on May 11 at the Plaza hotel. The National Ethnic Coalition of Organizations handed out medals on Ellis Island on May 13.

description: Excerpts  Tower Metals, Feed2 and Muse Orchestra 1  from the Maryanne Amacher album Sound Characters.

description: If youre looking for the funniest way to say, Go kill yourself, listen closely to Norm Macdonald.

description: To the Editor:

title: Trump Told Russians That Firing Nut Job Comey Eased Pressure From Investigation
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump told Russian officials in the Oval Office this month that firing the F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, had relieved great pressure on him, according to a document summarizing the meeting.

title: Raise a Glass to Pippa!
description: Pippa Middleton, sister of Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge (the former Kate Middleton) married James Matthews, a hedge fund manager, on Saturday in lavish style in Berkshire, England. Much like the current White House, the team behind Pippas wedding has not been immune to leaks about everything from the guest list to her wardrobe mandates  or, here, a draft of Pippas annotated wedding toast.

title: Trump Sees a Nut Job and a Witch Hunt
description: To the Editor:

title: Italian in Europes Parliament Convicted of Defamation for Racial Insult
description: ROME  An Italian member of the European Parliament has been found guilty of defamation and ordered to pay 50,000 euros, or $55,670, in damages to a fellow member of the European Union body, four years after he was accused of racially insulting her during a radio interview.

title: The Boy Scouts Can Do a Good Turn Finally
description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints last week announced a plan to scale back its involvement in the Boy Scouts of America by removing from the organization all Mormon boys between the ages of 14 and 18, estimated to be around 185,000 scouts. Many observers have speculated that the 100-year partnership between the Mormon Church and the Boy Scouts of America was dissolving over values, because of the scout organizations evolving view of homosexuality and its moves to end historic practices of discrimination.

title: Reviving the Ghostly Sounds of Maryanne Amacher
description: It had texture, the composer George Lewis said recently, recalling the very loud yet very subtle electronic music of Maryanne Amacher. It had ghost things inside. I think she actually said, You have to listen for the ghosts. And then once you started hearing them, they were always there.

title: You Still Need Your Brain
description: Most adults recall memorizing the names of rivers or the Pythagorean theorem in school and wondering, When am I ever gonna use this stuff? Kids today have a high-profile spokesman. Jonathan Rochelle, the director of Googles education apps group, said last year at an industry conference that he cannot answer why his children should learn the quadratic equation. He wonders why they cannot ask Google. If Mr. Rochelle cannot answer his children, I can.

title: Netflix Defends Strategy at Cannes: The Culture Is Changing
description: CANNES, France  As controversy continued to swirl here over the presence of two Netflix titles that are playing in the Cannes Film Festivals main competition but wont appear in any French theaters, the streaming giant finally broke its silence with a message that could be summed up as: The culture is changing and we listen to our 100 million customers.

title: Canada Today: Burning Schoolhouses, Vanishing Ice and Urban Birds
description: Victoria Day, Mondays holiday for federal public servants and everyone else in most provinces, is a curious thing. Australia has its own Victoria Day, which commemorates the formation of the state of the same name. By all accounts, Canada is the only place that marks the birthday of Queen Victoria.

title: A Womans Decision to Give Birth or Abort
description: To the Editor:

title: A Cultural Compendium: 7 Things Were Into Right Now
description: FrankLloyd Wright was funny about his birthday, occasionally fudging the year in favor of youth, but 2017 marks his actual sesquicentennial  to be celebrated with various exhibitions across the country. Here in New York, Wright aficionados who might otherwise be straining their necks at the Guggenheim will head to MoMA for Frank Lloyd Wright at 150: Unpacking the Archive, not your typical monograph of the architects masterpieces. Curator Barry Bergdoll invited a handpicked group of scholars to explore the vast Wright archive that the museum comanages with Columbias Avery Library, then organized the show around the objects they found most compelling. The historian Jennifer Gray used a little-known Wright-designed logo for a conservation group to examine his ideas about the prairie. Ken Tadashi Oshima, a specialist on East-West influences in design, found an old book of images of the Imperial Hotel, with rickshaws and automobiles pictured out front. Its not some big statement, Bergdoll says. More a kaleidoscope of facets meant to open new lines of inquiry.  KATE GUADAGNINO

title: What 15 People Wore to Solanges All-White Guggenheim Performance
description: When Solange speaks, we all listen, one showgoer said of her performance on Thursday night.

title: At Fox News, Another Prominent Host Is Fired, and Another Week of Tough Headlines
description: For Fox News, it was another unkind week in an unkind year.

title: Solange Knowles Tears Down Barriers at the Guggenheim
description: A kind of pagan spirituality threads its way through Solange Knowless music videos, and her followers have picked up on that. Shes a witch in the best possible way, said Stephanie Griffin, a photographer, 26.

title: Bangladesh Police Raid Gay Mens Gathering
description: NEW DELHI  The police in Bangladesh raided a monthly gathering of gay men at a community center on the outskirts of Dhaka early Friday and arrested 27 men on suspicion of drug-related offenses, officials said.

title: A Rental Building With a Hip Hotel Bar Vibe
description: A few years ago, Eric Birnbaum, a partner at Imperial Companies, was enjoying a drink at the buzzing lobby bar of the Bowery Hotel when he was struck by a question: Why couldnt the lobby of a residential building have just as much energy as a happening boutique hotel?

title: AT&T Workers Start 3-Day Strike in Contract Impasse
description: More than 35,000 AT&T workers began a weekend-long strike on Friday after their union accused the company of failing to make a fair proposal during contract negotiations.

title: Review: Another Downton Abbey Heroine Goes Dark
description: The Downton Abbey diaspora continues. Actresses keep fleeing the genteel personas the show saddled them with, finding refuge in seamier characters. Jessica Brown Findlay: from Lady Sybil to a prostitute on Harlots. Michelle Dockery: from Lady Mary to a sexy con woman on Good Behavior. Laura Carmichael: from Lady Edith to the loathsome mistress in The Maids onstage.

title: Dubious Corporate Practices Get a Rubber Stamp From Big Investors
description: Institutional asset managers, overseeing trillions of other peoples investment dollars, carry enormous clout across corporate America. They can use the power and weight of their clients shares in public companies to vote for change on crucial matters, like outsize executive pay and anti-investor antics in the boardroom.

title: VC Polo Anniversay Teaser 2
description: summary 2

title: Here Is Your Fall 2017 TV Schedule
description: 7: AMERICAS FUNNIEST HOME VIDEOS  More clips of pet shenanigans, groin injuries and other indignities.

title: The Playlist: Selena Gomez Goes Low-Gloss, and Camila Cabello Flees Fifth Harmony
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. You can listen to this playlist on Spotify here. Like this Playlist? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com, and sign up for our Louder newsletter here.

title: Baby Boomers Look to Senior Concierge Services to Raise Income
description: In her 40 years as a photographer in the Denver area, Jill Kaplan did not think she would need her social work degree.

title: Trump Budget Would Cut E.P.A. Science Programs and Slash Cleanups
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps fiscal 2018 budget proposal would cut the Environmental Protection Agencys Office of Science and Technology nearly in half, while paring by 40 percent funding for E.P.A. employees who oversee and put in place environmental regulations, according to a White House document that was shared with The New York Times.

title: Drag Queen Story Hour Puts the Rainbow in Reading
description: Story hour, long a mommy-and-me staple, had never looked so colorful.

title: Opening First Foreign Trip, Donald Trump Tries to Leave Crisis Behind
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump embarked on Friday on his first foreign mission since taking office, beginning a challenging nine-day, multistop, multifaceted journey to the Middle East and Europe and leaving behind a capital consumed by investigations and intrigue.

title: Where to Stream Previous Cannes Film Festival Winners
description: The Cannes Film Festival, which is currently presenting its 70th edition, is one of the premiere film events in the world. Many of its top prize winners have taken their place in the cinematic canon. Here are just a few  one from each decade of the festivals existence  that are available to stream now:

title: Always Dreaming and Classic Empire Size Each Other Up for Round 2 at Preakness
description: BALTIMORE  Always Dreaming and Classic Empire, two favorites in the Preakness Stakes here Saturday, have not been sent to separate corners  in fact, they share the barn here along with their rivals. In the days leading up to the 142nd running of the Preakness, however, the two colts have been spoken of as boxers, and the humans around the more bloodied one, Classic Empire, are itching for a rematch.

title: The Starter Tool Kit
description: Every home needs a good tool kit. Whether you live in a new apartment in the city or a century-old house in the suburbs, eventually you will need to do some home improvements.

title: Spotting Mysterious Twinkles on Earth From a Million Miles Away
description: When we look up at the night sky, we see twinkling stars. When a satellite orbiting a million miles away looks down upon Earth, it sees twinkles, too.

title: Intoned Absurdity: This Weeks 8 Best Classical Music Moments
description: In addition to reviews, features and news during the week, our critics and reporters collect the best of what theyve heard: notes that sent shivers down their spines, memorable voices, quotations that cut to the heart of the story.

title: A Radical Redo for Madama Butterfly  to Save It?
description: When Anna Netrebko appeared in full old-fashioned geisha get-up at the recent gala concert celebrating the Metropolitan Operas 50th anniversary at Lincoln Center, you didnt need to look at your program to know that she would be performing Un bel d, the most recognizable aria from Puccinis Madama Butterfly.

title: From a Super Bunhead to a Lead Dancer
description: Wearing a red print sundress and glamorous makeup, right down to her false eyelashes, Christine Shevchenko entered the media room at the Metropolitan Opera House looking as if she were en route to a garden party. Had she really just danced her first lead in a full-length ballet  the arduous, three-act Don Quixote  at American Ballet Theaters Wednesday matinee?

title: Review: Solange Turns the Guggenheim Into a Sanctuary for Dance
description: When the choreographer Trisha Brown died in March, Solange Knowles posted a tribute on Twitter: Rest in movement, Trisha Brown. Seeing In Plain Sight gave me so much confidence in the power of peace through dance.

description: See what Nicki Minaj, Tracee Ellis Ross, Nicole Kidman and others wore on the red carpet.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: Iowa Man Is Sentenced to 2 Life Terms in Killings of 2 Officers
description: An Iowa man was sentenced on Friday to two consecutive life terms in prison for ambushing and killing two police officers in the Des Moines area early one morning last November.

title: What to Cook, Watch, Listen To and More This Weekend
description: Were deep into everyones favorite part of the season: Spring cleaning!

title: For Family of Times Square Crash Victim, Nothing Is Safe Anymore
description: Each year the Elsman girls went with family members on a trip, a vacation the two teenagers anticipated all year. On Thursday morning they were strolling the neon-trimmed heart of New York City when a motorist jumped the curb and plowed through three blocks of Times Square sidewalk and into crowds of pedestrians. Twenty people were injured, including 13-year-old Ava Elsman.

title: Water Utilities Worldwide Face a Growing Need for Investment
description: Shares of the Brazilian water utility Sabesp took a dip this week after it said it might raise new equity. Investors everywhere, however, will have to get used to such capital calls.

description: The cities Mr. Trump will visit and what events are planned.

description: Academic philosophy has resembled a battleground in recent years, and not just because of its famously bare-knuckled argumentative style.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Cracking Washingtons Gridlock to Save the Planet
description: One day, ideally in the not-too-distant future, when Congress finally passes major legislation to curb carbon emissions  to reduce the environmental and economic harm caused by climate change  Americans will owe a big thank you to the perseverance and discipline of the Citizens Climate Lobby. Special appreciation should go to one volunteer, Jay Butera, a businessman from Pennsylvania who has put intense effort into getting Democrats and Republicans in Congress to begin talking with one another about potential solutions.

title: Genetic Tidying Up Made Humped Bladderworts Into Carnivorous Plants
description: Greetings, human. Have you met the humped bladderwort?

title: How a Golf Course Is Reshaping a New Orleans Neighborhood
description: NEW ORLEANS  With unbridled enthusiasm, Jonathan Ashford arranged nine plastic foam cups around the rug of the Columbia Parc community center and sank putts on his makeshift course as if his dinner that night depended on it.

title: The Daily Special Edition: What Trump Told the Russians About Firing Comey
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: What Saudis Get (or Not) in $110 Billion Arms Deal With U.S.
description: The New York Times reporter Mark Landler details the U.S.'s 10-year, $110 billion weapons deal with the Saudis, and what it means for both sides.

title: Dominant on Clay, Rafael Nadal Hits a Bump Before the French Open
description: ROME  Perfect on his beloved clay through three tournaments this year, Rafael Nadal ended his warm-ups for the French Open with a defeat, falling, 6-4, 6-3, to Dominic Thiem on Friday in the quarterfinals of the Italian Open.

title: James Donovan Backs Out as Nominee for No. 2 Treasury Job
description: James Donovan, the Goldman Sachs executive who was poised to become deputy Treasury secretary, is backing out of consideration.

title: Kevin Durant Is Certain Kawhi Leonard Will Play  100 Percent
description: SAN ANTONIO  Kevin Durant stepped off the Golden State Warriors practice court on Friday afternoon and made some news. Durant said he was 100 percent certain that Kawhi Leonard, hampered by an ankle injury, would play for the San Antonio Spurs on Saturday night in Game 3 of the N.B.A.s Western Conference finals.

title: Trump Goes Abroad. Nixon Tried the Same Thing.
description: President Trump left for the Middle East and Europe today, amid a domestic firestorm that is fanned by concerns over intelligence leaks and hints of obstruction of justice. Leaving home for foreign lands may seem to be just what the president needs, and his advisers can be forgiven for believing that a respite from domestic politics could be useful: Mr. Trump will probably be well received by foreign leaders, particularly those in the Middle East.

title: Justice Department Complaint Against UnitedHealth
description: The Justice Department filed a lawsuit against UnitedHealth Group, contending that senior executives knew the company was overbilling Medicare by hundreds of millions of dollars a year. The department is joining a whistle-blower suit filed earlier by a former UnitedHealth finance director, Benjamin Poehling.

title: William Brohn, Who Made Broadway Orchestras Sing, Dies at 84
description: William Brohn, one of musical theaters top orchestrators, who worked on more than a dozen Broadway shows and won a Tony in 1998 for Ragtime, died on May 11 in New Haven. He was 84.

title: Education Dept. Keeps Obama Plan to Streamline Loan System
description: The Education Department on Friday took up an Obama-era plan to streamline federal student loan servicing by moving to a new, single platform for managing the loans of 43 million borrowers.

title: Corrections: May 20, 2017
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Quotation of the Day:Where Every Syllable Is a Laughing Matter
description: New York City was the site of my great success. I made it there, and then I didnt make it anywhere else. I guess Frank Sinatra isnt so smart after all.

title: TV in the Age of Trump: Musicals, Murders and the Military
description: Musicals, murders and the military.

title: Mets Seek to Gain Control of a Season in Danger of Slipping Away
description: As is standard practice before the start of a Mets homestand, General Manager Sandy Alderson addressed reporters before Friday nights game against the Los Angeles Angels at Citi Field.

title: UnitedHealth Overbilled Medicare by Billions, U.S. Says in Suit
description: The Justice Department has sued UnitedHealth Group, saying that senior executives knew the company was overbilling Medicare by hundreds of millions of dollars a year, and halted a repayment plan in 2014 so the money could be used to meet Wall Streets revenue expectations.

title: Joe Girardi Preaches About Family. On Friday, He Practiced It.
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Shortly after pitcher Adam Warren arrived at spring training back in February, he gingerly walked into Manager Joe Girardis office.

title: Scandal in Brazil Raises Fear of Turmoils Return
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Just a few days ago, Brazil seemed to be turning a corner. The stock market was soaring. Bankers were cheering. The nations cutthroat lawmakers were lining up to curb spending. Inflation had been tamed.

title: Roger Ailes: The Man Who Wrecked Conservatism
description: Friends and colleagues who knew Roger Ailes better than I did attest that he was a nicer and more considerate man than most liberal obituarists will ever give him credit for. They add (and the same obituarists concede) that the creator of Fox News understood the art of political messaging better than just about anybody in the last 50 years.

title: From Lofty Perch, New Orleans Monument to Confederacy Comes Down
description: NEW ORLEANS  With the yank of a crane and to a cheer from the crowd, Robert E. Lee was lifted off his 80-foot perch, where he had been standing gazing north for most of 133 years, and slowly lowered to the ground.

title: Mattis Says Escalation Against ISIS Doesnt Imperil More Civilians
description: WASHINGTON  The United States began accelerating and intensifying its campaign against the Islamic State in January, at President Trumps direction, but it was not putting civilians in war zones at greater risk, the defense secretary said Friday.

title: Having Trouble Keeping Up With All the Trump News? Here Are the Must-Reads
description: Worried that you missed an important political story this week? Youre not alone. Catch up on a very busy week of news from the Trump Administration.

title: President Trump Tries to Engage the Muslim World
description: No American president in modern times has disparaged Islam as much as Donald Trump. From the attempted visa ban on Muslim-majority countries to his campaign claims that Islam hates us to his Islamaphobic advisers, the presidents record of hostility is well documented.

title: Stanley Greene, Whose Camera Captured Wars Brutality, Dies at 68
description: Stanley Greene, whose visceral and brutally honest images of conflict and fearlessness in the most perilous of places made him one of the leading war photographers of his generation, died on Friday in Paris. He was 68.

title: The Way Texas Treats Women
description: Abortion opponents have long sought to strip public funding from Planned Parenthood and other groups that provide abortions. In Texas, they succeeded.

title: Watch Out World, Trumps Coming
description: Donald Trump has gone abroad. Nine days. Five stops. Strange beds. Anything could happen.

title: Look Before You Leap
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  What a great mental workout. Paolo Pasco and David Steinberg have collaborated on a puzzle that will put most solvers through their paces, and the reward for this bit of work (20A) is a puzzle that sparkles with lively and clean entries, not to mention the Ooo, they got me! feeling that is so delicious when you think you know the answer but you really dont.

title: The Spring of G.O.P. Discontent
description: WASHINGTON  Now that Robert Mueller has been named special counsel, we can expect congressional Republicans to attempt a return to business as usual. Of course, thats all relative: President Trump will presumably continue to issue Twitter attacks on the investigation, leaks about his behavior are likely to continue (see the news on Friday about his comments on James Comey to the Russians) and the topic of obstruction of justice will still occupy many blocks of cable programming.

title: What Happens When Your Car Gets Hacked?
description: As devastating as the latest widespread ransomware attacks have been, its a problem with a solution. If your copy of Windows is relatively current and youve kept it updated, your laptop is immune. Its only older unpatched systems on your computer that are vulnerable.

title: Grand Jury Wont Indict Officer in Killing of Boy, 13, Who Held BB Gun
description: A grand jury in Columbus, Ohio, declined on Friday to indict a white police officer who fatally shot a 13-year-old black boy who was brandishing a BB gun, finding that the officers actions were justified, city officials and the police said.

title: Was Vietnam Winnable?
description: My interest in the Vietnam War began in the early 1990s, when I took a college course on the history of the conflict. Part of what drew me to the subject was the visceral contempt that my peers, professors and intellectuals generally had not just for the war, but for its veterans. It seemed to me a profound wrong that the young men who had risked their lives in Southeast Asia were deemed less worthy than those who had stayed safe at home.

title: Jacob deGrom Goes Seven Innings as Mets Halt a Seven-Game Skid
description: After throwing his 103rd pitch Friday night, Mets starter Jacob deGrom held his glove open, demanding the ball from catcher Rene Rivera. DeGrom had just struck out Danny Espinosa for the first out of the seventh inning, but he was still mired in trouble. Earlier in the inning, deGrom had struggled with his control, allowing the Los Angeles Angels to load the bases.

title: Explore the Architecture of This Years Pritzker Winners in Immersive Video
description: The Pritzker Prize, considered to be the Nobel of architecture, is usually awarded to one famous architect, like Renzo Piano or Philip Johnson. But this year the prize goes to relative unknowns, the first group of three to win: the partnership of Ramon Vilalta, Carme Pigem and Rafael Aranda, all from Spain.

title: The 2017 Pritzker-Winning Architecture
description: For the first time, a group of three architects have won the Pritzker Prize, the professions highest honor. In Catalonia, explore the buildings designed by the winners.

title: 133 Years Later, a Statue Comes Down
description: It took a whole day for the work to get done and two years of debate and deliberation to get there, but workers removed a statue of Robert E. Lee on Friday, capping an emotional process of change in New Orleans.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Robert De Niro in The Wizard of Lies and Dwayne Johnson on Saturday Night Live
description: Bernie Madoff gets the HBO treatment in The Wizard of Lies, starring Robert De Niro and Michelle Pfeiffer. (Compare it to Woody Allens fictionalized take in Blue Jasmine.) And Dwayne Johnson hosts Saturday Night Live for the fifth time.

title: Terence Crawfords Greatest Fight May Be With Himself
description: Terence Crawford will defend his world super lightweight title against Felix Diaz in the main event at Madison Square Garden on Saturday night.

title: Rouhani Wins Re-election in Iran by a Wide Margin
description: TEHRAN  Riding a large turnout from Irans urban middle classes, President Hassan Rouhani won re-election in a landslide on Saturday, giving him a mandate to continue his quest to expand personal freedoms and open Irans ailing economy to global investors.

title: Saudis Welcome Trumps Rebuff of Obamas Mideast Views
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  With trumpets blaring, cannons booming and fighter jets streaking overhead trailed by red, white and blue contrails, President Trump arrived in the scorching heat of the Arabian desert on Saturday hoping to realign the politics and diplomacy of the Middle East by forcefully reasserting American support for Sunni Muslim countries and Israel against Irans Shiite-led government.

title: Collect Evidence and Cover Your Backside
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.

title: The Conservative Force Behind Speeches Roiling College Campuses
description: BUFFALO  Lets give it up for the racists that are hosting this event! someone yelled, and the crowd roared, foot-stomping in unison, then breaking into song: Woody Guthries This Land Is Your Land. One member of the audience held up a sign, Queers Against Islamaphobia. Another unfurled a banner: Muslims Welcome. Fascists Get Out.

title: The Internet Is Broken: @ev Is Trying to Salvage It
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Evan Williams is the guy who opened up Pandoras box. Until he came along, people had few places to go with their overflowing emotions and wild opinions, other than writing a letter to the newspaper or haranguing the neighbors.

title: Characters in an Untitled Film Series
description: I remember when I first saw the Cindy Sherman Untitled Film Stills  that work really changed my expectations of how photography can be viewed, Mr. Michaels said. Especially that each of those photos could represent an untitled film that was never made. I wanted to explore that idea in Los Angeles.

title: 50 Years of Marriage and Mindfulness With Nena and Robert Thurman
description: WOODSTOCK, N.Y.  The lawn goldfish, to use Ganden Thurmans name for his parents three temple dogs, were trailing Nena Thurman in a wheezing cortege. Ms. Thurmans husband, Robert Thurman, the Buddhist scholar and activist, made his way down the twisting stairs of their idiosyncratic handmade house, and the two settled into a well-worn sofa, the dogs strewed on the floor.

title: That Voice, Those Parties: Remembering Jean Stein
description: To conjure Jean Stein you must first imagine the voice  a soft and breathy near-whisper, by turns merry or full of steel. It was a voice suited to late-night telephone conversations and dinners at the corner tables of now-forgotten Manhattan restaurants.

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: Caring About Tech News
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: 1917: Whole Country Must Mobilize to Win War, U.S. President Says
description: WASHINGTON  The President has issued a proclamation fixing June 5 as the date upon which all men aged from 21 to 30 shall register at the recruiting stations.

title: When a Roommate Wont Pay Up
description: Q. A year ago, I moved into an apartment in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, with a roommate. Both of our names are on the lease. Last February, my roommate moved out. She found someone to take her room, charging her $200 less a month than the rent she paid. On March 6, I told the new roommate that her rent would go up by $200 on April 1, when the original lease expired. Come April, she paid me the lower rent anyway. She is supposed to move out on June 1, but has not yet committed. How can I ensure that she leaves, and can I deduct the difference from her security deposit?

title: Missed Calls Prompt W.N.B.A. to Bolster Referees Training
description: Last years W.N.B.A. finals were deemed an instant classic. Lifted by an emotional Candace Parker and Nneka Ogwumikes game-winning shot in the final seconds, the Los Angeles Sparks captured the title in a decisive Game 5 on the road against the Minnesota Lynx in front of a sold-out crowd at Target Center.

title: 2017 Cannes Film Festival Red Carpet Looks
description: This years Cannes Film Festival opened this week, with stars Nicki Minaj, shown here wearing a wearing a Roberto Cavalli Couture gown at amfARs 24th Cinema Against AIDS Gala on May 25.

title: Belts, Roads, and Strategic Trade Policy
description: Look, Im as obsessed with the Trump disaster as anyone else. But Im trying to think about other things. And there does appear to be some big stuff happening, or potentially happening, on the global trade front, via Chinas belts and roads transportation initiative. This is obviously an attempt to expand Chinas political influence, and help find markets for Chinese exports. The magnitude of the effects is going to take some work to estimate. But is there anything else thats interesting on an analytical level?

title: Trump Discovers the Dangers of Governing at Daredevil Speed
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump was determined to leave his mark on Washington quickly. Now the city is leaving its bruising mark on him, with the same astonishing swiftness that has been a hallmark of his lightning-strike political career.

title: With Harleys and Hamburgers, Saudis Salute U.S. on Trumps Visit
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  There was neither beer, nor tattoos nor women at the biker rally in Saudi Arabias capital on Friday night. But among the hundreds of men riding on roaring Harley Davidsons and sporting leather vests, there was overwhelming excitement about the incoming visitor: President Trump.

title: Variety: Puns and Anagrams
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Its time for a palate cleanser, and todays Puns and Anagrams puzzle by Mel Taub fits the bill.

title: Letter to Homeland Security Secretary
description: Paul G. Altidor, the United States ambassador to Haiti, explains to Homeland Security Secretary John F. Kelly that allowing temporary protections to expire for Haitians living in the United States would add further strain to the island's economy, which depends largely on income coming from relatives in America.

title: 58,000 Haitians in U.S. May Lose Post-Earthquake Protections
description: MIAMI  Betty Versannes is one of the lucky ones: When a powerful earthquake buried Port-au-Prince, Haiti, on Jan 12, 2010, she was here, a world away. Her sister and cousin died in the rubble. Her other relatives moved into tents, and some live there still, in a country that is far from recovered.

title: Pippa Middleton Marries James Matthews in England
description: In what the British tabloid media have described as the wedding of the year, Pippa Middleton, the younger sister of the future queen of England, was married on Saturday in a ceremony attended by the next generation of Britains royal family.

title: Killing C.I.A. Informants, China Crippled U.S. Spying Operations
description: WASHINGTON  The Chinese government systematically dismantled C.I.A. spying operations in the country starting in 2010, killing or imprisoning more than a dozen sources over two years and crippling intelligence gathering there for years afterward.

title: Texas Rangers, a Perennial Contender, Surge Back
description: The Texas Rangers played host last week to the Philadelphia Phillies, a matchup that recalled one of the boldest, franchise-defining moves in recent years. Two summers ago, with his team well under .500 and coming off a 95-loss season, Rangers General Manager Jon Daniels traded five top prospects in an eight-player deal that brought starting pitcher Cole Hamels to Texas.

title: Viveca Gruen and Sisay Befekadu: A Sister Lives On in a Match She Made
description: Viveca Victoria Ahlfors Gruen and Sisay Befekadu were married May 20 at Rockaway Hunting Club in Lawrence, N.Y. Grace Zimmer, a friend of the couple who became an American Marriage Ministries minister for the event, officiated.

title: Bring on the Monstars: Another Rout Shows LeBron James Is on Jordans Level
description: BOSTON  Seconds after J. R. Smith ran down the long rebound of a missed jumper from the deep left corner and nailed one from the opposite side, Cedric Maxwell rose from his broadcasting seat and made eye contact with a reporter familiar from his days as a valued piece of two Boston Celtics championship teams in the Larry Bird era of the early to mid-1980s.

title: Devon Energys Fight Against Environmental Regulation
description: Devon Energy of Oklahoma City has long been one of the more aggressive opponents in the oil and gas sector of new federal environmental regulations, working since early in the Obama administration to challenge such rules. Now it is seeing the benefits of this effort, with Scott Pruitt's rise as the head of the Environmental Protection Agency.

title: How Rollbacks at Scott Pruitts E.P.A. Are a Boon to Oil and Gas
description: FREMONT COUNTY, Wyo.  In a gas field here in Wyomings struggling energy corridor, nearly 2,000 miles from Washington, the Trump administrations regulatory reversal is crowning an early champion.

title: N.B.A. Player Enes Kanter Released After Being Held in Romania
description: Enes Kanter, a Turkish citizen who is a six-year veteran of the N.B.A., found himself in an apparent political tussle on Saturday that began at a Romanian airport and ended hours later, in London, with Kanter proclaiming on Twitter that he would continue on to New York to hold a news conference on Sunday with lots of things to say.

title: Nassim Alisobhani and Justin Yanuck: Study Buddies Turn the Page
description: Nassim Christine Alisobhani and Dr. Justin Lee Yanuck were married May 20 at the Rancho Bernardo Inn in San Diego. Sam T. Lam, a friend of the couple, was appointed a deputy commissioner of civil marriages in San Diego County to perform this ceremony.

title: Donald Trump vs. Womens Health
description: When video surfaced last fall of Donald Trump boasting about sexual assault, outrage erupted. But if Trumps words about women were offensive, his policies are incomparably more consequential  and may cost more lives than in any other area of his governance.

title: Technology as a Teaching Tool
description: To the Editor:

title: Who Should You Listen to on Abortion? People Whove Had Them
description: When I arrived at the clinic in Washington, I looked for the young woman I was waiting for. Her body was covered with tattoos of birds and stars. She hugged me with a warm smile and introduced me to her boyfriend. He didnt look at me. In fact, he didnt look me in the eye for the five hours we sat together in the waiting room.

title: Modern African Art Is Being Gentrified
description: Sothebys held its first auction of modern and contemporary African art on Tuesday, where 83 pieces by artists from Cameroon to South Africa sold for a total of nearly $4 million. The star of the sale was the Ghanaian artist El Anatsuis sculpture made from discarded aluminum bottle caps and copper wire that went for about $950,000.

title: Watergate? Were Not There Yet
description: Now that Robert Mueller III has been appointed special counsel to investigate ties between President Trumps campaign and Russia, Democrats and even a few Republicans are drawing comparisons between the present mess and the Watergate scandal that brought down Richard Nixon.

title: Student Debts Grip on the Economy
description: After decades of rising college costs and tepid income growth, student debt has become a drag on graduates hopes and a threat to economic growth.

title: What to Remember About Watergate
description: Echoes of Watergate are everywhere these days.

title: The Real Power of Journalism? Blockbuster Scoops
description: THIS past week marked a watershed for the Trump administration and the journalists who cover it. On Monday, The Washington Post broke the news that President Trump revealed highly classified information in a meeting with top Russian officials. By the next day, The New York Times fired back in spectacular fashion with a damning report that Trump asked the F.B.I director, James Comey, to shut down his investigation of former National Security Adviser Michael Flynn. More scoops kept coming.

title: Roger Ailes, Hillary Clinton and Me
description: I sat in the makeup chair for what felt like hours. It was November 2014, two years before the presidential election. I was about to make my first and only appearance on the Fox News Sunday show Media Buzz.

title: 4-Year-Olds Dont Act Like Trump
description: The analogy is pervasive among his critics: Donald Trump is like a child. Making him the president was like making a 4-year-old the leader of the free world.

title: Donald Trump, Establishment Sellout
description: WHICH side are you on? Are you with Donald Trump, or with the Washington insiders who want to undo his election? Do you favor the legitimate president of the United States, or an unelected deep state  bureaucrats, judges, former F.B.I. directors, the media  thats determined not to let him govern? Are you going to let a counterrevolution by elites bring down a man who was elevated to the White House precisely because the country knows that its elite is no longer fit to govern?

title: If Every Day Is a Rainy Day, What Am I Saving For?
description: The only time I ever saw my mother in an actual bank was the day my parents sat down at the kitchen table and decided, much to the relief of every family within earshot of our suburban home, to finally get a divorce. They shook hands amicably, and Mom excused herself, then drove us both straight to the bank to withdraw all but one dollar from my parents joint account.

title: Life Behind Israels Checkpoints
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  Every conflict has its heroes. In Palestine theyre the taxi drivers.

title: Will the Presidency Survive This President?
description: As President Trump stumbled from crisis to crisis this past week, he reminded the country of a lesson it didnt really need to learn: A presidents greatest asset is trust. Once he has lost it, he cant govern. Mr. Trumps serial recklessness may change not just the course of his presidency but also the office itself. Whatever happens to him, its not too soon to wonder what will happen to the presidency when hes gone.

title: Pregnant at 18. Hailed by Abortion Foes. Punished by Christian School.
description: BOONSBORO, Md.  Maddi Runkles has never been a disciplinary problem.

title: The 5 Handsome Girls Trying to Be Chinas Biggest Boy Band
description: BEIJING  In a small dance studio in Beijing, the members of Chinas newest entry in the national pop-music pageant ran through a sequence of pulsing pelvic thrusts and choreographed crotch grabs.

title: For 2 Experts Killed in Congo, U.N. Provided Little Training and No Protection
description: Zaida Cataln was on to something, and it was making her jumpy.

title: Outside Washingtons Blazing Inferno, Democrats Seek an Agenda
description: WASHINGTON  As the nations capital was rocked by revelation after revelation from the investigation into any connection between the Trump campaign and Russia, Democrats in Washington were focused on what they saw as nothing less than saving the republic.

title: Saudi Arabia to Invest $20 Billion in Infrastructure, Mostly in U.S.
description: As President Trump begins his first presidential trip abroad in Saudi Arabia, an investment company run by one of his top supporters, the billionaire Stephen A. Schwarzman, has secured an enormous investment from the Middle Eastern kingdom.

title: Trump, Shouting Death Spiral, Has Nudged Affordable Care Act Downward
description: WASHINGTON  When Aetna, the health insurance giant, announced this month that it was pulling out of the Affordable Care Acts insurance exchange in Virginia in 2018, President Trump responded on Twitter: Death spiral!

title: Brazils President Assails His Accuser as Corruption Scandal Intensifies
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  President Michel Temer of Brazil on Saturday attacked the billionaire whose secret recording of a conversation between the two men has fueled a corruption scandal leading to widespread calls for Mr. Temers resignation.

title: Simone Matthew and Joseph McElroy: A Cat Named Mehitabel, a Lowercase Cockroach and Love
description: Simone Woodyear Matthew and Joseph Franklyn McElroy were married May 20 at Pebble Beach in Brooklyn Bridge Park. Dakota Bellici, a Universal Life minister and a friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Story of a Rogue Agent Clouds Efforts to Ease Border Patrol Expansion
description: BROWNSVILLE, Tex.  Joel Luna was just the kind of job candidate the Border Patrol covets. He grew up on both sides of the border, in Mexico and South Texas. He participated in the Reserve Officers Training Corps in high school and later served in the Army, seeing combat in Iraq.

title: Ryan Blaney, Rising Star in Nascar, Follows His Fathers Trail
description: Ryan Blaney, a 23-year-old stock car driver, had just finished a Mexican lunch a few weeks ago when he was stopped by someone who identified himself as a fan. The fan, wearing a David Pearson T-shirt, reached in his coat and pulled out a die-cast model of Blaneys No. 21 racecar.

title: Misquoting Scripture
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Randolph Ross returns today with a set of misquoted phrases from the Bible, and those phrases are clued in a punny way.

title: House Inquiry Turns Attention to Trump Campaign Worker With Russia Ties
description: Michael Caputo, who served as a communications adviser to the Trump campaign, has been asked by the House committee investigating Russian election meddling to submit to a voluntary interview and to provide any documents he may have that are related to the inquiry.

title: Angolas Omnipresent Leader Wont Run Again. But Will He Relinquish Power?
description: LUANDA, Angola  A billboard in the heart of Angolas capital, Luanda, reads like a warning to any challengers, reminding everyone of the tremendous share of votes won by President Jos Eduardo dos Santos in his partys leadership race last year: 99.6 percent.

title: Cloud Computing Takes the Preakness, Ending Always Dreamings Crown Hopes
description: BALTIMORE  This was supposed to be a duel between the Kentucky Derby winner, Always Dreaming, and Classic Empire, a hard-luck colt who most believed was the best 3-year-old horse in the country. And a duel it was, a heart-pounding one, as the two of them glided down the backstretch side by side as if they were stuck together.

title: Pain of Deportation Swells When Children Are Left Behind
description: SAN SIMN EL ALTO, Mexico  When Alejandro Cedillo was deported to Mexico from the United States, his Florida-born son and daughter were little older than toddlers, and it would be six years before he would see them again.

title: Quotation of the Day: Pruitts E.P.A. Is Boon to Oil and Gas
description: Not in our wildest dreams, never did we expect to get everything. We were kind of used to getting punished.

title: Despite Adjustments, the Yankees Masahiro Tanaka Is Battered by the Rays
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Masahiro Tanaka is a master tinkerer. He treats his bullpen sessions between starts as if they are trips to the lab, toying with his mechanics and his grip to get the desired effect on his pitches.

title: Corrections: May 21, 2017
description: NATIONAL

title: To Trump, Human Rights Concerns Are Often a Barrier to Trade
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson had some advice on Saturday for Irans newly re-elected president. The Trump administration, he said, hopes Tehran restores the rights of Iranians to freedom of speech, to freedom of organization, so that Iranians can live the life that they deserve.

title: Kelly McHenry, Owen Jennings
description: Kelly Anne McHenry, the daughter of Dee D. McHenry of Ocala, Fla., and Steve M. McHenry of Park City, Utah, was married May 20 to Owen Britton Jennings, a son of Deborah L. Jennings and Dana Jennings of Montclair, N.J. The Rev. Richard Meyer, who was ordained by the Conservative Baptist Association of America, officiated at the Triple S Ranch in Calistoga, Calif.

description: Amanda Louise Erickson and John Louis Davisson were married May 20 at St. Lawrence the Martyr Catholic Church in Sayville, N.Y. The Rev. Brian Ingram, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

description: Ariel Stephanie Akselrad and Jacob Hirsch Lieberman were married May 20 at the Museum of the City of New York. Rabbi Roger Ross officiated.

description: Grant Allen Kretchik and Lance Christopher Williams were married May 19 at the courthouse of the Superior Court of California in Beverly Hills. Nancy L. Claiborne, a deputy commissioner of civil marriages in Los Angeles County, officiated.

title: Hillary Stuchin, James Skoufis
description: Hillary Lynn Stuchin and James George Skoufis were married May 20 at the Pierre Hotel in Manhattan. Rabbi Sarah Reines officiated the interfaith ceremony, which incorporated both Jewish and Greek traditions.

description: Tarara Faith Deane-Krantz and Darren Wang were married May 20 in Hamilton Parish, Bermuda. The Rev. John Stow, an Anglican priest, performed the ceremony at Holy Trinity Church.

description: Kathryn Diane Hayes and Thomas Lynch Thompson-Flores were married May 20. The Rev. Matthew L. Potts, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Barnabas Episcopal Memorial Church in Falmouth, Mass.
