description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: What to Read Before Your Florida Trip
description: Florida seems to have developed something of a monopoly on the bizarre. Take a 2015 news story about a traffic accident in which the only casualty was a shark. Or the ubiquitous Florida man headlines that have inspired parodic Twitter accounts and trivia games. (Which of these absurd headlines is fake?) Yet to some, Florida is either just home or an entertaining destination for travelers. The following books will guide you through the states swamplands, retirement communities and cultural enclaves, offering outright or de facto defenses of Florida.

title: Finding My Florida
New York Today: Remembering Scott Joplin
description: Good morning on this semi-sunny Tuesday.

title: Editorial Contest Winner | Stopping Bullets With Locked Doors and Silence Is Already Pulling the Trigger
description: We are honoring each of the Top 10 winners of our Fourth Annual Student Editorial Contest by publishing an essay a day. You can find them all here.

title: Trump Leaves Israel With Hope for Peace, but No Plan for It
description: JERUSALEM  In case there was any doubt, President Trump made it exceedingly clear: He wants a deal. I intend to do everything I can, he said on Tuesday.

title: UkeHut in Queens: Where No Ukulele Need Goes Unmet
description: Ukulele devotees know that good things come in small packages, in all manner of shapes and styles, which is where the UkeHut in Long Island City, Queens, comes in.

title: Forest Kindergarten
description: In a forest kindergarten, like the one in the short video above, children spend most of the day in the wilderness, regardless of weather. Toys are replaced by the imaginative use of sticks, rocks and leaves. There are more than 1,500 of these in Germany.

title: In Manchester, a Loud Bang, Silence, Then Screaming and Blood
description: MANCHESTER, England  It was that moment after the music ends. The pop star Ariana Grande had finished the encore of her Dangerous Woman concert, and the shrieks of teenagers and others had subsided. The stage show was over, the arena lights had gone up, and fans were clutching pink balloons that had dropped from the rafters  souvenirs from a special night.

title: Theresa May on The Spirit of Manchester and the Spirit of Britain
description: The following is a transcript of Prime Minister Theresa Mays speech on Tuesday on the bombing at Manchester Arena and a subsequent emergency meeting in the Cabinet Office Briefing Room, as recorded by The New York Times.

title: Conspiracy Bill Advances in Japan Despite Surveillance Fears
description: TOKYO  Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan won a crucial vote in the House of Representatives on Tuesday on an anti-conspiracy bill that he said was needed to fight terrorism but that critics feared could give the authorities broad surveillance powers over citizens.

title: Governor of Jakarta Withdraws Appeal of Blasphemy Sentence
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  The Christian governor of Jakarta, Basuki Tjahaja Purnama, who was recently imprisoned for blasphemy against Islam in a trial that has divided Indonesia, has withdrawn an appeal of his two-year sentence, his family and defense team said on Tuesday.

title: California Today: Rep. Adam B. Schiff on Impeachment Talk and More
description: Good morning.

title: Howard Jacobson: Manchester, United in Grief and Kindness
description: LONDON  Too cruel anywhere. Any attack on the innocent, whatever the location, whatever the time, and whatever the ideology it serves, offends us to our very souls. But a bomb whose target is the innocent young  children leaving a concert, excitedly full of what theyd seen, looking for their parents who had come to take them home  is outrage piled upon outrage.

title: Weekly News Quiz | May 17-22, 2017
description: Though this is the final edition of our news quiz for the 2016-17 school year, come back in late August for a quiz that rounds up all the headlines of summer 2017.

title: Insidious Twist on Terror Attack Victims: Teens and Young Girls with Mothers in Tow
description: LONDON  Some of the girls had barely reached puberty. Many had come with parents in tow. At least one was only 8 years old.

title: Movers: Trumps Budget and Fed Speakers
description: Were following major developments in the markets throughout the day. Check below for the latest updates.

title: 1917: Mexico Faces Ruin as Strikes Spread
description: NEW YORK  The New York Herald this morning prints an unusual despatch from its special correspondent somewhere in Mexico, and although, in accordance with the request of the United States Government, all matters appertaining to Mexicos international relations are eliminated, the correspondent reports that numerous strikes are paralyzing all commercial and industrial activity in Mexico.

title: Chinese Student in Maryland Is Criticized at Home for Praising U.S.
description: HONG KONG  Speaking at the University of Maryland, Yang Shuping, a graduating senior from China, sprinkled her upbeat commencement speech with observations that drew warm applause: The air was far cleaner in the United States than in China, she said, and she could openly discuss racism, sexism and politics in ways that she had never before dreamed possible.

title: Roger Moore, Who Played James Bond 007 Times, Dies at 89
description: Roger Moore, the dapper British actor who brought tongue-in-cheek humor to the James Bond persona in seven films, eclipsing his television career, which had included starring roles in at least five series, died on Tuesday in Switzerland. He was 89.

title: For a Young Bride, Joy  and Judgment
description: So, how long have you been dating? the supermarket cashier asked as I swiped my credit card, my engagement ring clearly visible on the ring finger of my left hand.

title: German Prosecutors Search Daimler Offices in Diesel Emissions Inquiry
description: BERLIN  German prosecutors searched the offices of Daimler, the automaker that produces Mercedes cars, on Tuesday as part of an investigation into whether the company improperly evaded emissions rules.

title: Chinese Merchants Thrive in Senegal, Where People Needed Stuff
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Fresh out of college and frustrated by the paucity of job prospects at home, Cao Qihan, 23, did what generations of ambitious Chinese had done before him: He rolled the dice and ventured to a far-off, utterly unfamiliar land, where people speak languages he doesnt understand.

title: Take It From Milwaukee: Beware of Sheriff David Clarke
description: MILWAUKEE  When David A. Clarke Jr., the sheriff of Milwaukee County, announced last week that hed been appointed to a senior position at the Homeland Security Department, Milwaukee residents like me felt two things: relief that we might finally rid ourselves of his disastrous leadership, and deep concern about what his reported new role will mean for the rest of the country.

title: How to Best Use Your Hotel Concierge
description: A hotels concierge staff can help you fulfill a range of requests to make your trip that much better, but its services are often underused and sometimes misused, said Kenneth Abisror, the head concierge at Mandarin Oriental New York in New York City.

title: Fifth Amendment Makes it Hard to Build a Case Against Flynn
description: A major focus of the inquiry into contacts between President Trumps campaign and Russia has been Michael T. Flynn, the former national security adviser, who may have violated federal law by not disclosing various payments from the Russian government.

title: The Trumps Abroad
description: Fun for the whole family.

title: Transit Hubs: A Growing Lure for Developers
description: Rail stations, it turns out, are delivering much more than passengers to surrounding neighborhoods.

title: Read Trumps 2018 Budget
description: The Trump administration on Tuesday released its 2018 budget, called A New Foundation for American Greatness.

title: 'Twin Peaks Premiere Delivers Only Half a Million Viewers
description: Only a fraction of Twin Peaks old broadcast audience returned for Sunday nights two-hour premiere of Showtimes revival, which arrived more than 25 years after it was last on the small screen.

title: Ivo van Hove and Pina Bausch Highlight BAMs Next Wave Festival
description: TheBrooklyn Academy of Musicon Tuesday unveiled this years Next Wave Festival  the penultimate one that will be overseen by Joseph V. Melillo, the academys executive producer and the festivals founding director.

title: Doing a 180 on Facebook 360 Photos
description: Q. I uploaded a panorama picture to Facebook and it turned it into one of those interactive photos you can move around. Is there a way to make it just be a really wide photo?

title: Fraught Racial Dynamics in the Bachelorette Premiere
description: Another season of The Bachelorette is upon us, and The New York Times is here for the right reasons. Our resident obsessives will be following Rachel Lindsays love journey, starting with unpacking all the cultural signals jammed into Monday nights premiere. Can we steal you for a sec?

title: One-Line Reviews of Roger Moores James Bond Movies
description: The British actor Roger Moore, best known for playing James Bond in seven films, has died at 89.

title: Trumps Saudi Arabia Trip Figures Into Plan for Palestinian Deal
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  For 15 years, Saudi Arabia has been pitching its formula for peace among Israel, the Palestinians and the Arab world, with little response from Israeli leaders.

title: Spurs Manu Ginobili Gets Quite a Send-Off, but Will He Retire?
description: SAN ANTONIO  The home crowd was chanting his name in the closing minutes on Monday night, so Manu Ginobili looked up from his seat on the bench and gave a little wave. The fans responded with a roar, a collective expression of appreciation, nostalgia and grief. Patty Mills, Ginobilis teammate on the San Antonio Spurs, turned to him.

title: Daily Report: AlphaGo Shows How Far Artificial Intelligence Has Come
description: Last year, a Google computer program known as DeepMinds AlphaGo beat one of the worlds top players in the game of Go, a two-player board game that originated in China more than 2,000 years earlier. The event made headlines the world over, including in The New York Times, as a sign of the increasing strength of artificial intelligence versus human brainpower.

title: W.H.O. Elects Ethiopias Tedros as First Director General From Africa
description: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus of Ethiopia was voted director general of the World Health Organization on Tuesday, the first African ever to head the agency.

title: Warmer Weather Brings More Infections After Surgery
description: As the weather gets warmer, the risk of developing an infection at the site of a surgical wound increases, a new study reports.

title: The Jamaican Beef Patty Extends Its Reach
description: Its delicate crust is flaky and golden, its ground beef punctuated with kicks of Scotch bonnet, black pepper, onion and garlic. While it may not yet have achieved the popularity of the taco or the pizza, the Jamaican beef patty is expanding its reach.

title: Pedro Winter on Daft Punk and the Paris Party Scene He Defined
description: Back in the early aughts, Ed Banger Records was the leading exporter of glitchy French electronic dance music and a Parisian cool-kid scene that orgiastically blended night life, fashion and art. Founded by the D.J. and musician Pedro Winter, the label helped turn acts like Justice, Uffie, Sebastian and Mr. Oizo into international figures.

title: Trump Administration Is Split on Adding Troops in Afghanistan
description: ROME  When President Trump landed in Saudi Arabia last Saturday on his first foreign trip, he brought with him a $110 billion arms deal. When he arrives at the NATO summit in Belgium on Thursday, he will bring mostly questions, many of them about the war in Afghanistan.

title: Q&A: Trumps First Foreign Trip
description: New York Times journalists are answering readers questions about President Trumps first trip abroad. He is visiting multiple cities in four countries: Saudi Arabia, Israel, Italy and Belgium.

title: Why Im Not Reviewing Noma Mexico
description: Under the rustling palms of Tulum, Mexico, the chef Ren Redzepi has been serving what Kevin Sintumuang, reporting for Esquire, called the most enviable meal of the year. Mr. Redzepi, who transplanted most of his staff to the Yucatn, while Noma, his restaurant in Copenhagen, prepares to move, said he wanted Noma Mexico to be the meal of the decade. For Jacob Richler, who wrote about the dinner for The Toronto Star, it was the meal of a lifetime.

title: With Pitching and Prime-Age Players, Rockies Sense This Year Is Different
description: PHILADELPHIA  The last time he was healthy at the end of a season, Greg Holland pitched in the World Series. His new teammates on the Colorado Rockies have asked him about that assignment, for the Kansas City Royals in 2014, but Holland does not know what to say.

title: Since Ouster, Sheriff Arpaio Has Lots of Time, but Not for Regrets
description: FOUNTAIN HILLS, Ariz.  Joe Arpaio, the onetime sheriff in this part of the West, still talks about his former job, the one he was unceremoniously ousted from last fall, in the present tense.

title: Ex-President of F.C. Barcelona Is Arrested in Corruption Inquiry
description: MADRID  Spanish police investigators arrested the former president of F.C. Barcelona, Sandro Rosell, on Tuesday as part of an inquiry into money laundering and kickbacks said to have been paid for the television rights for matches involving Brazils national soccer team.

title: Ex-C.I.A. Chief Reveals Mounting Concern Over Trump Campaign and Russia
description: WASHINGTON  John O. Brennan, the former C.I.A. director, described on Tuesday a nerve-fraying few months last year as American authorities realized that the presidential election was under attack and feared that Donald J. Trumps campaign might be aiding that fight.

title: N.F.L. Relaxes Celebration Rules to Bring Some Fun Back
description: Maybe a little fun is coming back to the No Fun League.

title: Democrats Warn Trump Against Pre-emptive Attack on North Korea
description: Worried over what they described as President Trumps erratic response to North Koreas behavior, 64 Democratic legislators urged him on Tuesday to talk directly to the North Koreans  and warned that he would need congressional approval for any pre-emptive military strike.

title: Cortez Kennedy, Hall of Fame Defensive Tackle, Dies at 48
description: Cortez Kennedy, a 300-pound but nimble defensive tackle for the Seattle Seahawks in the 1990s who was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2012, was found dead on Tuesday at his home in Orlando, Fla. He was 48.

title: Emotional Richness in Minor Keys From 2 Revered Pianists
description: New York piano lovers hardly knew what to expect over the weekend from two keyboard lions approaching winter. Was this to be a wallow in nostalgia? In melancholy?

title: Charcoal or Gas? Depends on What Youre Grilling
description: Gas or charcoal? It is a question that has bedeviled American consumers and cooks for decades, since the first LazyMan propane grill went on sale in the 1950s and left the Smiths with their briquette-fueled brazier looking jealously over the fence at the Joneses and their new outdoor science stove.

title: Security Council Meets Over Killing of 2 U.N. Experts in Congo
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Under mounting pressure to take credible action after two United Nations experts were killed in the Democratic Republic of Congo, the United Nations Security Council said on Tuesday that it was meeting to discuss the case.

title: Mindanao, a Philippines Island, Is Placed Under Martial Law
description: MANILA  President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines placed the southern island of Mindanao under martial law on Tuesday after armed men belonging to two terrorist groups affiliated with the Islamic State killed a police officer and two soldiers, officials said.

title: Roger Moore Was the Best Bond Because He Was the Gen X Bond
description: I heard about Roger Moores death during a walk in Brooklyn on Tuesday morning, when a young father looked up from his phone and said, The worst James Bond ever just died. He wasnt talking to me, but rather to the toddler in the stroller in front of him, who seemed indifferent to the news. Kids these days.

title: Our Teeth Are Making Us Sick
description: The left side of Jacquelyn Garcias face throbbed fiercely. She had tried taking Tylenol and Excedrin for the pain, but threw them up. On a Monday morning straight after working the night shift as a custodian, she rushed to the N.Y.U. emergency dental clinic. Here a student delivered the verdict: decay so deep it had reached the nerve. The tooth needed to be pulled.

title: Christie Warns of Summer Detours Into Hoboken for Many N.J. Transit Riders
description: Thousands of New Jersey commuters who usually ride trains to and from Pennsylvania Station in Manhattan will have to detour through Hoboken for most of the summer, Gov. Chris Christie announced on Tuesday.

title: The Bombing at a Manchester Concert
description: To the Editor:

title: 180 Tenth by Smorgasburg Opens at the High Line Hotel
description: 180 TENTH BY SMORGASBURG The leafy, welcoming terrace in front of the High Line Hotel is ready for its seasonal run. This year, it will be in the hands of Eric Demby, the organizer and operator of markets and food halls like Smorgasburg, Brooklyn Flea and Bergn, and his business partner, Jonathan Butler. Instead of curating a collection of vendors, Mr. Demby will be running the restaurant and bar. In the kitchen he has put Aaron Taber, who was at David Changs Maple, a food delivery service that is now defunct. The menu is long on smaller items like oysters, arancini, crudits, charcuterie plates and pickles. Salads and vegetables, some served with eggs, and a few more substantial dishes, including burgers, round out the choices. Drinks like Tom Collins and frozen negronis are suitably summery. Mr. Demby said he was quite excited at the prospect of opening a real restaurant. Dinner will be followed by brunch on June 10 and weekday lunches starting on June 19. (Opens Thursday): High Line Hotel, 180 10th Avenue (20th Street), 212-933-9735, 180tenth.com.

title: Bresha Meadows, Ohio Teenager Who Fatally Shot Her Father, Accepts Plea Deal
description: Last summer, an Ohio 14-year-old fatally shot her father after fleeing home several times to escape what she, her mother and her siblings described as an unending cycle of domestic abuse.

title: Comedy Central Extends The President Show
description: Comedy Central is giving more time in office to President Trump  or, at least, to the satirical incarnation of the commander in chief who hosts a late-night talk show.

title: Rand Castile, Who Opened Doors for Asian Art, Dies at 78
description: Rand Castile, who introduced audiences to the splendors of Japanese warlord helmets, Kabuki theater and Tibetan sacred art at Japan Society in Manhattan and the Asian Art Museum in San Francisco, died last Tuesday in Manhattan. He was 78.

title: Grayson Perrys The Descent of Man: Deconstructing the Masculine Mystique
description: The English artist and media personality Grayson Perry has a sexually ambiguous pageboy haircut. He sometimes wears dresses. He dedicates his new book, The Descent of Man, a plea for less toxic masculinity in the world, to his childhood teddy bear.

title: Inside the Studio of David Korins, Set Designer of Hamilton
description: On a recent morning, the Broadway set designer David Korins gave a tour of his tchotchke-filled studio near Pennsylvania Station in Manhattan. In a room with miniature models of stage sets, a conversation about staircases ensued.

title: Cuomo Steps Into Transit Fray With Ideas for After Summer of Hell
description: Facing a torrent of criticism for failing to address New York Citys deteriorating transit system, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Tuesday acknowledged that the regions mounting infrastructure problems had reached a crisis level and said he would shoulder the responsibility for addressing them.

title: Fox News Retracts Seth Rich Story That Stirred Controversy
description: Fox News on Tuesday retracted a story linking the murder of a Democratic National Committee staff member with the email hacks that aided President Trumps campaign, effectively quashing a conspiracy theory that had taken hold across the right-wing news media.

title: A Bad Day at the Circus
description: To the Editor:

title: A Chaos President
description: To the Editor:

title: Manchester, Donald Trump, Roger Moore: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Immigrant Detentions
description: To the Editor:

title: Navy SEALs Kill 7 Militants in Yemen Raid but Suffer Injuries
description: WASHINGTON  Members of the Navys elite SEAL Team 6 killed seven militants, but suffered combat wounds themselves, during an early Tuesday raid on a compound associated with Al Qaeda in Yemen, the Pentagon said.

title: Misogyny in a Yearbook
description: To the Editor:

title: Trump Budget Proposes Deep Cuts in Energy Innovation Programs
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps budget proposal for 2018 envisions a flurry of changes to domestic energy policy, reaping billions of dollars in one-time revenue from oil and gas resources while cutting research into future energy technologies that could pay long-term dividends.

title: Kendall Jenner, Mary J. Blige and Al Gore Party at Cannes
description: The stars turned out for Vanity Fairs annual A-list gathering during the film festival.

title: Kendall Jenner, Mary J. Blige and Al Gore Party at Cannes
description: ANTIBES, France  Around 11 on Saturday night, Mary J. Blige walked into the party hosted by Vanity Fair and Chopard at the Htel du Cap-Eden-Roc. Her wingwoman was her sister, LaTonya Blige-DaCosta, who has written lyrics for some of her songs.

title: Wendy Whelan: The First Time I Danced a Balanchine Ballet (the Day He Died)
description: My first performance in a Balanchine ballet took place 34 years ago, on April 30, 1983. It was a day that will forever be marked in the history books because it also happened to be the day Balanchine died.

title: 48 Hours With Iris van Herpen
description: Around Dallas with the fashion designer, ahead of her show at the citys art museum.

title: Taking Flight: Julie Kent at Washington Ballet
description: WASHINGTON  Almost exactly two years ago, the ballerina Julie Kent stood onstage at the Metropolitan Opera House, eyes brimming with tears, and bade farewell to her 30-year dancing career at American Ballet Theater. (She was 45.) Her ballerina days were over, but she didnt have much time to lament the loss. Barely a year later, she was offered the job of leading the Washington Ballet.

title: In Dallas With One of Fashions Most Innovative Designers
description: I think a lot of people, when they look at my work, they see the future, but what I find interesting is that it is actually all present, said the 32-year-old Dutch fashion designer Iris van Herpen, who is known for her innovative designs that interweave cutting-edge technology with couture craftsmanship. I cannot make something that isnt there yet. Everything that I do is here and now.

title: U.S. Sues Fiat Chrysler, Accusing It of Using Software to Pass Emissions Tests
description: The federal government filed a lawsuit against Fiat Chrysler Automobiles on Tuesday, accusing it of using illegal engine-control software to enable its diesel-powered vehicles to pass emissions tests.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: How to Raise a Reader
description: tk

title: Manchesters Resilience
description: MANCHESTER, ENGLAND  It just doesnt feel real. Im used to waking up or scrolling through Twitter to learn some terrible news that another terrorist attack has happened at a sports stadium or subway station in America, Europe or Asia.

title: Review: ABCs Perspiration-Free Dirty Dancing
description: The Dirty Dancing phenomenon was never really about the story  or the music  or even the dancing. It was about the way those things came together at a particular moment in time for a particular audience in a gritty movie featuring two engaging stars.

title: Review: Opera Lovers, Make a Pilgrimage to Munich for Tannhuser
description: MUNICH  Nach Rom! the cast of Wagners Tannhuser cries at the end of that operas second act, pressing the title character to make the Catholic pilgrimage to Rome and save his troubled soul.

title: Review: In Restless Creature, Wendy Whelan Dances Against the Clock
description: If I dont dance, Id rather die.

title: Border Taxs Apparent Demise Jeopardizes G.O.P. Overhaul Plan
description: WASHINGTON  After months on life support, the border adjustment tax looks as if its finally dead.

title: Trucking And Blue-Collar Woes
description: What with everything else going on, this Trip Gabriel essay on truckers hasnt gotten as much attention as it should. But its awesome  and says a lot about what is and isnt behind the decline of blue-collar wages.

title: Review: Alexei Ratmanskys Ballet Whipped Cream Is a Candyland Triumph
description: American Ballet Theaters gala at the Metropolitan Opera House on Monday was a triumph on many levels. Alexei Ratmanskys two-act Whipped Cream, an exuberantly nutty piece, new this March, in which a candy shop coming to life is only the start of the tales subversive craziness  made its New York debut with high-spirited success.

title: A Dignified End for New Yorks Forgotten Veterans
description: Ernest R. Garcias body sat for more than a month in his Bronx apartment before the authorities finally entered in January and found it decomposing.

title: High Ticket Prices Are Fueling a Broadway Boom
description: Musicals about the aftermaths of a teenage suicide and a terror attack proved unlikely sensations. Star turns by Bette Midler, Josh Groban, Jake Gyllenhaal and Glenn Close added sizzle. And, led by Hamilton and Hello, Dolly!, the hottest shows started charging once unthinkably high prices for the best seats.

title: What an Attack at an Ariana Grande Show Means for Teen Girls
description: The pink balloons, floating above the maelstrom of panicked concertgoers, are what struck me first. Images of innocence, bumping along above hordes of shrieking children, many of whom refused to release their balloons even as they fled the arena.

title: Butterfly and Carmen, in Bold and Vivid Cuts
description: Opera fans who object to contemporary productions of revered works that seem driven by some provocative concept often wonder where it will all end. If youre going to zap, say, Rigoletto from 16th-century Mantua to 1960s Las Vegas, they complain, you might as well tweak the libretto, reorchestrate and trim the score, shift scenes around or cut them completely.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $14.8 MILLION

title: Inside the Air War Over Syria: A High Altitude Poker Game
description: AL UDEID AIR BASE, Qatar  The salvo of American cruise missiles  launched at a Syrian airfield last month was intended as a one-time message to dissuade President Bashar al-Assad from mounting another chemical weapons attack.

title: After Complaints, Fannie Mae Will Stop Selling Homes to Vision Property
description: One of the biggest firms in the rent-to-own home business is now on the federal governments do-not-sell list.

title: Manchester, Trump, Roger Moore: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Trump Adds Another Chinese Trademark to His Portfolio
description: BEIJING  China has granted President Trump preliminary approval for another trademark in apparel, expanding business interests that have already generated criticism over potential conflicts.

title: Obamas Fiduciary Rule, After a Delay, Will Go Into Effect
description: New consumer protections requiring financial advisers to put their customers interests ahead of their own  at least when handling their retirement money  will take effect next month, putting to rest the question of whether they would be delayed further.

title: Ranked-Choice Voting System Violates Maines Constitution, Court Says
description: Maines voting system was thrown into potential turmoil on Tuesday by a court opinion that said a process in which voters rank candidates rather than simply picking one  approved by voters in November  violated the State Constitution.

title: Why Chocolate May Be Good for the Heart
description: Eating chocolate has been tied to a reduced risk of heart disease. Now scientists have uncovered one possible reason.

title: Economists See Little Magic in Tax Cuts to Promote Growth
description: If one assumption has undergirded Republican economic policy for decades  and is the foundation of the Trump administrations first budget proposal  it is that tax cuts will unleash fantastic growth.

title: Live Event: Take a Tour of Citi Field With a New York Times Sports Reporter
description: Welcome to Times Insider Events  live programming for Times Insiders and their guests. Times Insider offers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.

title: Moving to a Disco Beat, or the Clatter of Household Objects
description: Follow your bliss. Depending on your mood, that phrase is either enlightening or exasperating. Both could be used to describe Michelle Bouls latest work, The Monomyth, which takes partial inspiration from the writer and mythologist Joseph Campbell, who coined the saying. It also refers to his vision of a heros journey: Embark on an adventure, face a crisis, and, in the end, emerge transformed.

title: Republicans Will Reject Trumps Budget, but Still Try to Impose Austerity
description: WASHINGTON  Finally some good news for President Trump: His new budget stands absolutely no chance of being enacted by Congress.

title: Proposed Rules Would Allow U.S. to Track and Destroy Drones
description: The Trump administration is asking Congress to give the federal government sweeping powers to track, hack and destroy any type of drone over domestic soil with a new exception to laws governing surveillance, computer privacy and aircraft protection, according to a document obtained by The New York Times.

title: Executive for Soup Nazi Company Pleads Not Guilty to Felony Tax Evasion
description: An executive at Soupman Inc., the company that licensed the recipes of the Soup Nazi made famous by the television show Seinfeld, has landed in hot water.

title: Glencore Makes Informal Takeover Approach to Bunge
description: Glencore, the mining and energy giant, said Tuesday that its agriculture business had made an informal takeover approach to the commodity company Bunge Limited.

title: Watch the Cyan! How The New York Times Gets Inked
description: At The New York Timess headquarters on Eighth Avenue in Manhattan, dozens of journalists ride out the daily miracle: Articles are written, edited, rewritten, copy edited, laid out and finished. Late evening fades into night, and eventually, around 12:30 a.m., the last pages of the late editions are released by news designers. But where do they go?

title: Mitch Landrieu Reminds Us That Eloquence Still Exists
description: These are hard days of coarse language  of tweets and catcalls that appeal to the worst in us, not the best. Maybe thats why a big, sweeping, old-fashioned speech delivered in New Orleans on Friday made such an impression on me. It was a reprieve. It was an antidote.

title: Target to Pay $18.5 Million to 47 States in Security Breach Settlement
description: Target will pay $18.5 million to 47 states and the District of Columbia as part of a settlement with state attorneys general over a huge security breach that compromised the data of millions of customers.

title: Mitch Landrieus Speech on the Removal of Confederate Monuments in New Orleans
description: This is the full text of the remarks delivered last week by the mayor of New Orleans, Mitch Landrieu, upon his removal of the last of the citys several Confederate monuments.

title: Gardner Museum Doubles Reward for Recovery of Stolen Masterpieces
description: The board of trustees of the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston has doubled the reward to $10 million for the recovery of 13 masterpieces stolen nearly three decades ago in the largest art heist in American history, the museum said Tuesday.

title: Stipend Scandal Fuels Divide Among New Yorks Democratic State Senators
description: ALBANY  There was a time when this special election, to fill a vacant state Senate seat in Harlem, would have carried some greater significance.

title: Trumps Budget Doesnt Make Sense
description: President Trump entered office facing the worst ratio of debt to gross domestic product of any new president in American history except Harry Truman  an onerous 77 percent. So, like many presidents before him  including, most recently, President Barack Obama, who had to respond to the economic crisis he inherited  President Trump is faced with the choice of whether and how to confront a looming situation not of his own making.

title: Talking Milkshakes on the Train
description: Dear Diary:

title: New Jersey Town Used Zoning to Discriminate Against Islam
description: This is the chronicle of how a founding principle of this country, the freedom to worship, crashed into a public bureaucracy in the venerable and prosperous New Jersey suburb of Bernards Township.

title: Federal Court Revives Wikimedias Challenge to N.S.A. Surveillance
description: A federal appeals court on Tuesday revived a high-profile challenge to the National Security Agencys warrantless surveillance of internet communications as they enter or exit the United States.

title: More Corporate Sponsors Abandon Puerto Rican Day Parade
description: The list of those boycotting the Puerto Rican Day Parade, over a decision by parade organizers to honor a Puerto Rican nationalist linked to terrorist acts, grew on Tuesday, with two more prominent defections.

title: Despite Security, Concerts Provide Target-Rich Environments
description: With bomb-sniffing dogs, bag inspections and rows of metal detectors at the entrance, the modern concert arena is in some ways a fortress.

title: What Ariana Grande Represents to Her Fans
description: Young women and girls pack Ariana Grandes concerts, snap up her songs the moment theyre released and follow her every social media post. In her music, shows and videos, Ms. Grande  ever-smiling as she unleashes a soaring voice  is what her fans long to be: Self-assured, sexy, talented, optimistic, in control and proudly feminine. Pink balloons drop at the end of her concerts  a deliberately chosen color  and many of her fans were happily clutching them on the way out of the Manchester Arena when a terrorists bomb exploded there on Monday.

title: In Times Square Attack, Bollards Stopped One Car. But What About the Next?
description: Planners describe it as a turning point in the redesign of Times Square: a meeting around the end of 2012 when David C. Kelly, then the Police Departments assistant commissioner for counterterrorism, showed up with a copy of Al Qaedas English-language magazine, which called on attackers to "mow down pedestrians with pickup trucks.

title: Trumps Problematic Math: Budget Plan Adds Growth, but Doesnt Subtract Cost
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps budget proposal, unveiled on Tuesday, purported to show the benefits of cutting taxes on businesses and consumers: By the end of the decade, faster growth could balance the federal budget.

title: Cuts to AIDS Treatment Programs Could Cost a Million Lives
description: WASHINGTON  At least one million people will die in sub-Saharan Africa and elsewhere, researchers and advocates said on Tuesday, if funding cuts proposed by the Trump administration to global public health programs are enacted.

title: Uber to Repay Millions to Drivers, Who Could Be Owed Far More
description: Uber said Tuesday that it had made a mistake in the way it calculated its commissions, at a cost of tens of millions of dollars to its New York drivers, and the company vowed to correct the practice and make the drivers whole for the lost earnings.

title: When Terrorists Target Children
description: Every victim of terrorism is innocent, and every one is to be mourned. But the bombing in Manchester, England, on Monday night that killed teenage or even younger fans of the pop star Ariana Grande, many accompanied by their parents and some clutching the pink balloons Ms. Grande had sent sweetly raining down at the end of her concert, is particularly wrenching.

title: Divided Republicans May Find It Hard to Pass Any Budget
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional Republicans greeted President Trumps first full budget on Tuesday with open hesitation or outright hostility. But it was not clear that they could come up with an alternative that could win over conservatives and moderates while clearing a path for the tax cuts and policies they have promised for years.

title: At Vigil After Manchester Attack: We Stand Together
description: People gathered in the streets in Manchester, England, on Tuesday to honor the victims of a terrorist attack at an Ariana Grande concert the day before.

title: Quotation of the Day: Former Top Spy Recounts Fears Over Trump Ties
description: Frequently, people who go along a treasonous path do not know they are on a treasonous path until it is too late.

title: Jon Stewart and HBO Cancel Animated Shorts Project
description: Jon Stewart and HBO are not going forward with his much-anticipated animation project, a setback for what was supposed to be the next step in his post-late-night career.

title: Review: Money-Hungry Women Scheme for a Better Life in Can You Forgive Her?
description: Feisty women trying to jump class are so 19th century; Im looking at you, Jane Eyre. And so 20th century, too: Have you met Sister Carrie?

title: To a Plumber
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Theres an old saw that says that if you want to be financially comfortable in life, you should become a plumber. Supposedly, they make a good living because most people cant or wont deal with the issues that go with the ownership of a home and its plumbing system.

title: Trump Praises Duterte for Philippine Drug Crackdown in Call Transcript
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump praised President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines in a phone call last month for doing an unbelievable job on the drug problem in the island nation where the government has sanctioned gunning down suspects in the streets. Mr. Trump also boasted that the United States has two nuclear submarines off the coast of North Korea but said he does not want to use them.

title: How the Manchester Arena Attack Unfolded
description: A look in and around the scene of the terror attack.

title: China Cant Sustain Its Debt-Fueled Binge, Moodys Says
description: SHANGHAI  China has gone on a spending spree, borrowing money to build cities, create manufacturing giants and nurture financial markets  money that has helped drive the economic powerhouse in recent years. But the debt-fueled binge now threatens to sap the energy of the worlds second-largest economy.

title: The Americans Season 5, Episode 12 Recap: Suffer the Children
description: Now thats a cliffhanger. Did the lonely teenager cut his wrists the right way? Tune in next week!

title: Witness Describes Arranging Meeting That Ended in Murder
description: Dealing drugs was a sideline for Quran Pender, a former actor and Ivy League basketball player, something he did to supplement his income as a basketball coach and history teacher at a private middle school in Los Angeles.

title: Royals Rally Past the Yankees Imploding Bullpen
description: The Yankees christened a small section of seats in right field as the Judges Chambers this week, garnishing the area with wood paneling, handing out judicial robes and foam gavels, as well as a sign that read, All Rise.

title: Harvey Struggles, but Conforto Saves the Day for the Mets
description: Matt Harvey sprinted to the mound Tuesday night at Citi Field, looking eager to pitch at home for the first time since the Mets suspended him for three games for violating team rules this month.

title: How Trumps Budget Would Affect Every Part of Government
description: Government spending would be cut substantially. See how every budget item would be changed.

title: Corrections: May 24, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Rihannas Style Through the Years
description: A look at the singers journey from red carpet newcomer to fashion icon.

title: The Lessons of Rihanna
description: On Monday night, late in the program for the 69th annual benefit and student fashion show at Parsons School of Design, a group of graduating seniors stood onstage and extolled the talents of one of the evenings honorees. She was inspiring. Her style was amazing. Her brand was amazing. (There were a lot of amazings.)

title: In the Bars of Berlin, Both the Drinks and Design Are Bracing
description: Within one minute of being seated at Buck and Breck, a cocktail bar in Berlin, I was asked if I wanted an ashtray. It was a shocking offer for a resident of smoking-ban New York. Ashtray? Smoking? I had looked around. Yes, smokers were there, smokers with personal ashtrays.

title: European Leaders Hope to Win Trumps Favor
description: LONDON  Brussels, which he called a hellhole, and the European Union, which he called a vehicle for Germany, and NATO, which he called obsolete, are all nervously awaiting the arrival of President Trump on Wednesday, the way earthlings might await the impact of an asteroid.

title: Manchester, Roger Moore, Donald Trump: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: When Colleges Dangle Money to Lure Students Who Ignored Them
description: In the minds of parents and teenagers going through the college application process, May 1 is a magic date. At that point, youve sent in a deposit, bought a sticker for your car window and posted your choice on social media.

title: Angry Over Zillows Home Prices? You Can Win a Prize by Improving Them
description: SEATTLE  Its one of the oldest tricks in an internet companys playbook. Concoct a tool that gives the public new statistics on something  the quality of a restaurant or a toaster, say. Then watch visitors flock to the data and worry about accuracy later.

title: Senators Shake Off Blowout Loss to Force Game 7
description: OTTAWA  With their season on the line, the Ottawa Senators found a way to dig a little deeper on Tuesday, rebounding from a humiliating outing two days earlier with a 2-1 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins that kept them from elimination.

title: Manchester Uniteds Henrikh Mkhitaryan Brings Armenia With Him
description: MANCHESTER, England  Henrikh Mkhitaryan would be forgiven for not wanting to take his work home with him. His first season in the Premier League has, after all, been a demanding one, enough to make anyone cherish any chance at all to switch off.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: A Dirty Dancing Remake and The Handmaids Tale
description: Frances Houseman and Johnny Castle have the time of their lives  again  in a remake of Dirty Dancing. And Luke resurfaces in The Handmaids Tale.

title: Word + Quiz: intellect
Unity Technologies, Whose Engine Is Behind Pokmon Go, Agrees to Funding
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Unity Technologies, which makes software at the heart of Pokmon Go and other video games, has agreed to receive $400 million in a new funding round led by the investment firm Silver Lake, the company said.

title: Body Image
Five Places to Go in Zagreb
description: Just east of Zagrebs main square, a formerly bland residential neighborhood has been transformed into the creative hub of the Croatian capital. Along its principal thoroughfare, Marticeva, and the streets around it, artsy cafes, bookstores, boutiques and design studios have moved into storefronts that once sold auto parts. The micro-cultural revolution was spearheaded in 2004 by the cafe-literary club Booksa, which drew creative types to the area. As if to confirm the neighborhoods cool factor, the Design District Zagreb festival, from June 13 to 18, is to be held there for its second year in a row.

title: With Gift and in Conversation, Vatican Presses Trump on Climate Change
description: VATICAN CITY  Pope Francis put climate change on the agenda of his first meeting with President Trump on Wednesday, and the subject is likely to come up again and again in the presidents encounters with other world leaders in the coming days.

title: Michael Bloomberg Gives $75 Million to Shed Arts Center
description: The ambitious new arts center known as the Shed, rising in Hudson Yards, has received $75 million from Michael R. Bloomberg, showing just how much the Far West Side continues to be shaped by a small group of influential billionaires.

title: Australias Stolen Generations Tell Their Stories
description: In Generations Stolen, Matthew Sherwood documents the fates of mixed-race children who had been kidnapped from their families during Australias disastrous experiment with forced assimilation.

title: Vermonts D.I.Y. Approach on Marijuana
description: Vermont is on the verge of becoming the ninth state to legalize the recreational use of marijuana, but, being Vermont, it is taking an earthier, grow-it-yourself approach  one that could become a model for others.

title: The Price of Disability Denial
description: It was 1989 and I was immersed in my first teaching job, a one-year gig at Barnard College, with the possibility of something long-term. During that time, I had become friendly with a senior colleague named Bill. On our many walks along Broadway to grab deli sandwiches, wed talked about our grad school days at Berkeley, the high rent of tiny apartments in New York and how to get the Barnard women to share our passion for European history in the small classes theyd asked me to teach.

title: A Road Trip Through Rusting and Rising America
description: OAK RIDGE, Tenn.  In his dystopian Inaugural Address, President Trump painted a picture of America as a nation gripped by vast carnage  a landscape of rusted-out factories scattered like tombstones that cried out for a strongman to put America first and stop the world from stealing our jobs. It was a shocking speech in many ways and reportedly prompted former President George W. Bush to say to those around him on the dais, That was some really weird [stuff].

title: The Handmaids Tale, and Ours
description: During the George W. Bush administration, liberal TV watchers found a cozy sort of comfort in the dreamy alternate reality of President Josiah Bartlets America, where a collection of eloquent, passionate, fast-talking Clinton Democrats stalked sun-spangled West Wing halls and governed a country where the 1990s never really ended and all right-wing dragons could be tamed or slain.

title: Why Work Requirement Became a Theme of the Trump Budget
description: The new White House budget proposal is built on a deep-rooted conservative belief: The government should help those who are willing to work, and cull from benefit rolls those who arent.

title: Amazon Sets Up Shop in the Heart of the Publishing Industry
description: Jeff Bezos, the chief executive of Amazon, has often struck a defiant tone when asked about the companys dominance of the book industry.

title: South Korean Military Sentences Captain for Sex With Other Servicemen
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A military court in South Korea sentenced an army captain to six months in prison on Wednesday for having sex with other servicemen, igniting an outcry against what rights groups called a homophobic witch hunt in the countrys military.

title: Australias Stolen Generations Tell Their Stories
description: Alfred Calma was 4 years old when the police snatched him from his mother, never to live with her again. Joyce Napurrula-Schroeder was not quite 2 when it happened to her. Luke Morcom was a newborn, barely a week on this earth.

title: Questions for: Salman Abedi, 22, Is Identified as Manchester Arena Bomber
description: Article: Salman Abedi, 22, Is Identified as Manchester Arena Bomber

title: Janet Mock Struggles With Being Called a Trans Advocate
description: Your new book, Surpassing Certainty, is about your 20s, and what separates it from most books about young adulthood is that you really show the messiness of becoming the person you end up being. Usually this kind of memoir comes from a grande dame  someone whos in her 60s, smoking her cigarettes and saying, Im going to tell the children what it was really like to fight Mr. DeMille. Im in my mid-30s! So I am still close to the experiences, but theyre far enough away for me to reflect on and to find lessons.

title: Should Yearbooks Include Political News?
description: Study the image above, of a yearbook spread from Shawnee Mission East High School in Prairie Village, Kan.

title: Should You Expose a Charity That Exploits Its Employees?
description: I recently began training for a staff position at a nonprofit that offers services to victims of domestic violence and sexual assault. I was very happy to be offered this position, particularly in light of the current political climate. The job required several weeks of training, followed by on-the-job training, to become state-certified.

title: British Officer or Tusken Raider?
description: President Woodrow Wilson dominated the cover of the Mid-Week Pictorial this week, having just signed the Selective Service Act, requiring all men aged 21 to 30 to register on June 5.

title: Mondrians World: From Primary Colors to the Boogie Woogie
description: It has often been assumed that Piet Mondrian was a cold, calculating, detached kind of man. Look at his paintings, his primary color planes divided by black lines, so formal and rectilineal: Hello, is there anyone in there?

title: Mapping 50 Years of Melting Ice in Glacier National Park
description: Glacier National Parks eponymous ice formations lost more than a third of their area between 1966 and 2015. See how every glacier in the park has retreated over 50 years.

title: The Colorado River and Its Unnatural World
description: WHERE THE WATER GOES Life and Death Along the Colorado River By David Owen 274 pp. Riverhead Books. $28.

title: New in Memoir: The Intersex Body, the Dead Body, the Body in Grief
description: The subfield of feminist scholarship devoted to narratives of whats commonly referred to as the body is having something of a heyday. Disability studies are growing in popularity, as is the prominence of intersectional theories around gender, body modification and the politics of difference. Often, the lines of inquiry (or interrogations, as academics like to say) concern themselves with power dynamics imposed by cultural norms, including those that conspire to make physicality itself a form of trauma.

title: Inside the Svalbard Global Seed Vault
description: The Svalbard Global Seed Vault, a safeguard of the worlds most important crops, flooded after permafrost surrounding the entrance thawed in Norway. Look inside in 360 degrees.

title: Aleppo After the Fall
description: One morning in mid-December, a group of soldiers banged on the door of a house in eastern Aleppo. A male voice responded from inside: Who are you? A soldier answered: Were the Syrian Arab Army. Its O.K., you can come out. Theyre all gone.

title: The Rise of the Fat Start-Up
description: In 2003, Keith Rabois, a longtime Silicon Valley investor and executive, had an ambitious idea: He wanted to start a website that would instantly offer a fair price for your home. If you accepted the offer, the site would agree to buy your house immediately, closing the deal in a matter of days.

title: Stories of New Orleans: As Monuments Go Down, Family Histories Emerge
description: NEW ORLEANS  The debate over the removal of four Confederate-era monuments has stewed here for nearly two years, longer than the city was under Confederate control, and it has not abated with the removal of the last: the statue of Robert E. Lee, plucked off its pedestal on Friday afternoon. On barricaded streets and in rancorous Facebook comment threads, people sparred over ideas about legacy and resolution, the line between veneration and history, and the meaning of symbols as time passes.

title: Living In Breezy Point, Queens
description: Years after Hurricane Sandy, the private community has not finished recovering. But there are flip-flops for sale again in the surf shop.

title: Breezy Point, Queens: Tested by Hurricane Sandy
description: In October 2012, when Hurricane Sandy struck Breezy Point, destroying about 350 houses by flooding and fire and damaging hundreds more, Jamie Hogan was living near Laguna Beach, Calif. Two weeks later, she and her husband flew east to help with the recovery. Ms. Hogan, 60, had lived in Breezy Point, a private community on the western end of the Rockaway Peninsula in Queens, off and on throughout her life and could look to more than a century of family history there.

title: Highlights From Trumps Meeting With the Pope
description: Pope Francis welcomed President Trump to the Vatican on Wednesday for the first face-to-face meeting of the two leaders, who have vastly contrasting visions.

title: Stephen Colbert Joins Trumps Twitter Intervention
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: How to Read the C.B.O. Score of the Health Bill Like an Expert
description: Today, the Congressional Budget Office will issue important numbers about the House-passed version of the American Health Care Act, the Republican bill to repeal and replace portions of the Affordable Care Act.

title: Fig Leaves Are Out. What to Wear to Be Kind to the Planet?
description: In the Garden of Eden, figuring out what to wear was easy and the fig leaves were environmentally friendly. Today, its much harder to find clothes that dont have some kind of negative impact on the planet.

title: Hunt for Manchester Bombing Accomplices Extends to Libya
description: MANCHESTER, England  The police accelerated their hunt Wednesday for co-plotters of the Manchester concert bombing, making at least a half-dozen arrests in Britain, searching for a possible clandestine bomb factory and extending the investigation to Libya, where two of the bombers relatives were detained.

title: Duterte Suggests Martial Law Across Philippines, Citing Islamist Threat
description: MANILA  President Rodrigo Duterte warned on Wednesday that he may declare martial law throughout the Philippines to deal with the threat of Islamist militancy, making the remarks one day after he imposed military rule on a southern island.

title: Manchester, Pope Francis, Uber: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Court Ruling Could Make Taiwan First Place in Asia to Legalize Gay Marriage
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  In a ruling that paves the way for Taiwan to become the first place in Asia to recognize same-sex marriage, the constitutional court on Wednesday struck down the Civil Codes definition of marriage as being only between a man and a woman.

title: The Daily: The Terrible Limbo Between Attack and Credit
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Editorial Contest Winner | Leave the Citizens to Their TV Shows
description: We are honoring each of the Top 10 winners of our Fourth Annual Student Editorial Contest by publishing an essay a day. You can find them all here.

title: A 1-Hour Walk, 3 Times a Week, Has Benefits for Dementia
description: Exercise may bolster the brain function and thinking skills of people with dementia, according to a new report. The studys findings suggest that walking a few times per week might alter the trajectory of the disease and improve the physical well-being of people who develop a common form of age-related memory loss that otherwise has few treatments.

title: How to Be Mindful While Swimming
description: Swimming often devolves into autopilot behavior in which you focus only on getting in the distance youve planned, or following the black line. This is a lost opportunity. Swimming can also be an immensely rewarding opportunity to practice mindfulness. By swimming mindfully, we can transform routine lap sessions into an immersive form of moving meditation.  Terry Laughlin, founder of Total Immersion Swimming.

title: For a Hotel Beekeeper, Honey Is Just the Beginning
description: A wine distributor and sommelier by trade, Noel Patterson, the resident beekeeper at Miraval Resort & Spa in Tucson, parlayed his experience with terroir to capture time and place in a bottle. His latest medium? Honey.

title: New York Today: Roller Coasters Within Reach
description: Good morning on this drizzly-to-dry Wednesday.

title: Morning Agenda: Glencore Weighs Takeover of Agriculture Rival
description: ABCD  G?

title: Manchester Bombing Victims Include at Least 7 Parents
description: LONDON  The world has been horrified by the young ages of many of the victims in the Manchester bombing, but on Wednesday, attention shifted to parents of concertgoers who were also killed. Seven have been identified, among them a couple who left behind two daughters.

title: How Trumps Budget Affects Women
description: The Trump budget disproportionately cuts programs that benefit women.

title: Tom Cruise Confirms Top Gun Sequel
description: Goodness gracious, great balls of fire: A Top Gun sequel is coming.

title: Movers: Fed Minutes, and Chinas Rating Downgrade

description: Good morning.

title: The Bands Visit to Open on Broadway
description: One of the most lauded new Off Broadway musicals of the just-wrapped theater season is moving uptown.

title: Two Women Walk Into a Club: Melissa Leo and Ari Graynor
description: The comedy scene of 1970s Los Angeles was a great time and place for talented, young stand-up comedians with ambition and appetites for drugs and alcohol. It just wasnt especially hospitable to women, who were treated as also-rans and groupies.

title: Have You Heard the One About the Angsty Comic? Yes, Too Often
description: In the first episode of Showtimes Im Dying Up Here, we meet Eddie (Michael Angarano) and Ron (Clark Duke), two comedians from Boston whove come to Los Angeles in 1973 to seek their fortune. When they introduce themselves to their taxi driver, he scoffs.

title: What You Get for $2.3 Million
description: A modernist house in Boulder; a country-style home outside Charleston; and a 1775 house in Stockbridge are on the market.

title: $2.3 Million Homes in Colorado, South Carolina and Massachusetts
description: WHAT A 2016 house with five bedrooms and three and a half bathrooms

title: They Went to Manchester Arena as Homeless Men. They Left as Heroes.
description: LONDON  For Chris Parker, the arenas entrance area might have seemed like a good place to ask people for money. Stephen Jones had found a spot nearby to sleep.

title: How Whales Became the Biggest Animals on the Planet
description: Whales are big. Really big. Enormously big. Tremendously big.

title: Trump vs. Math
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Alabama Inmate, 75, Hopes to Dodge Death for an Eighth Time
description: Tommy Arthur, who was first sentenced to death in 1983, has long imagined what could be his end: time in a so-called death cell, a choice of a last meal, the final telephone calls and then a lethal injection.

title: The Jazz Trio Harriet Tubman in a We Resist Concert
description: The doom-jazz power trio Harriet Tubman has released four albums over the past 20 years, none thicker with intention and power than its latest, Araminta. Recorded in collaboration with the deep-toned trumpeter Wadada Leo Smith, the record wades through an electric mire with a sense of rugged determination, finding a kind of balance but resisting equilibrium. Harriet Tubman  Brandon Ross on guitar, Melvin Gibbs on bass and J.T. Lewis on drums  headlines a concert on Wednesday, May 31, as part of Le Poisson Rouges We Resist series; proceeds will benefit the Equal Justice Initiative. The show begins at 7 p.m. with a set from the Haitian-born percussionist and turntablist Val-Inc. Also on the bill is the James Brandon Lewis Trio, led by an audacious young tenor saxophonist whose sound is a grimy sluice. That trio is celebrating a release of its own: No Filter, its first album, comes out on CD and vinyl on June 9. The guitarist Anthony Pirog joins as a special guest. (212-505-3474, lpr.com.)

title: From Clipper Ships to Artists Lofts, at the Menil Collection
description: In the early 1950s, when Abstract Expressionism was hot and Greenwich Village was the place to be, New York Citys first generation of loft-dwelling artists was forming down near Wall Street and South Street Seaport, in 19th-century buildings that had once produced riggings for clipper ships.

title: A Banned Dance From Anna Halprin, Now Celebrated
description: New York is often cited as the birthplace of postmodern dance, but California deserves credit. Radical Bodies, an exhibition at the New York Public Library for the Performing Arts, explores these Golden State roots through the relationship of three pioneering women with strong ties there: Anna Halprin, Simone Forti and Yvonne Rainer. The exhibition covers 1955-1972, when Ms. Halprin formulated her task-based communal works in the Bay Area and shared them with Ms. Forti and Ms. Rainer, who became influential figures in the New York scene in that period. (Through Sept. 16; nypl.org.)

title: A Mahler Focus for the Met Orchestra and Esa-Pekka Salonen
description: Esa-Pekka Salonen had an acclaimed run at the Metropolitan Opera a year ago leading Strausss Elektra. So it was little surprise when he was tapped, in the midst of those performances, to replace James Levine in the Met Orchestras traditional post-opera-season outing at Carnegie Hall a year hence. Those concerts have arrived, and the Met forces travel to Carnegie on Wednesday, May 31; June 3; and June 6.

title: Michael Jacksons Final Years Become a Lifetime Movie
description: Its been almost eight years since the King of Pop died, but a reasonably convincing version of him lives on in Michael Jackson: Searching for Neverland, a made-for-TV movie that has its premiere on Monday, May 29, on Lifetime. It stars Navi, an entertainer who bills himself as the worlds No. 1 Michael Jackson impersonator and who is making his acting debut.

title: Chinese Fashion Designers Flock to City of T-Shirts and Flip-Flops
description: XIAMEN, China  In the seven years she lived in Beijing, Vega Zaishi Wang started her eponymous label and made her name as one of Chinas top young fashion designers.

title: Period Activists Want Tampon Makers to Disclose Ingredients
description: Have you ever wondered what chemicals and other ingredients are in your tampons?

title: A Giddy Government Inspector, Restaged by the Red Bull Theater
description: Mistaken identity is one of the most exhaustively used devices in comedy. Few plays, though, have taken it to the mad heights occupied by Nikolai Gogols The Government Inspector. This 1836 work  in which a witless fop is assumed to be a powerful state functionary by corrupt politicians in the provinces  infuses scathing satire with giddy surrealism.

title: The Wit of Ernst Lubitsch, Revisited at Film Forum
description: You cant go wrong with a retrospective of Ernst Lubitsch, whose movies still sparkle with urbanity and sly wit. Film Forum serves up a feast of them beginning Friday, June 2, in The Lubitsch Touch, which commemorates the 125th anniversary of his birth. The program, which runs through June 15, features 31 films, an array that demonstrates versatility and adaptability. Lubitsch, who died in 1947, began directing in the silent era but transitioned with apparent ease into talkies. For a sample of his style, you cant do better than the 1940 comedy The Shop Around the Corner (showing June 3).

title: Trump Is Expected to Endorse NATOs Mutual Aid Pledge, Ending Silence
description: ROME  President Trump is expected to publicly endorse NATOs mutual defense commitment at a ceremony on Thursday at the alliances headquarters, an administration official said, breaking months of silence about whether the United States would automatically come to the aid of an ally under attack.

title: Brazilian Uber Rival Raises $100 Million From SoftBank
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  A Latin American competitor to Uber  99  has raised $100 million from SoftBank of Japan to fuel growth, the Brazilian start-ups chief executive says.

title: Why Chinas Growing Debt Load Worries the World
description: Moodys Investors Service downgraded its rating of Chinas sovereign debt one notch on Wednesday, citing concerns over growing debt in the country, which has the worlds second-largest economy. In recent years, as Chinas stunning economic performance of past decades has become difficult to sustain, the country has used debt to fuel growth.

title: Transparent, the Musical: Coming Soon?
description: The third season of Transparent ends with Shelly Pfefferman, played by Judith Light, performing her one-woman show To Shell and Back on a cruise ship. The musical moment, one of many in the award-winning Amazon series, happens so naturally that its easy to wonder: What if this were a musical?

title: House Hunting in  Colombia
description: In Cartagena, the market has been strong for the last 20 years, since the citys centuries-old houses began to be restored as luxury properties.

title: House Hunting in  Colombia
description: This 200-year-old Spanish colonial house sits on the corner of a narrow street in the walled Centro Historico, or Old City, of Cartagena. The two-story house has four bedrooms and three bathrooms, and balconies that overlook the cobbled Plaza de San Diego, with hanging planters brimming with bougainvillea and other colorful tropical plants.

title: Alan Yang, a Master of None Creator, on Season 2, Chef Jeff and That Final Shot
description: Master of None shouldnt work as well as it does. Created by Aziz Ansari and Alan Yang, the Netflix series is yet another dramedy that follows a young, indecisive, relatively well-off creative type  in this case, Mr. Ansaris journeyman actor, Dev Shah  as he dates his way through New York City. Each of its two seasons splits its time between a serialized story line that tracks Devs romantic and professional misadventures and stand-alone episodes on such themes as religion, gender and immigrant families.

title: Trumps Budget Takes Aim at My Sweet Son
description: President Trumps budget is here, and it contains serious cuts to the social safety net. One of the big changes is a plan to slash more than $800 billion over the next 10 years from Medicaid.

title: Gas or Charcoal?
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Artists Space Gallery Finds a New Home, in TriBeCa
description: Artists Space, the nonprofit gallery and pioneer of New Yorks downtown art scene that was forced to move from  its SoHo home last year when its landlord planned to build a penthouse on the building, has found a place to put down roots: 80 White Street, in TriBeCa.

title: The Manchester Attack: Decoding ISISs Online Claims
description: The Islamic State claimed responsibility on its social media for an attack in Manchester that killed 22 people and wounded dozens more at a pop concert. Rukmini Callimachi, a foreign correspondent for The New York Times covering ISIS and Al Qaeda, analyzes ISISs online messages and explains what they mean.

title: 6 Lightweight Anoraks for Unpredictable Weather
description: Unpredictable spring weather calls for a portable, lightweight layer. Below, a handful of anoraks  durable enough to scrunch into your backpack and easy enough to slip on over a sweater  that provide ample coverage for any chance showers.

title: The Handmaids Tale Episode 7: Crossing the Border
description: The Handmaids Tale is very good at imbuing simple and quiet moments  a trip to the gynecologist, Serena Joy pruning her rose garden, a game of Scrabble  with high suspense. Scenes often include emotional turns and narrative twists that resonate long after the characters stop speaking. Its suspense often leaves me in a state of anxiety. This series may have its blindspots (which Ive written about several times before), but I have always been riveted by its story and curious about its characters. Until now.

title: Nevada and Connecticut are Latest to Ban Discredited Conversion Therapy
description: At least nine states now ban conversion therapy for minors, a discredited method meant to change a persons sexual orientation or gender identity, after Nevada and Connecticut this month joined others in prohibiting the practice.

title: Grateful Dead Documentary: A Four-Hour Jam on Jerry Garcias World
description: Four-hour documentaries about rock bands are nothing new  Bob Dylan, George Harrison and Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers have all been the subjects of these visual equivalents of boxed sets. But the latest entry in the field is perhaps the most detailed yet: Amir Bar-Levs Long Strange Trip, an elegy for what that director calls the most American of all rock bands, the Grateful Dead, and its ringmaster, Jerry Garcia.

title: The Latest on the Manchester Bombing Investigation
description: The hunt continued for the network that might have helped Salman Abedi in the Manchester bombing. Eight men were in custody and the authorities scrambled to find a possible bomb maker who might have helped Mr. Abedi assemble the device he used.

title: With a Bazaar of Gizmos and Apps, Tackling Readers Tech Questions
description: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? J. D. Biersdorfer, The Timess Tech Tips columnist and a Book Review production editor, discussed the tech she is using.

title: Reality Check: What Does, and Doesnt, Protect Your Smartphone
description: Once you get a smartphone, whats the first thing you might want to go along with the device? For many people, its probably a case.

title: Its Flagstaff Light Aglow Again, a Park Is Ready for Memorial Day
description: It sounds like an unfortunate twist on an old joke: How long does it take to change a light bulb?

description: To the Editor:

title: Put Your Baby in a Box? Experts Advise Caution
description: Are babies better off if they sleep in a cardboard box?

title: Insider-Trading Case Ensnares Hedge Fund
description: For hedge funds, information is a valuable currency. A scrap of insight about a coming change in government policy can be as precious as any market data, potentially making the difference between a profit or loss on a trade.

title: Flipped Emergency Switch Causes Another Round of Subway Delays
description: The Wednesday morning commute was snarled along the Sixth Avenue subway lines after someone pulled an emergency switch inside a Manhattan station.

title: In Search of the Simple Sign-In
description: Q. I want to use the feature of the iOS TV app where you only have to put in your name and password in once in order to stream different channel apps, but I cant find where you go to enter that information. Where is it?

title: Sean Hannity, a Murder and Why Fake News Endures
description: If we can learn anything from the latest triple-bank-shot of a conspiracy theory coursing through the alt-reality media  this one involving the unsolved murder of a Democratic National Committee staff member named Seth Rich  its this: Fake news dies hard.

title: Daily Report: From Lean to Fat Start-Ups
description: Lean start-ups were once all the rage in Silicon Valley. Now, here comes the fat start-up.

title: In One Chart: Trump Plans to Cut Medicaid After Promising Not To
description: A look at how Medicaid funding could be cut by half.

title: Teaching Science with the Trilobites Column
description: Want to know how ants figured out farming millions of years before humans? Or how your ancestors' climates might have shaped your nose? Then read, teach and learn with Trilobites.

title: Jerusalem Day Celebration Underscores Israeli-Palestinian Divide
description: JERUSALEM  Three old men who are better known for being young men stood on Wednesday morning where they had 50 years earlier: in Jerusalems Old City, at the limestone retaining wall that is one of the holiest places for Jews.

title: House Intelligence Committee Will Subpoena Flynn, Schiff Says
description: WASHINGTON  The House Intelligence Committee will issue subpoenas to Michael T. Flynn, President Trumps first national security adviser, the committees senior Democrat said on Wednesday, escalating Mr. Flynns troubles with Congress.

title: D.E.A. Misled Overseers on Deadly Honduras Operations, Watchdogs Say
description: WASHINGTON  The Drug Enforcement Administration misled the public, Congress and the Justice Department about a 2012 operation in which commando-style squads of American agents sent to Honduras to disrupt drug smuggling became involved in three deadly shootings, two inspectors general said Wednesday.

title: Review: Baywatch, a Romp Full of Surf, Sand and Lots of Skin
description: In case the question should ever arise on a standardized test, the opposite of prestige TV is Baywatch. The series, which ran on NBC and in ubiquitous syndication through the 1990s, bequeathed a rich legacy of wet-suit fashion, Jet Ski safety and sunscreen awareness. In other news, Paramount has just released a movie called Baywatch, starring Dwayne Johnson in the role of the beach daddy originated by David Hasselhoff.

title: Found at the Scene in Manchester: Shrapnel, a Backpack and a Battery
description: The Times got access to evidence photographed at the crime scene, and it suggests an improvised device made with forethought and care.

title: Watch the First Trailer for Game of Thrones Season 7
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation newsletter and website.

title: Wayne Thiebaud: 1962 to 2017
description: Works on view in the artists new survey show.

title: At Tea With the Legendary Painter Wayne Thiebaud
description: The artist Wayne Thiebaud renders everyday delights strange and vibrant. Long celebrated for his peppy still life paintings and fantastical landscapes, the 96-year-old California native is currently in London for a survey show at the citys White Cube gallery.

title: When You Know Youre in Love: Delivering the Punch Line
description: How do you know when you are in love? No 1-800-line psychic will tell you. No notice sent by registered mail. Not even a ping from your iPhone. But there are a million ways of figuring it out, and weve asked some people when they knew. Here is one way:

title: How Demands of Female Birds Changed the DNA of a Species
description: Darwins finches, those little birds in the Galpagos with beaks of different sizes and shapes, were instrumental in the development of the theory of evolution.

title: Landslide Closes Section of Popular Coastal Highway in California
description: Travelers in California enjoy the isolation that comes with driving along Highway 1, a serpentine route with steep cliffs known for its spectacular views of the Pacific Ocean.

title: 3 Books That Help Make Sense of Cyberwar
description: The fear of a massive cyber attack became fact on May 12, when over 200,000 computers were hacked in a global blackmail attempt. Hospitals were locked out of medical records; individuals were prompted to pay a ransom in order to access their computers. Yet cyber war and, as such, cyber security, remains murky territory. These books address the cyber threat  and one, published decades ago, shows that the cyber world may have been foreseen in literature.

title: Feather Fancy
description: The likes and dislikes of females produced a lot of different looking species of southern capuchino seedeaters.

title: Expert Doubts Chinas Population Number, Saying India May Be No. 1
description: BEIJING  Chinese people cheering on their countrys ascent sometimes comfort themselves with the idea that Asias other behemoth, India, is years from surpassing Chinas population and decades from emerging as a potential economic peer.

title: Fed Sounds Cautious Note but Doesnt Deter Forecast of Rate Increase
description: WASHINGTON  Federal Reserve Board officials said at a meeting early this month that they wanted to see evidence of stronger economic growth before continuing to increase the Feds benchmark interest rate, according to minutes of the meeting published on Wednesday.

title: Sign Up for the Smarter Living Newsletter
description: Like what youre reading? Sign up for the Smarter Living newsletter to get stories like this (and much more!) delivered straight to your inbox every Monday morning.

title: Simcha Felder Tells Fellow Rogue Democrats to Rejoin the Party Fold
description: ALBANY  The call for a breakaway faction of Democrats in the State Senate to abandon its Republican allies and rejoin the partys fold picked up a surprising supporter on Wednesday: Senator Simcha Felder, a Brooklyn Democrat who also sides with the Republicans.

title: After Bombing, Ariana Grande Suspends Her Tour
description: The pop singer Ariana Grande is suspending her tour until at least June 5, following Mondays terrorist bombing in Manchester, England, that killed 22 people as they were leaving one of her concerts.

title: High-Fiber Diet Tied to Less Knee Arthritis
description: Researchers have found yet another benefit of a high-fiber diet: It is associated with a reduced risk for arthritis of the knee.

title: You May Not Know Jack Antonoff. But You Probably Love His Music.
description: The first time Jack Antonoff hit it big  more than a decade after he began touring as a teenager in crowded vans that often arrived at empty rooms  he walked away.

title: Man in Florida Told the Police He Killed Neo-Nazi Roommates for Disrespecting His Muslim Faith
description: A man in Florida who shot two of his roommates dead gave an unusual defense, the authorities say: they were neo-Nazis who had disrespected his recent conversion to Islam.

title: Trumps Budget: Who Wins, Who Loses
description: To the Editor:

title: Trumps Budget: The Math Is Phony but the Cruelty Isnt
description: Phony math is a time-honored tradition in the Washington world of budget making, but the first full fiscal plan from the Trump administration breaks new ground.

title: Senator Felders Letter on the I.D.C.
