Muncy, 36, who serves as a photographer in the Air National Guard, discovered the airfield when he started wondering what veterans did to recapture the camaraderie and shared purpose they had experienced in the service. Once you retire, that support system, the people you spend so much time around, is just gone, he said.

title: Summer Reading Recommendations, From 6 Novelists Who Own Bookstores
description: On a sunny afternoon in late April, the day before the opening of Books Are  Magic in Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, the novelist Emma Straub was apologetically shooing away potential customers.

title: Pop, Rock and Jazz in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to pop and rock shows and the best of live jazz.

title: Finding Songs Hidden in Britains Thankful Villages
description: SHROPSHIRE, England  One recent Saturday, Darren Hayman drove three and a half hours from London to Harley in Shropshire, a well-to-do village among rolling hills made up of 75 houses and a Norman church with a notice boasting it had just installed carpeting. Mr. Hayman, 46, a cult British songwriter, was there to record a song about the villager Hilda Preece, who in the early 1900s, he said, held prototype raves in a barn, putting gramophones in, everyone dancing all night.

title: Eyeglass Vendor, Imprisoned for Terrorizing Consumers, Is Accused of Fraud
description: Vitaly Borker served a three-and-a-half-year stint in prison for threatening to stalk, maim and murder customers of his online eyeglass store, DecorMyEyes. But the court-ordered timeout, it seems, did little to convince him to take a new approach to sales.

title: Even in Liberal Cities, Budgets Push Austerity Into Starvation Territory
description: As soon as it was released, President Trumps budget, titled A New Foundation for American Greatness, was characterized by politicians and ordinary human beings of various leanings as the manifesto of someone who seemed to wish he were running a Victorian orphanage. Greatness, in the context of the administrations economic ideology, is built on a ground laid thick with self-abnegation. It is demanded not on the part of the well off, who are mandated instead to indulge themselves  spending the money they might have otherwise paid in taxes on Jet Skis and lake houses  but from those who are not typically in a position to decide whether its wild Alaskan salmon or a grass-fed rib-eye for dinner tonight.

title: Greg Gianforte, Montana Republican, Captures House Seat Despite Assault Charge
description: BOZEMAN, Mont.  Greg Gianforte, a wealthy Montana Republican who was charged with assaulting a reporter on Wednesday, nonetheless won the states lone seat in the House of Representatives on Thursday, according to The Associated Press, in a special election held up as a test of the countrys political climate.

description: Our guide to stand-up, improv and variety shows.

title: Nora Mae Lyng, Actress at the Heart of Forbidden Broadway, Dies at 66
description: Nora Mae Lyng, a brassy actress and singer who collaborated with Gerard Alessandrini to create and star in Forbidden Broadway, that campy, saucy and enduring Off-Broadway sendup of legitimate theater, died on May 4 in Manhattan. She was 66.

description: Our guide to film series and special screenings. All our movie reviews are at nytimes.com/reviews/movies.

title: Student Brought Loaded Gun to Brooklyn School, Police Say
description: A 17-year-old student in Brooklyn brought a loaded handgun to his high school on Thursday, the New York Police Department said.

title: The Bombing, the Crime Scene Photos and the Outcry
description: Around midday on Wednesday, The New York Times published several photographs showing, in eerie detail, the makeshift shrapnel, shredded blue backpack and powerful lead acid battery used by the Manchester bomber who killed 22 people. The story accompanying the photos, describing the forensic evidence and crime scene found by investigators, said the bombers torso had been heaved toward the entrance of the Manchester Arena.

title: In Taormina, a Playground for the Jet Set, Trumps Worlds Will Collide
description: TAORMINA, Sicily  President Trump should enjoy some respite from the rigors of his recent travels on Friday when he gazes out of his luxury suite and takes in the view of Taormina, an iridescent pearl of the Ionian Sea.

title: Rumors on WhatsApp Ignite 2 Mob Attacks in India, Killing 7
description: MUMBAI, India  The video, widely circulated on social media this week in India, shows a man on the ground, pleading for his life before a mob kicks and beats him to death. He was one of seven men killed in two vigilante mob attacks in central India last week, at times as police officers looked on.

title: Art and Museums in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to new art shows  and some that will be closing soon.

description: BIARRITZ, France  Flags from Israel, South Korea, China, Sweden, Ireland, Greece and even Afghanistan are flying in the Basque Country seaside wind this week, representing surfers who harbor Olympic dreams.

title: Fact Check: The Updated G.O.P. Health Care Bill
description: Does the health care bill passed by the House live up to Republicans promises? We checked the facts.

title: Trumps Budget, Breaking Tradition, Seeks Cuts to Service Programs
description: WASHINGTON  In his inaugural address, John F. Kennedy exhorted the youth of America to ask what they could do for their country. In his inaugural budget, President Trump wants the government largely out of the national service business.

description: The unveiling of President Trumps first budget and the initial congressional hearings on overhauling the tax code should have brought clarity to the administrations top legislative priorities.

description: Dear Diary:

description: President Trumps former national security adviser, Michael T. Flynn, is facing a mounting tangle of potential legal troubles arising from his business dealings with foreign entities and his interactions with both executive branch and congressional investigators.

title: Michael Bliss, Historian Who Dispelled Myths of Insulins Discovery, Dies at 76
description: Michael Bliss, a distinguished Canadian historian whose unraveling of the story behind the discovery of insulin overturned the widely accepted telling of it and brought international attention to his work, died on May 18 in Toronto. He was 76.

title: Brooklyn Prison Supervisors Charged With Sexually Assaulting Inmates
description: As prison officials and reformers have stepped up efforts to reduce rape behind bars, they have looked to the supervisors who keep watch over prisoners  and prison guards  to help curb the scourge of sexual abuse.

title: Trump Administration Considers Moving Student Loans from Education Department to Treasury
description: The Trump administration is considering moving responsibility for overseeing more than $1 trillion in student debt from the Education Department to the Treasury Department, a switch that would radically change the system that helps 43 million students finance higher education.

description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Kenyas national census used to classify them as Other.

description: A little over a year ago, the private equity titan Stephen A. Schwarzman sat down with Mohammed bin Salman, the deputy crown prince of Saudi Arabia and chairman of the kingdoms largest sovereign wealth fund, in hopes of expanding their relationship.

title: Quotation of the Day: Assault Charge Against Republican Upends Montana House Race
description: Should the gentleman apologize? Yeah, I think he should apologize. I know he has his own version, and Im sure hes going to have more to say, but theres no call for this, no matter what  on any circumstance.

title: Review: Tackling a Major Taboo in The Boy Who Danced on Air
description: Given enough intellectual muscle, any outr story can probably be pounded into a musical. For evidence, look no further than Sweeney Todd, Fun Home and Hamilton, three great shows of forbiddingly unlikely origin.

title: G.M. Accused in Lawsuit of Deceit on Diesel Truck Emissions
description: A Seattle law firm that specializes in suing automakers has filed a class-action lawsuit against General Motors, accusing the company of programming some of its heavy-duty pickup trucks to cheat on diesel emissions tests.

title: Injured Boy at Yankee Stadium Puts Face on Bill Seeking Safety Netting
description: Legislation that would require both of New York Citys major-league baseball teams to extend protective netting from behind home plate all the way to the foul poles was introduced by a City Council member on May 8 and is expected to come up for a hearing in September.

title: A Journalist Was Body Slammed, but Some Conservatives Want the News Media to Apologize
description: In this time of intense partisanship, shiv-in-the-kidney politics and squabbles over the meaning of truth, can Americans come together and agree that a politician slamming a journalist to the ground for asking a question is wrong?

title: In Controversy, Hannity Isnt Seeing Advertisers Exodus That OReilly Did
description: This week, a handful of companies including Cars.com announced plans to stop advertising on Sean Hannitys Fox News program in response to his unapologetic promotion of a conspiracy theory surrounding the murder of a Democratic National Committee staff member. To some, it looked like the beginnings of the kind of exodus that helped push Bill OReilly off the network last month.

title: Britain Hopes for a New Chapter at the Americas Cup
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda  The coffee table, fittingly for a modern Americas Cup team headquarters, was made of carbon fiber.

title: Mets Latest Injury Update: Theyll Be Talking About Injuries Less
description: A day after Manager Terry Collins created an uproar of sorts by proclaiming he was no longer at liberty to discuss the Mets numerous injury situations, his boss, General Manager Sandy Alderson, tackled the issue himself.

title: Leaks: A Uniquely American Way of Annoying the Authorities
description: WASHINGTON  British leaders were infuriated this week when the name of the Manchester concert bomber was disclosed by American officials, and further outraged when The New York Times ran investigators photographs of the bomb remnants. After Prime Minister Theresa May complained bitterly to President Trump, he denounced the leaks on Thursday and vowed to find and punish the leakers.

title: Staying Out When You Shouldnt Have
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  By Friday, you should be ready for a good fight with your crossword puzzle. The early week puzzles have built up your solving self-esteem, youve sharpened your skills on the midweek puzzles and now, at the end of the week, youre primed and ready for a tug-of-war.

title: Jerry Perenchio, Entertainment Mogul Who Advised Think Big, Dies at 86
description: Jerry Perenchio, an entertainment mogul who promoted the Muhammad Ali-Joe Frazier heavyweight championship fight in 1971, produced television shows with Norman Lear and turned Univision into the dominant Hispanic TV network in the United States, died on Tuesday at his home in the Bel Air neighborhood of Los Angeles. He was 86.

title: LeBron James Scores 5,995th Playoff Point, Taking the Record From Michael Jordan
description: With 35 points against the Celtics on Thursday night LeBron James now has the most career playoff points. He passed Michael Jordan, who held the record since 1998.

description: UPS must pay $247 million in damages and penalties to New York City and New York State for illegally shipping cigarettes, a federal judge ordered Thursday.

description: The Mets game against the San Diego Padres on Thursday was primed to become an affront to the eyes of baseball purists.

title: Wanting Monogamy as 1,946 Men Await My Swipe
description: Leaving Michaels apartment one Tuesday morning, I smiled and said, Have a good class today. That may not sound like much, but I was trying to leave a hint: I was interested in more than our one-night-a-week thing.

title: Dirty Dancing: Where Kellermans Came to Life
description: The great Dirty Dancing lake war has been raging almost since that much-loved movie came out 30 years ago this August. Its one of those rare wars in which both sides can claim a victory of sorts, as I learned this spring when I explored the two main locations where the film was shot.

title: A Mothers Help
description: The mother in this photo has been by her paralyzed sons side, literally, throughout every one of his classes at Chapman University.

title: The Way They Kill Now
description: ARRAS, France  In the springtime of 100 years ago, nations that shared a Christian heritage slaughtered one another over a few miles of mud. In just one battle, the great powers of Europe fought for more than a month outside this magnificently reconstructed medieval city, and suffered 280,000 casualties.

title: Retirement Investors Arent Safe Yet
description: The secretary of labor is supposed to represent the interests of working people. But the new secretary, Alexander Acosta, was speaking to and for the financial industry this week when he took to the opinion pages of The Wall Street Journal to make his first major policy announcement.

title: President Trump Fails NATO
description: President Trumps first NATO meeting was the moment to show that he would honor the example of his predecessors in leading a strong and unified alliance that has been and should remain the anchor of Western security. He failed.

title: The Demented Detectives on Seth Richs Case
description: Seth Rich died on the night of July 10, 2016. The conspiracy theories were born days later. The process by which these baseless theories about his death snaked from Reddit to Twitter to Fox News illustrates just how thin the membrane has become between the conspiracy world and the mainstream.

title: Jared Kushners Beleaguered Tenants
description: Community organizer is a bully boy taunt for President Trump.

title: Its All About Trumps Contempt
description: For journalists covering domestic policy, this past week poses some hard choices. Should we focus on the Trump budgets fraudulence  not only does it invoke $2 trillion in phony savings, it counts them twice  or on its cruelty? Or should we talk instead about the Congressional Budget Office assessment of Trumpcare, which would be devastating for older, poorer and sicker Americans?

title: The Four American Narratives
description: America has always been a divided, sprawling country, but for most of its history it was held together by a unifying national story. As I noted a couple of months ago, it was an Exodus story. It was the story of leaving the oppressions of the Old World, venturing into a wilderness and creating a new promised land. In this story, America was the fulfillment of human history, the last best hope of earth.

title: Beautiful Military Equipment Cant Buy Middle East Peace
description: Tehran  As President Trump was being feted in the palaces of the Saudi royal family after concluding a historic arms deal, Iranians were celebrating the outcome of a hard-fought election. The vote manifested the determination of Irans electorate to continue on the path of moderation and constructive engagement based on mutual respect that brought the world the nuclear deal in 2015.

title: Where Will the Medical Misfits Go?
description: HOUSTON  People with health insurance tend to think of safety-net hospitals the way airline travelers think of the bus: as a cheaper service they would use only if they had to. But without these essential hospitals  which specialize in the care of our countrys most medically and financially vulnerable, particularly the uninsured  our entire health care system would be in danger.

title: Statue of Woman Removed From Bangladeshs Supreme Court
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  Under pressure from Islamic hard-liners, the Bangladeshi authorities in the predawn hours on Friday swiftly and quietly removed a sculpture of a woman personifying justice from outside the countrys Supreme Court building.

title: How to Build a Fallout Shelter
description: The most important thing is to build underground, says Cdric Vuilleumier, an engineer for the Federal Office for Civil Protection in Switzerland, where all citizens are legally guaranteed a spot in a bomb shelter. Packed earth insulates against radiation and blast waves, but dont go deeper than 10 feet; if your exits (make two) become blocked in the blast, you may need to dig yourself out.

title: Judge John Hodgman on the Husband Whos Too Cool for Social Media
description: Sean writes: My friend Gavin thinks its cool to not be on social media, but he has been creeping on his wifes account for the last nine years. She doesnt mind when he logs on, messes with her likes and follows the lives of her friends (like me). I think he should get his own account.

title: Whirl
description: Surrealism was invented in the 1920s in Paris by poets who thought that practicing it would make us more fully human and liberated. It was not intended as an escape but as a fusion of dreams with reality to reveal a higher, truer state of consciousness. There was no purer contemporary surrealist than the Slovenian poet Tomaz Salamun, whose poems are not designed to be interpreted but instead to act upon us, in order to open up in us a little dormant space of weirdness where we can hopefully feel more free. Selected by Matthew Zapruder

title: Few in St. Louis Knew Confederate Memorial Existed. Now, Many Want It Gone.
description: ST. LOUIS  The angry, divisive fight over public symbols of the Confederacy has swept through Columbia, S.C., Birmingham, Ala., and New Orleans. This week, the debate made its way some 600 miles north, up the Mississippi River, to St. Louis, the home of a Confederate memorial many residents did not know was in their midst.

title: Strap Into the Jersey Shores New Roller Coaster
description: The Hydrus opened in May, replacing the famous Jet Star roller coaster, which was destroyed by Hurricane Sandy. Experience the ride in this 360 video.

title: Behind the Cover: 5.28.17
description: Jake Silverstein, editor in chief: Hatab Square was once lined with restaurants and hotels. Sebastin Listes photograph captured the devastation of the war and also, with those spring flowers blooming, the strange fact that life automatically continues, even in the aftermath of total destruction. It has been very difficult to get photographers into Aleppo in recent years, so these pictures carried extra interest.

title: Friday Mailbag: Manchester, Stereotypes and Social Security Math
description: Tragedy struck Manchester, England, on Monday when a bombing at a pop music concert killed 22 people and injured 64, including children. As the investigation into the attack unfolded, details that were passed by the British to U.S. officials were reported by the American news media. First, the attacker was identified: a 22-year-old Briton named Salman Abedi. Next, The New York Times published forensic photos of the backpack, battery and shrapnel used by Abedi in the attack.

title: McConnell May Have Been Right: It May Be Too Hard to Replace Obamacare
description: WASHINGTON  Shortly after President Trump took office, Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the majority leader, met privately with his colleagues to discuss the Republican agenda. Repealing the Affordable Care Act was at the top, he said. But replacing it would be really hard.

title: A Shiny New Ride Above the Sand at the Jersey Shore
description: SEASIDE HEIGHTS, N.J.  It was one of the indelible images of the wrath of Hurricane Sandy: a famous Jersey Shore roller coaster reduced to a twisted, mangled wreck in the surf off Seaside Heights, its decades-old iron and steel slicing the coming waves.

title: Where to Live When the L Train Shuts Down

description: NORTH ADAMS, Mass.  The master plan for MASS MoCA in 1986 was a wildly ambitious dream: to simultaneously rehabilitate all 28 buildings of a shuttered 19th-century factory in this depressed Berkshire County town for the long-term display of monumental art installations.

title: As C.E.O. Pay Packages Grow, Top Executives Have the Presidents Ear
description: Pay packages for Americas top executives once again climbed in 2016 after slipping the year before.

title: A Football Coachs Struggle With C.T.E.  and a Guilty Conscience
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  In the last years of his life, the longtime football coach for dominating college teams wrestled with impaired speech, forgetfulness, lapses in concentration. And with his conscience.

title: For Army Infantrys 1st Women, Heavy Packs and the Weight of History
description: FORT BENNING, Ga.  The first group of women graduated from United States Army infantry training last week, but with soldiers obscured by body armor, camouflage face paint and smoke grenades, it was almost impossible to distinguish the mixed-gender squads in the steamy woods from those of earlier generations.

title: My Deaf Son Fought Speech. Sign Language Let Him Bloom.
description: I watched my toddler wade into the Gulf and launch a fistful of pebbles in flight. They glistened, tiny sparks of light, before I realized he was up to his chin in cold water. And I realized that if I called his name, if I screamed it, the word would sink like stone.

title: How Much Sugar Is in a Glass of Wine?
description: Q. Some wineries add sugar to dry red wines after fermentation so that they taste smoother to the American palate. How can I find out how much sugar is in what I am drinking?

description: We are honoring each of the Top 10 winners of our Fourth Annual Student Editorial Contest by publishing an essay a day. You can find them all here.

title: At Bay Area Restaurant, Roadside Food With a California Accent
description: Step up to the counter at Dads Luncheonette, and two things immediately become apparent. First, the restaurant is an old train caboose, with no indoor seating. Second, the man who descends from the caboose every few minutes to serve his customers may very well be the happiest chef in Northern California.

title: Trump Has Changed a Night at the Opera, Too
description: It was two days before the inauguration of Donald J. Trump, and I had never been so eager to be heading to a production of Rossinis The Barber of Seville. The contentious election and its stunning result had left Americans bitterly divided. Spending a few hours in the comfort of the Metropolitan Opera enjoying the madcap adventures of Rossinis endearing characters would surely provide a welcome escape.

title: Still Haunted After a Case Goes Cold
description: The night it happened he was outdoors. It was a syrupy thick summer evening in Brooklyn, abundant with promise. Bernard Sowells lingered near the front stoop of his rental home on Van Siclen Avenue in the East New York neighborhood. It had a metal fence and a smear of parched lawn. Neighbors clucked in casual pleasantries as the night listlessly stretched out. It was around 11. The date was July 20, 2000.

title: For Two Runners, Married Life Begins at Mile 6
description: If the particulars of Alex Salazars transformation from couch potato to marathon man are fuzzy  he calls his efforts pretty casual  the benefits are clearly defined. In addition to toned pectorals and fierce quadriceps, Mr. Salazar gained a sense of purpose and a bustling social life after he started running and working out in 2012.

title: The Power of Ariana Grande
description: LONDON  Between Instagram and Twitter, Ariana Grande has over 150 million followers, more than the population of Britain and France combined. Bubbly and self-assured, this young artist whose Manchester show ended in the blast of a terrorist bomb connects every day with her fans, known as Arianators.

description: I think we have an opportunity to establish overnight a leadership position, Hamilton E. James, president of Blackstone, said of the $20 billion cornerstone investment by Saudi Arabias sovereign wealth fund in his firms infrastructure fund.

title: Gunmen in Egypt Force Coptic Christian Pilgrims From Buses and Kill 28
description: CAIRO  Dressed in military fatigues, the gunmen waved down the bus filled with Christian pilgrims as it wended its way down a dusty side-road in the desert of western Egypt, headed toward a monastery.

title: A Small, Untrained Talent Becomes Americas Most Expensive Artist at Auction
description: Occasionally, the art market achieves a truly exceptional price that makes headlines round the world, leaves experts in shock and makes millions of people view an artist in a different way. The $39.9 million paid at Christies in 1987 for Van Goghs Sunflowers was one such result. The $110.5 million bid last week at Sothebys for Jean-Michel Basquiats 1982 Neo-Expressionist painting of a skull, Untitled, may well be another.

description: This interview with Elisa Steele, chief executive of Jive Software, a provider of social networking software for businesses, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Young Comic TV Showrunners From Left Field
description: BURBANK, Calif.  Bajillion Dollar Propertie$, the Seeso streaming services workplace comedy about the hot young brokers of Platinum Realty, is set in a glass-and-steel tower in Beverly Hills, Calif. But the sound bites in this mockumentary, where their whining and conniving are exposed, are filmed in a cramped studio in the production offices here belonging to its creator and showrunner, Kulap Vilaysack.

title: Stuck in Memorial Day Traffic? Here Are 15 Podcasts to Distract You
description: Apart from being the unofficial start of summer, Memorial Day weekend marks the onset of another seasonal staple: a heck of a lot of time sitting in a motionless car, trapped in traffic.

title: Why the Palestinian Authority Should Be Shuttered
description: RAMALLAH, WEST BANK  President Trumps meeting this week with the president of the Palestinian Authority, Mahmoud Abbas, was pitched as an effort by the author of The Art of the Deal to restart the United States-sponsored peace process, long stalled. But as next months 50th anniversary of the Israeli occupation approaches, this much is certain: The process is worse than stalled. In the face of an intransigent right-wing government in Israel, which doesnt believe Palestinians should have full rights, negotiations are futile.

title: Philippines Strains to Clear ISIS-Inspired Militants From Southern City
description: MANILA  As fighting continued Friday between government forces and Islamic State-linked insurgents in the southern Philippines, the government said that foreign militants were among those taking part in the clashes.

title: Movers: G-7 Summit Meeting
description: Were following major developments in the markets throughout the day. Check below for the latest updates.

title: In Indonesia and Philippines, Militants Find a Common Bond: ISIS
description: BANGKOK  An eruption of violence in the southern Philippines and suicide bombings in Indonesia this week highlight the growing threat posed by militant backers of the Islamic State in Southeast Asia.

title: 1967: U.S. War Toll Sets a Record
description: SAIGON  The U.S. command reported today that American casualties last week were the highest of any week in the war in Vietnam. A total of 337 U.S. servicemen were killed in action, 31 listed as missing, and 2,282 were wounded  by far the heaviest losses in any one week.

title: New Emoji Is a Meaningful Symbol for Indigenous Australians
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Hundreds of Australian Aboriginal leaders gathered on Friday at Uluru, a massive sandstone monolith in Australias central desert, to call for a road map to a treaty and to enshrine an indigenous representative body in the Constitution. Around the same time, a new emoji was quietly added to Twitter: the Australian Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags.

title: California Today: Rising Rent Threatens a Los Angeles Treasure
description: Good morning.

title: Petra Kvitova in French Open Field, 5 Months After Attack
description: PARIS  Five months after a home invaders knife sliced into her left hand, Petra Kvitova will return to competitive tennis at the French Open, a last-minute decision to make her comeback earlier than expected.

title: Can the Paris Climate Deal Survive a Trump-Style Renegotiation?
description: As President Trump ponders whether the United States should stay in or leave the Paris climate agreement, many of his closest allies and advisers have been urging him to keep the country in but renegotiate the deal to better reflect his energy policies.

title: How Jo Miller of Full Frontal With Samantha Bee Spends Her Sundays
description: Jo Miller, the show runner, executive producer and head writer for Full Frontal With Samantha Bee on TBS, has not always had a high-flying comedy career. If you can name any job, Ive had it, said Ms. Miller, 50, who had worked in academia, construction and food service, among other fields, before she was hired to write for The Daily Show, where she met Ms. Bee and the co-executive producer for Full Frontal, Alison Camillo. We are like the three perimenopausal musketeers, she said. During the week, Ms. Miller lives with her cat, Sammy, in Harlem, but on Friday nights, they drive to her 650-square-foot house in the Catskills. Sammy loves it, she said. He thinks hes king of the jungle up there.

title: Ultranationalist Monks in Myanmar, Facing Crackdown, Say Theyre Unrepentant
description: HONG KONG  In the wake of vigilante attacks and brawls that have shaken Yangon, Myanmars largest and most cosmopolitan city, the countrys religious authorities are ramping up a crackdown on hard-line Buddhist monks who have played increasingly public roles as sectarian provocateurs.

title: Why Britain Gets Angry When America Is Casual With Secrets
description: LONDON  The leaking of sensitive information about the investigation into Mondays terrorist attack on the Manchester Arena, including forensic images of bomb apparatus, to United States media caused dismay and anger among British officials. The prime minister, Theresa May, went so far as to raise the issue directly with President Trump when they met at Thursdays NATO conference in Brussels.

title: Somehow, This Fish Fathered a Near Clone of Itself
description: A female and male get together. One thing leads to another, and they have sex. His sperm fuses with her egg, half of his DNA combining with half of her DNA to form an embryo.

title: Britain Says It Has Large Part of Manchester Bombers Network
description: MANCHESTER, England  British officials expressed confidence on Friday that they had rounded up the bulk of the Manchester bombers associates, and that their efforts to avert a follow-up attack appeared to be succeeding.

title: Geoffrey Rush Loves to Play Rogues and Fools. A Genius, Too.
description: Before he caught the acting bug, Geoffrey Rush fancied himself something of a cosmologist, obsessed by space exploration and diligently studying math, physics and chemistry.

title: 11 Years Old, a Mom, and Pushed to Marry Her Rapist in Florida
description: When she was a scrawny 11-year-old, Sherry Johnson found out one day that she was about to be married to a 20-year-old member of her church who had raped her.

title: The Question Isnt Why Wage Growth Is So Low. Its Why Its So High.
description: One of the economys biggest mysteries is this: The labor market is the strongest it has been in a decade, yet wages are rising barely faster than inflation.

title: Where to Stream Some of the Best Movies of 2017
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation website. For great suggestions of what to watch straight to your inbox, subscribe to our three-times weekly newsletter here.

title: Senator John Kennedy (No, Not That One) Embraces Anonymity
description: WASHINGTON  Senator John Kennedy shuffles alone through the Capitol basement, reveling in his bag of walnuts, unrecognized and unbothered as reporters chase his colleagues for comments on the daily swirl.

title: To Invest in Your Childs Theater Dreams, First Invest in the Theater
description: Dean Roth, the owner and president of a New Jersey company that makes parts for the tool-and-die industry, admits he has utterly failed to talk his teenage daughter out of pursuing a career in musical theater.

title: When Donald Trump Met Pope Francis
description: Or, when @realDonaldTrump met @Pontifex.

title: Review: How Laws of Physics Govern Growth in Business and in Cities
description: The new book of Geoffrey West, a theoretical physicist, comes with a mouthful of a subtitle that suggests he has unlocked the secrets of human existence  Scale: The Universal Laws of Growth, Innovation, Sustainability and the Pace of Life in Organisms, Cities, Economies, and Companies (Penguin).

title: Iraqi Forces in Mosul Plan ISIS Assault, but Fight Could Be Long
description: LONDON  Although the Iraqi military on Friday began leafleting areas of western Mosul still controlled by the Islamic State, warning people to evacuate because an offensive was imminent, the American military is not predicting a speedy resolution to the battle for the city.

title: China Moves to Stabilize Currency, Despite Promise to Loosen Control
description: HONG KONG  China has made a big show of gradually loosening its grip on the value of its currency, an effort meant to mollify critics like President Trump and experts who have long urged Beijing to let markets fix financial problems in the worlds second-largest economy.

title: Homework? First I Need to Get to the Bottom of This Comey Story
description: ST. LOUIS  Its 7:32 on a recent Wednesday morning, and Gabe Fleisher is racing to put the finishing touches on his daily newsletter, Wake Up to Politics. Its been a busy 24-hour news cycle. Another day, another bombshell, the newsletter begins.

title: Waiting for the Credits to End? Movies Are Naming More Names
description: It is now a standard feature of the typical Hollywood blockbuster. You watch scenes that have become more complex and dazzling than ever in their visual effects and technical mastery, then sit through end credits that feel almost novelistic in length: hundreds, or frequently thousands, of names in a blur of acknowledgment of the village it took to stage a superhero battle or bring robots to photorealistic life.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Saturday Night Fever at 40: You Should Still Be Dancing
description: The first year of Jimmy Carters presidency was extraordinary for Hollywood: Star Wars opened in May 1977 and Close Encounters of the Third Kind in November, followed weeks later by Saturday Night Fever, reissued this month in a Blu-ray directors cut adding 15 minutes to the release version.

title: A Garden Oasis in the Lobby
description: Beginning next month, residents coming home to the new 392-unit rental building at 525 West 52nd Street will be welcomed by a lobby with an interior garden as its centerpiece. Enclosed in glass on three sides, like some giant terrarium, but open to the sky, the inaccessible landscape will sprout with ferns, horsetail and magnolia trees.

title: Katie Hopkins, Conservative Provocateur, to Leave Radio Show After Tweet
description: LONDON  An outspoken commentator who gained fame after appearing on The Apprentice will be leaving her job at the radio station LBC after a post on social media about the recent attack in Manchester.

title: Taliban Kill at Least 15 at Afghan Army Outpost in Kandahar
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan  The Taliban besieged an Afghan Army outpost early on Friday and during hours of fighting killed at least 15 soldiers and wounded five, officials said, adding to a string of recent attacks in the strategically vital province of Kandahar.

title: El Museo del Barrio Fires Executive as New Director Faces More Challenges
description: El Museo del Barrio, which has struggled with financial problems and abrupt leadership changes in recent years, has fired one of two senior executives who had been temporarily running the institution. The dismissal comes after El Museo, the oldest museum in the United States devoted to Latino art, appointed a new executive director who is facing multiple challenges, including a basic one: obtaining permission to work in the United States.

title: Shakira Finds Liberation, One Song at a Time
description: Not long ago, the Colombian songwriter and pop star Shakira didnt know if she would ever make another album. I was full of doubts, and I thought I was never going to make good music again, she said in an interview at a Midtown Manhattan hotel suite on a busy day of promotion for yes, a new album, El Dorado, released on Friday.

title: Twin Peaks Season 3, Episodes 3-4 Recap: Falling in Space
description: It made sense for Showtime to air the first two hours of the Twin Peaks revival together last week, because the episodes flow so cleanly that its hard to tell where one ends and the next begins. Putting Part 3 and Part 4 back-to-back, though, wasnt really fair to either. Part 3 offers a dose of David Lynch madness so concentrated and so puzzling that it mightve been best just to let it bounce around in viewers heads for a week. Part 4 has its own charms, but after an hour of mesmerizing Lynchian nightmares, its not so easy to shift gears to deadpan comedy and celebrity guests.

title: Paris, London and New York in the Age of Revolution
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music

title: Journalists Footage Shows Iraqi Forces Torturing Civilians, ABC Report Says
description: Video smuggled out of Iraq by an Iraqi journalist and broadcast by ABC News on Thursday appears to show members of an Iraqi special forces unit  one that has been praised by the United States  torturing and executing civilians in Mosul during a campaign against the Islamic State last year.

title: Rental Building Rises on Domino Sugar Site
description: Williamsburg, Brooklyn, is set to shed another layer of its industrial past this summer with the opening of a 16-story rental building on the site of the former Domino Sugar refinery.

title: Shopping for Toy Storage
description: A beautifully designed room rarely looks better with toys scattered across the floor. But with the right storage pieces, straightening up after a childs play session can be a snap.

title: At Wellesley, Hillary Clinton Criticizes Trump and Invokes Nixon Resignation
description: WELLESLEY, Mass.  Hillary Clinton never named him, but she excoriated him.

title: A Courtroom Novelist Tackles War Crimes in Bosnia
description: CHANGE OF VENUE: Scott Turows new novel, Testimony, enters the hardcover fiction list at No. 6, and it abandons Turows usual setting of Kindle County, Ill., to follow a Bosnian war-crimes trial in the International Criminal Court. Why the change? In 2000, Turow told me via email, in the midst of a book tour, I attended a reception at the United States ambassadors residence in The Hague, where I was encircled by a number of American lawyers working at war-crimes tribunals the U.N. had established. They all insisted I had to write a novel about one of those courts, because the magnitude of the cases, the diplomatic entanglements and the personal politics combined to make fertile ground. Usually, when people tell me theres a huge injustice I must write about, its their divorce proceedings. But a war-crimes court seemed like a unique setting that I never forgot. He added, I knew far less than I should have about the sad history of the Bosnian conflict, but I soon came to see those killing fields as a provocative stage for a story about the law.

description: This weeks properties include a five-bedroom in North Stamford, Conn., and a two-bedroom in South Salem, N.Y.

title: 10 Things to Do in NYC Now
description: This archly witty English pop-rock band has gained a fervent  and growing  American audience in the last two years, thanks in part to the reputation of its outspoken lead singer, Matthew Healy. (On Tuesday, he paused a show to deliver a profanity-laced denunciation of the deadly attack that night at an Ariana Grande concert in the groups native Manchester.) The latest studio album from the 1975, I Like It When You Sleep, for You Are So Beautiful Yet So Unaware of It, is full of self-aware commentary on modern romance and immaculate new-wave hooks  many of which will get the arena-scale grandeur they cry out for on Thursday night at the bands first-ever headline gig at the Garden. SIMON VOZICK-LEVINSON

title: Finding Missing Notifications
description: Q. I thought I had turned on iPhone notifications for a couple of my favorite news apps, but I dont seem to be getting any alerts  especially when I know there are headlines all over the place these days and my phone isnt locked. How can I fix this?

title: A Mural Designed by Carmen Herrera Will Be Painted by Bronx School Students
description: Last year the Whitney Museum of American Art gave what was widely considered a long-overdue debut exhibition to the painter Carmen Herrera, who turns 102 next Wednesday. This year, she is taking her art to another institution, albeit a more humble one: M.S. 244, in the Bronx.

description: In January, Mark Zuckerberg, Facebooks chief executive, vowed to see America.

title: Cyclists: Where to Live in New York
description: In New York City, about 86,000 people bike to work and there are more than 1,000 miles of bicycle lanes, according to city officials. Citi Bike has expanded its network of bike-sharing stations deeper into Brooklyn, Queens and even Jersey City.

title: The Mall of Americas Writer in Residence Has a Knack for Landing Offbeat Gigs
description: More than 4,000 people applied to be the Mall of Americas writer-in-residence, which, if you think about it, probably says something about just how tough it is to make a living as a writer.

title: The Awkward Body Language of Donald Trump
description: Our golden-haired leader is no silver-tongued devil, but thats O.K. What he lacks in verbal zingers he makes up for with physical ones.

title: HBO Renews Veep and Silicon Valley, but Theres One Subtraction
description: Is there more intrigue left in the post-presidency of Selina Meyer? HBO is betting so, with its announcement of a seventh season of Veep, the networks popular sendup of modern-day politics starring Julia Louis-Dreyfus. And fans of tech culture satire can rest easy as well: Silicon Valley, the biting comedy created by Mike Judge about technology entrepreneurs in the Bay Area, is coming back for a fifth season.

title: Candidates Call to Save Canadian Values? Un-Canadian, Critics Say
description: To Kellie Leitch, one of more than a dozen candidates vying to lead Canadas Conservative Party, the most pressing issue today is something that some of her critics consider un-Canadian: the need to preserve what she calls Canadian values through a more restrictive immigration policy.

title: A Right to Bingo, but Not Clean Water, in New Yorks Constitution
description: ALBANY  The Bill of Rights in the New York State Constitution protects a number of essential liberties. Freedom of worship? Check. The right to assemble? Check. Freedom to divorce? That, too. The right to play bingo and gamble on horses? You bet.

title: An Effect of Climate Change You Could Really Lose Sleep Over
description: Global warming caused by human emissions of greenhouse gases is having clear effects in the physical world: more heat waves, heavier rainstorms and higher sea levels, to cite a few.

title: Leek and Spring Onion Gratin
description: This comforting side dish combines sweet caramelized spring onions and leeks, gooey cheese and a crisp crust.

title: A Cheesy, Oniony Gratin That Brings a Family Together
description: The members of the allium family can be a confusing lot.

title: Trump Says NATO Allies Dont Pay Their Share. Is That True?
description: President Trump castigated the leaders of NATO allies to their faces during his trip to Europe this week, suggesting that many of them owe massive amounts of money to the alliance. Mr. Trump has a point, but he mischaracterizes the way it works.

title: What I Love | Beowulf Boritt
description: When Beowulf Boritt and his wife bought a prewar fixer-upper, he used all the tricks he learned in the theater to redo it.

title: Beowulf Boritt, Set Designer, Renovates His Home
description: It may well be, as the saying goes, that doctors wives die young, shoemakers children go barefoot and car mechanics drive wrecks. But if Beowulf Boritt is any proof, set designers would sooner hand over their staple guns than give short shrift to home sweet (and soigne) home.

title: Hamilton Minus Music
description: If you can tear yourself away from Lin-Manuel Mirandas soundtrack, theres a more direct (if less rhyming) way to learn about Alexander Hamilton. The Essential Hamilton, edited by the Yale professor Joanne B. Freeman and published this month by the Library of America, collects examples of the founding fathers personal and political writings.

title: Review: Rom-Com as Ritual in The Art of Luv (Part 5)
description: Psychedelic and shambolic, the Royal Osiris Karaoke Ensembles The Art of Luv (Part 5): Swipe Right/ROK Cupid explores courtship in the age of the app. Tinders tag line, Its like real life, but better, wont apply here.

title: From Heavy Metal Frontman to Taiwans Parliament
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  In a land renowned for its singalong pop songs and bubble milk tea, Freddy Lim has always been something of a black sheep.

title: Ben Carson and the Poverty State of Mind
description: To the Editor:

title: Coptic Christians: Islamic States Favorite Prey
description: At this rate Copts will be extinct in 100 years. They will die, leave, convert or get killed, a friend wrote on Facebook as news broke of the latest bloody attack on Egypts Coptic Christians. Less than two months ago, while attending church in Cairo on Palm Sunday, my friend told me shed mused to herself that it was a blessing her daughter wasnt with her: If there was a bombing, at least her child would survive. Forty-five Copts were murdered that day by the Islamic State in churches in Alexandria and Tanta. Such are the thoughts of Coptic parents in Egypt these days.

title: On Leaving the White House
description: To the Editor:

title: The Playlist: Matt Ox Delivers the Sound of This Second
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. You can listen to this playlist on Spotify here. Like this Playlist? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com, and sign up for our Louder newsletter here.

title: David and Goliath in Vietnam
description: There are some events that can be understood only with the perspective of time. The war in Vietnam is one.

title: Melania Trumps International Style
description: The first lady wore modest outfits (and many belts) on her first trip overseas since the inauguration.

title: Review: A Fast-Rising Czech Conductor Leads the Philharmonic
description: The 35-year-old Czech conductor Jakub Hrusa has been rising fast. Already the chief conductor of the Bamberg Symphony in Germany and the permanent guest conductor of the Czech Philharmonic, he becomes principal guest conductor of the Philharmonia Orchestra in London next season and appears regularly with major orchestras and opera houses.

title: During Ramadan, Home Cooks Shine
description: For Amanda Saab, the flavors of Ramadan are baked into sweet, tender bites of namoura. Her Lebanese grandmother used to make the cake, folding together frothy, aerated yogurt and semolina flour. Now Ms. Saab makes it the same way, soaking the cake in a floral-scented sugar syrup while its still warm from the oven, and cutting it into diamond-shaped pieces.

title: The Lessons of Montana
description: After I finished college, I worked on a ballot issue campaign in Montana, where I grew up. The other side had enormous popular support, and we had eight weeks. My dad told me not to take the job because we were going to lose and it was going to be depressing. I took it anyway. We made our case in the press and in ads, and people listened, and we won. And Montana was better for it. That election was one of the most thrilling nights of my life.

title: The Trump Effect on C.E.O. Pay
description: After the November election, the stock market experienced a Trump bump. The surge in share prices thrilled investors, but some corporate executives had even more reason to celebrate. Thats because rising prices can fuel higher pay even if other corporate results are so-so, which seems to be the case for some companies right now.

title: Trump Course Solicits New Members
description: The Trump National Golf Club in Virginia sent this letter soliciting membership and promoting its facilities.

title: With a Presidential Boost, the P.G.A. Comes to Trump National
description: STERLING, Va.  On the green at the 11th hole, the golf stars John Daly and Rocco Mediate sized up their opening tournament putts. Nearby, a Golf Channel crew swung its cameras into place. And a pack of spectators lined up to watch it all.

title: Bluesy Incantation: This Weeks 8 Best Classical Music Moments
description: In addition to reviews, features and news during the week, our critics and reporters collect the best of what theyve heard: notes that sent shivers down their spines, memorable voices, quotations that cut to the heart of the story.

title: Melania Trump on Display, Dressed in Ambivalence and Armor
description: And so we come to the end of what has been the longest and most comprehensive viewing of Melania Trump playing the role of first lady since her husbands administration began: nine days, five countries, more than a dozen outfits, all of them photographed and recorded (and exclaimed over) for the historical record.

title: World Leaders Increase Pressure on Trump to Stay in the Paris Accord
description: TAORMINA, Sicily  World leaders on Friday intensified their pressure on President Trump to keep the United States in the Paris climate agreement, as negotiators for seven Western powers labored to bridge differences between Mr. Trump and his counterparts before they depart on Saturday.

title: Ballerinas and Top Cops
description: Benefits took place for the American Ballet Theater, the Whitney Museum, the New York City Police Foundation and the Holy Apostles Soup Kitchen.

title: Ballerinas and Top Cops
description: The American Ballet Theater held its spring gala May 22 at Lincoln Center. The Whitney Museum of American Arts annual gala and studio party was May 23. The New York City Police Foundation gave its annual gala May 18 at the Sheraton New York. And the annual farm-to-tray benefit for the Holy Apostles Soup Kitchen was May 18 at its Chelsea home.

title: Canada Today: End-of-Life Stories
description: One of the hardest parts of my job is not writing many of the stories I gather. There is never enough room. My article about John Shieldss decision to end his life was particularly heartbreaking on this account because he wasnt the only person who opened up his life and pending death to me. Two women also did.

title: Congressional Democrats Letter to State Senators
description: The Democratic members of New Yorks congressional delegation sent a letter to every Democrat in the State Senate, calling on a group of breakaway Democrats to return to the fold.

description: After several days of silence, Ariana Grande responded on Friday to the bombing at her concert in Manchester this week, saying that she would perform a benefit concert there and suggesting that her tour  on hold since the attack  would go on.

description: The remarkable thing about Vice President Mike Pence is that he is not remarkable at all.
