description: Tourist has become a dirty word in the hospitality business. The preferred word? Local.

title: For Steve Johnson at French Open, a First-Round Win and Tears
description: PARIS  Steve Johnsons eyes were pink and glossy with tears as he sat in a small interview room at Roland Garros on Monday. He had just won a five-set match that tested his emotional mettle, but he was unable to answer a question about his father.

title: Strange Scene Behind Curtain at Ceremony for Dwight Gooden
description: A good politician is a natural flirt who knows that sports loyalties are a shortcut to a fans heart.

title: Jared Kushner, Russia, Angela Merkel: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Political Winds Leave New Jersey Lawmaker Caught Between Party and Home
description: It was the scribbled footnote that did it, rippling across social media networks from northern New Jersey to Washington, revealing a pugnacious side of a low-key lawmaker.

title: Hello? Dolly? Bette Midler Seems Unlikely to Sing at Tony Awards
description: Josh Groban plans to lead the cast of Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812 in a mash-up of the shows ballad and its big dance number at the Tony Awards ceremony next month. Ben Platt expects to perform Waving Through a Window, an emotional song from Dear Evan Hansen. The cast of Falsettos, a show that closed in January, will reunite to perform a number from that musical.

title: The Earliest Signs of Brain Damage in Athletes? Listen for Them
description: Evidence continues to mount that professional athletes in a number of contact sports are suffering brain damage as a result of head impacts. But there is no reliable test to detect the injury, called chronic traumatic encephalopathy, in its earliest stages.

title: Scientists Link a Gene Mutation to Rheumatic Heart Disease
description: Whether a painful strep throat turns into a fatal case of heart disease depends not just on prompt antibiotic treatment but also on the patients genetic makeup, according to a new study led by Oxford University scientists.

title: Gay and Transgender Patients to Doctors: Well Tell. Just Ask.
description: Do doctors need to know their patients sexual orientation and gender identity?

title: In Antarctica, Scientists Are Lured to a Frozen Desert
description: Welcome to the McMurdo Dry Valleys, the largest ice-free region in Antarctica and one of the driest places on the planet. Most of the continent is covered in thick ice, but this place is a striking exception. Sheltering mountains and dry winds from the continent preserve a frigid desert that defies all expectations.

title: Whats Your Citys Newly Annoying Neighborhood? Ask Hedwig.
description: Hedwig and the Angry Inch always uses topical and local references written just for the cities where it plays. So its natural that when the musicals national tour finishes in Washington next month, Hedwig, played by Euan Morton, will save her wrath for the most topical local of them all: President Trump.

title: Fierce Wind Lashes Moscow, Leaving 12 Dead
description: MOSCOW  A fierce windstorm caused by an extreme cold front killed 12 people here on Monday.

title: A Former F.B.I. Agent on Terrorism Since the Death of Bin Laden
description: ANATOMY OF TERRORFrom the Death of Bin Laden to the Rise of the Islamic State By Ali Soufan359 pages. W.W. Norton & Company. $27.95.

title: Noncompete Clauses for Too Many Workers
description: To the Editor:

title: Safe Abortions, and the Adoption Option
description: To the Editor:

title: Were Forward-Looking. Or Are We?
description: To the Editor:

title: Car Accidents Remain a Top Child Killer, and Belts a Reliable Savior
description: The most common cause of death in children under the age of 15 is unintentional injury, and the most common cause of unintentional injury is car accidents.

title: Inside Sonny Rollinss Jazz Archive, Headed Home to Harlem
description: The saxophonist Sonny Rollins, perhaps jazzs most respected living improviser, is also one of its most relentless seekers. But thats well known; whats not as widely recognized is the diversity  and the depth  of his inquiry.

title: Challenging Mainstream Thought About Beautys Big Hand in Evolution
description: Not long ago, a physicist at Stanford posed a rhetorical question that took me by surprise.

title: In Albany, Stipends Known as Lulus Feed a Culture of Scandal
description: ALBANY  Corruption and scandal have claimed the most powerful and recognizable names in New York State, from governors like Eliot Spitzer to entrenched legislative leaders like Sheldon Silver and Dean G. Skelos.

title: Hunting Down the Lost Apples of the Pacific Northwest
description: STEPTOE, Wash.  David Benscoter honed his craft as an investigator for the F.B.I. and the United States Treasury, cornering corrupt politicians and tax evaders. The lost apple trees that he hunts down now are really not so different. People and things, he said, tend to hide in plain sight if you know how and where to look.

title: Behind the Scenes at Orchard Platform, a Struggle to Innovate
description: On a warm morning early last year, a start-up founder named Matt Burton addressed a group of 175 investors and executives at the sleek glass IAC building in Chelsea.

title: Indias Bad Debt Is Looking Better to Investors
description: MUMBAI, India  In India, the vultures are circling.

title: When Political Intelligence Meets Insider Trading
description: A case involving insider trading charges based on government information dispensed by a political intelligence operative raises interesting questions about how some of the tricky rules for proving the offense will be applied when information is leaked from a federal agency rather than a corporation.

title: Orioles Dylan Bundy Shows His Best Stuff in Beating the Yankees
description: BALTIMORE  A chessboard sits on a card table at the far end of the Baltimore Orioles clubhouse, near most of the pitchers lockers. It helps many of them pass the downtime that is so abundant once they have studied video, reviewed scouting reports and worked through their throwing routines.

title: Immigrants Keep an Iowa Meatpacking Town Alive and Growing
description: STORM LAKE, Iowa  When Dan Smith first went to work at the pork processing plant in Storm Lake in 1980, pretty much the only way to nab that kind of union job was to have a father, an uncle or a brother already there. The pay, he recalled, was $16 an hour, with benefits  enough to own a home, a couple of cars, a camper and a boat, while your wife stayed home with the children.

title: How Much Trump Is Good for the G.O.P. in House Races?
description: ROSWELL, Ga.  In the northern suburbs of Atlanta, where what is likely to be the most expensive House campaign in history is being waged, a band of conservative advocacy groups is grappling with a question that may decide whether the Republican Party keeps its House majority after 2018: Do you run with President Trump or against him?

title: A Creationist Wants Rocks to Study. The Grand Canyon Says No.
description: PHOENIX  Did Noahs flood create the Grand Canyon? Not a chance, say mainstream scientists, who maintain that the canyons layers of rocks were carved and chiseled by a persistent flow of water beginning some five million years ago. But Andrew A. Snelling  a geologist by training, a creationist by conviction  has a minority view, and he hoped to prove himself right.

title: No Corrections: May 30, 2017
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: New Yorkers Eagerly Head to Ferries, and Grumpily Board Them
description: Crowds. Delays. Fraying tempers.

title: With Collins Under Scrutiny for Pitching Decisions, His Latest Pays Off
description: Mets Manager Terry Collins has a strong stomach. That was evident in an answer he gave on Monday about how he deals with criticism  from the news media, from Mets fans, and even from within the team  concerning his heavy use of his bullpen.

title: White House Acts to Roll Back Birth-Control Mandate for Religious Employers
description: WASHINGTON  Federal officials, following through on a pledge by President Trump, have drafted a rule to roll back a federal requirement that many religious employers provide birth control coverage in health insurance plans.

title: Drug Lobbyists Battle Cry Over Prices: Blame the Others
description: WASHINGTON  Hundreds of independent pharmacists swarmed the House and Senate office buildings one recent afternoon, climbing the marble staircases as they rushed from one appointment to the next, pitching lawmakers on their plan to rein in the soaring drug prices that have enraged American consumers.

title: Quotation of the Day: Leaping Shark Floors Angler in Australia
description: I looked over and said, Oh, a bloody shark.

title: A Daring Beer Run to Soldiers in Vietnam, Recounted Yet Again
description: For decades, Chick Donohues greatest beer run story has been met with incredulous scoffs.

title: Payment Processor First Data to Buy CardConnect for $750 Million
description: First Data agreed on Monday to buy CardConnect, a fellow payment processor, for about $750 million in cash including the repayment of debt, in its biggest takeover since going public in 2015.

title: Puerto Rican Day Parade Honoree: A Bad Guy. Why Not?
description: Two weeks before the 60th annual Puerto Rican Day Parade in New York City, Andrs Otero was his own grand marshal of the Loisaida Festival, a neighborhood celebration on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. Decked head to toe in the colors of the Puerto Rican flag on Sunday, he drove down the middle of Avenue C in a red scooter festooned with stickers of conga drums and roosters.

title: Ann Birstein, Memoirist and Novelist, Dies at 89
description: Ann Birstein, a novelist and memoirist who recounted her bittersweet Jewish roots in New York as a rabbis daughter in Hells Kitchen and her turbulent marriage to the literary critic Alfred Kazin, died on Wednesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 89.

title: As Computer Coding Classes Swell, So Does Cheating
description: For a simple assignment, writing code that would allow one computer to visit web pages located on another, two students in H. E. Dunsmores class at Purdue University turned in nearly 100 identical lines of code. Was it a fluke? Or had they cheated?

title: Cant Get There From Grand Central
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Look at Major Drug-Pricing Proposals
description: Several bills that seek to tackle the high cost of prescription drugs are moving through Congress, and the Trump administration has also signaled that it may take action.

title: Egypts President Enacts Law Placing Severe Restrictions on Aid Groups
description: CAIRO  President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi on Monday enacted a law that imposes strict new regulations on aid groups, stoking fears that his government intends to accelerate its harsh crackdown on human rights activists before a presidential election scheduled for next year.

title: Frank Deford, a Literary Storyteller of Sport, Dies at 78
description: Frank Deford, who mined the sports world for human stories and told them with literary grace over six decades in Sports Illustrated, a shelf of books and many years of radio and television commentary, died on Sunday at his home in Key West, Fla. He was 78.

title: With Italy No Longer in U.S. Focus, Russia Swoops to Fill the Void
description: ROME  President Trump made the most of his short time in Italy. He was treated to a private audience with the pope, met with both the countrys president and its prime minister in Rome, flew to Sicily for a summit meeting of world leaders and visited with American troops at a nearby naval air station.

title: Investigation Turns to Kushners Motives in Meeting With a Putin Ally
description: WASHINGTON  Jared Kushner, the presidents son-in-law and senior adviser, was looking for a direct line to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia  a search that in mid-December found him in a room with a Russian banker whose financial institution was deeply intertwined with Russian intelligence, and remains under sanction by the United States.

title: Texas Lawmaker Threatens to Shoot Colleague After Reporting Protesters to ICE
description: A Texas state representative, referring to protesters at the State Capitol on Monday, said he reported several illegal immigrants to federal immigration authorities and then threatened to shoot a fellow lawmaker who objected.

title: In Battle of Two French Open Champions, Garbie Muguruza Dominates
description: PARIS  Garbie Muguruza began the defense of her French Open title on Monday against another player who has lifted the trophy on Court Philippe Chatrier: Francesca Schiavone, the 2010 champion.

title: Theresa May Doesnt Crack and Jeremy Corbyn Keeps His Cool in U.K. Debate
description: LONDON  After an inept start to campaigning in Britains general election and a pause following the Manchester bombing, Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday navigated a television debate and interview without sustaining further political damage, yet without banishing doubts about her leadership that were raised by a significant policy reversal last week.

title: Brains
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Here at the Gray Lady, were used to not being too self-referential. One of the things you learn when you start out here is that the most interesting stories are always about other people, not about ones self. And I agree, in general, with this policy.

title: Pharoah Sanders and Perfume Genius to Perform at Dutch Festival
description: The eclectic and probing Le Guess Who? festival will return to the Netherlands in November with a lineup that includes Pharoah Sanders, Perfume Genius and Grouper, the organizers announced on Tuesday.

title: Hilary Duff Is Still a Shimmering Star
description: Hilary Duff may have come up as a bubbly Disney star, but these days she plays a complex, career-focused editor on TV Lands comedy Younger, back this month for Season 4. When she is not on set in New York, Ms. Duff, 29, who lives in Los Angeles and is the mother to a 5-year-old son, Luca Cruz Comrie, might be trying out yoga classes and dabbling in makeup. Peruse her favorites, below.

title: Angela Merkel, Vladimir Putin, Francesco Totti: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Predators Uneven Play Gives Penguins Early Lead in Stanley Cup Finals
description: PITTSBURGH  Imagine dreaming about going away to college, about the opportunity for validation and reinvention that it presents. And then, when move-in day finally arrives, imagine encountering a roommate who hasnt showered in a week, a suitcase that got run over by a truck and a nasty case of food poisoning.

title: What I Saw at the Venice Biennale
description: A veteran reporters first trip to the 57th edition of the worlds most important international art festival.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: House of Cards and The Americans
description: House of Cards, one of the first Netflix original series, is back for its fifth season of soap opera-quality politics for your bingeing pleasure. And on FX, The Americans concludes Season 5 after the most recent episode ended with a cliffhanger.

title: Why Noriegas Ouster Still Reverberates
description: Removing Manuel Noriega, the dictator of Panama, from power in 1989 not only entailed what was then the largest American military action since Vietnam, but also set the stage for future actions by the United States.

title: Manuel Noriega, Dictator Ousted by U.S. in Panama, Dies at 83
description: Manuel Antonio Noriega, the brash former dictator of Panama and sometime ally of the United States whose ties to drug trafficking led to his ouster in 1989 in what was then the largest American military action since the Vietnam War, died Monday night in Panama City. He was 83.

title: Australias Real Estate Boom Has Wall Street Wooing a Newspaper Publisher
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Wall Street has started a bidding war for Fairfax Media, an Australian company best known for the dowdy business of publishing newspapers. To understand why, look no further than Deanna McMath.

title: Despite an Erratic Offense, Penguins Lead Predators in Stanley Cup Finals
description: PITTSBURGH  This is what was said in the Nashville Predators locker room late Monday night:

title: Questions for: Three Men Stood Up to Anti-Muslim Attack. Two Paid With Their Lives.
description: Article: Three Men Stood Up to Anti-Muslim Attack. Two Paid With Their Lives.

title: Word + Quiz: consolidation
Are Women-Only Screenings of Wonder Woman a Novel Idea  or a Problem?
description: What do you think it would be like to see a movie in a theater filled with only one type of people? Would it matter? Would you seek it out?

title: Dream Houses
description: Every week in the What You Get column, the Real Estate section features photos of houses on sale around the country or the world for a similar price. This weeks edition, above, shows three houses which could be yours if you had $2.3 million to spend.

title: Spirit and Strength in Nepal After an Earthquake and Destruction
description: A book by Omar Havana chronicles Nepals efforts to recover from a 2015 earthquake that devastated the country and killed thousands.

title: Deutsche Hires Tax Structuring Expert to Join Investment Bank
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Deutsche Bank has hired an expert in tax structuring as a managing director in its investment bank.

title: Show HUDs Budget Cuts the Door
description: Ben Carson, the secretary of Housing and Urban Development, set the stage for President Scrooges meanspirited budget when he suggested that the government had made things too cozy for poor people and said that poverty was merely a state of mind. Mr. Carson, ostensibly the custodian of housing for the nations poor, left the impression that the five million people who rely on the government for rental assistance could just pull themselves up by their bootstraps or suffer the consequences.

title: Trumps Giant Loophole
description: One of the major goals of tax reform is to reduce the opportunities for savvy taxpayers to game the system. But if President Trump and House Republicans have their way, we will have a new contender for the tax codes largest loophole: a new special cap on the tax rate for so-called pass-through business income.

title: When Politicians Pick Their Voters
description: Partisan gerrymandering  the dark art of drawing legislative district lines to specifically favor Republicans or Democrats  is as old as it is corrosive to a representative democracy. Self-interested politicians have no business making maps with the sole purpose of keeping themselves and their party in power.

title: Melissa Harris-Perry: How to Save the N.A.A.C.P. From Irrelevance
description: The N.A.A.C.P. announced two weeks ago that it will replace its current president as part of the latest effort to revitalize itself. That wont solve the problem. Instead, it shows that its bloated 64-member board of directors has little understanding of why the N.A.A.C.P. has become marginal.

title: Lyndon Johnsons Living Room War
description: On May 31, 1967, an ABC news anchor, Frank Reynolds, introduced a film report from Vietnam in an unusual way. He told viewers that they were seeing something unprecedented  a war that television was bringing into their living rooms.

title: Why There Is No Trump Slump on Wall Street
description: After a brief stumble, the stock market returned to its upward march last week and hit another high. This optimism has left many people confused, even infuriated. Why isnt Wall Street being affected by all the crazy news  including rumors of impeachment  coming out of Washington? Where is the Trump Slump?

title: The Politics of Clan: The Adventures of Jared Kushner
description: Jared Kushner deserves a bit of sympathy. All his life hes been serving his father or father-in-law. All his career hes been thrust into roles hes not ready for. His background has ill prepared him for national government. Now he is in a realm where his instincts seem to lead him astray and where theres a chance he will end up in disgrace and possibly under indictment.

title: Princeton  Yes, Princeton  Takes On the Class Divide
description: PRINCETON, N.J.  Few American institutions have a history of exclusion quite like Princeton Universitys.

title: Border Advice for Muslims Alarms Australian Official  but It Came From His Department
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The advice for Australian Muslims traveling overseas, in a booklet from a legal rights group, was straightforward: If anything on your phone could be construed as advocating violence, delete it.

title: Spirit and Strength in Nepal After an Earthquake and Destruction
description: A critique from a photo editor changed the course of Omar Havanas career and, more important, his life. The Spanish photographer  who had been living in Cambodia since 2008  had signed with Getty in 2013; an editor there said he needed a challenge. He needed to go someplace new: He needed to go to Nepal.

title: The Gucci Resort Renaissance
description: FLORENCE, Italy  At Gucci, people like to call Alessandro Michele the renaissance man. Since his ascent to the role of creative director just over two years ago, the soft-spoken Roman has been hailed as a design visionary, responsible for a dazzling turnaround in fortunes at the Italian luxury house.

title: What to Remember Before Watching House of Cards Season 5
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and movie recommendation site.

title: Taking the Plunge at the New Volcano Bay Water Park in Orlando
description: Tail over teakettle is not my best look.

title: Sandy, of All Things, Has Helped Open Access to Jersey Shore
description: MANTOLOKING, N.J.  Alex Staal never saw this town at its worst, submerged and ravaged by Hurricane Sandy, 90 percent of its homes damaged by the storm. He started visiting only two years ago, and what he knows is a vast sandy expanse for relaxing and refreshing dips in the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Four Senators to Watch in the Trump-Russia Investigation
description: WASHINGTON  They are a disparate foursome: the chambers leading Republican centrist, a minister who embraces public service as a calling, a seasoned dealmaker and a high-profile presidential contender.

title: Free Play or Flashcards? New Study Nods to More Rigorous Preschools
description: A group of students at Woodside Community School in Queens peered up at their teacher one morning this month, as she used an overhead projector to display a shape.

title: In California, Finding Fat City With the Man Who Wrote It
description: Most people will have you believe that a city starts at its outskirts. You get there by landing at an airport or exiting a freeway ramp, following directional signs in plain highway green and white. A citys boundaries are clearly drawn; cross a line, and youre there. Youll probably have to fight your way through a ring of big box architecture and layers of residential sprawl, but eventually youll find the heart of it: an old downtown full of ornate, once-magnificent buildings.

title: Hang With Showtime Dancers on the Subway
description: A dance group, Team Movie Life, performs outlawed acrobatics underground on a cramped New York City subway car. Watch in this 360 video.

title: Manuel Noriega, Russia, Pittsburgh Penguins: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Morning Agenda: A Newspaper Bidding War?
description: The business of publishing newspapers may not be the most obvious thing to set a private equity executives heart fluttering.

title: The Daily: The Investigators
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: A Beginners Guide to Biking to Work
description: If that bicyclist whizzing by seems a little happier than the average gridlock-bound car commuter, youre not imagining it: A recent study found that two-wheeled commuters were happier than their gas pedal-stomping, car-caged peers.

title: South Korea Leader Orders Investigation Into Unreported U.S. Launchers
description: SEOUL, South Korea  President Moon Jae-in of South Korea ordered an investigation on Tuesday into why the Defense Ministry had failed to inform him that four additional launchers for a contentious American missile-defense battery had been brought into his country.

title: After Divorce, Giving Our Kids Custody of the Home
description: The Fourth Grade Parents Night Out is in full swing. These adults-only gatherings, potluck style with plenty of cocktails, are a tradition at my sons school. A new couple introduces themselves and we make small talk over glasses of wine while I wait for the inevitable question.

title: Editorial Contest Winner | The Asian Misnomer: What the Affirmative Action Debate Misses
description: We are honoring each of the Top 10 winners of our Fourth Annual Student Editorial Contest by publishing an essay a day. You can find them all here.

title: How to Make the Most of a Sports-Centered Trip
description: Major sporting events, such as the Super Bowl, the Kentucky Derby and the World Series, offer enticing entertainment worth traveling for, said Craig Fravel, the president and chief executive of the Breeders Cup, the annual international horse racing championships. Theres so much energy around big sports games and races, and anyone can have a good time at them even if theyre not into the sport, he said.

title: I Wont Give Up: How First-Generation Students See College
description: Five students, the first in their families to go to college, interview other first-generation students about the college experience.

title: The Ringer, Bill Simmonss Site, Will Switch Its Host to Vox Media
description: The Ringer, a sports and culture website created by Bill Simmons, will soon be hosted on Vox Medias platform but maintain editorial independence under a partnership announced on Tuesday.

title: New York Today: Memorializing, After Memorial Day
description: Updated, 11:14 a.m.

title: Filipinos Who Fled ISIS-Inspired Fighting: There Was Gunfire Everywhere
description: MARAWI, Philippines  After she heard the first few shots ring out a week ago in Marawi, the center of Islamic faith in this predominantly Christian nation, Jemaliah Batingulo said she locked all the doors to keep her five children safe inside.

title: White House Communications Director Resigns as Shake-Up Begins
description: After his first foreign trip, President Trump begins shaking up his White House.

title: A High-Proof Tribute to Tiananmens Victims Finds a Way Back to China
description: BEIJING  Its a big journey for a little bottle, even one so potent in alcohol and symbolism.

title: Delays Cascade on L.I.R.R. After Power Problem in Tunnel
description: Two Long Island Rail Road trains carrying more than 1,000 passengers were stuck in the tunnel that leads under the East River for more than an hour on Tuesday morning as commuters headed into work after the Memorial Day weekend, causing cancellations and lengthy delays throughout the rail system.

title: Movers: Amazons Stock Price Hits $1,000
description: Were following major developments in the markets throughout the day. Check below for the latest updates.

title: A Trump-Putin Axis
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: California Today: Everywhere You Look, $1 Million Homes
description: Good morning.

title: As Trump Weighs Shake-Up, He Faces Recruiting Challenge
description: WASHINGTON  Back from overseas and confronting an unforgiving political environment, President Trump appears increasingly isolated inside the White House, according to advisers, venting frustration over the performance of his staff and openly talking about shaking it up. But as he considers casting off old aides, Mr. Trump is finding it challenging to recruit new ones.

title: Video Appears to Show Myanmar Soldiers Beating Captives
description: BANGKOK  Human rights advocates are calling on Myanmars government to investigate a video that appears to show soldiers kicking, beating and threatening to kill six captives.

title: Does Wrong Mind-Set Cause Poverty or Vice Versa?
description: Ben Carson has proposed, in effect, a human experiment.

title: Alanis Morissette Has Written a Musical Based on Jagged Little Pill
description: Alanis Morissettes got one hand in her pocket, and the other one is writing a stage musical.

title: In Chicagos Crisis of Violence, Some Signs of Hope
description: CHICAGO  After spiraling gun and gang violence brought Chicago more homicides than any other American city in 2016, officials took a more aggressive stance this year at the start of the period that is seen as the most violent season for the nations third-largest city.

title: Smoked Baby Back Ribs Ready for Summer Barbecues
description: At 75, the magazine publisher Stephen Sheanin has turned his hobby into a second career. Mr. Sheanin, a lifelong backyard griller, went into the smoked ribs business after his chef friends started selling his baby back ribs at their restaurants in Los Angeles. A smokehouse in California produces them, and he sells them online and in some stores. These ribs are smoky, meaty and succulent. They need but a quick reheat: BBQ Hero Ribs, $79.95 for two racks, bbqheroribs.com.

title: Food Memories of Travels to France
description: Gastronomy, and not just the Eiffel Tower, has always lured some travelers to France. Adrienne Zausner; her husband, Martin Zausner; and their friend Joan M. Harper were among those gastronomes, dining at Michelin three-star restaurants the way safarigoers checked the Big Five off their lists. Ms. Zausner went beyond exquisite dinners by befriending chefs, cooking with them and serving their recipes at home. Now, afflicted with primary progressive aphasia, a type of degenerative dementia, Ms. Zausner can no longer prepare lobster in Champagne sauce from LAuberge de LIll or salmon in sorrel sauce from Jean Troisgros. Ms. Harper has assembled a cookbook of recipes, stories about Ms. Zausners travels and useful kitchen advice. Ten percent of the proceeds goes to the Association for Frontotemporal Degeneration: Cooking With Adrienne: A Story of Friendship and Food by Joan M. Harper (Harper Publications, $19.99), cookingwithadrienne.com.

title: Dear Match Book: What Books Are Best Savored by Reading Aloud?
description: Dear Match Book,

title: Johnny Iuzzini and the Chocolate Factory
description: The pastry chef Johnny Iuzzini has started a bean-to-bar chocolate company, sourcing his raw cacao from farms in Jamaica, South America, Tanzania and Vietnam. Within modest, brown-paper wrappers are sleek two-ounce bars, six types in all. They vary from 75 percent cacao (Peru) down to a 50 percent dark milk chocolate bar from Tanzania. The Vietnamese bar (65 percent) conveys smoke and spice, and the Peruvian bar is buttery, earthy and kissed with a hint of passion fruit: Chocolate by Johnny Iuzzini, $10 per bar, goldbely.com/johnny-iuzzini.

title: A Sipping Rum From the Philippines
description: This aged rum, newly arrived from the Philippines, is made in small batches with a base of molasses produced from an old strain of sugar cane. The aroma is honeyed, slightly nutty and touched with vanilla. It is mellow on the palate with suggestions of orange peel and banana, and it has a sweet, liqueurlike finish, making it a choice for sipping neat or on the rocks, perhaps with a modest splash of tropical fruit juice: Don Papa Rum, donpaparum.com, $34.99 for 750 milliliters, Warehouse Wines & Spirits, 735 Broadway, 212-982-7770, warehousewinesandspirits.com.

title: Donald Trump at the NATO Summit
description: Making waves.

title: A Late  and Maybe Last  Collection of F. Scott Fitzgeralds Lost Stories
description: ID DIE FOR YOUAnd Other Lost StoriesBy F. Scott FitzgeraldEdited by Anne Margaret DanielIllustrated. 358 pp. Scribner. $28.

title: Sauces to Start a Moroccan Tagine Dinner
description: Mina Kallamni, a native of Morocco, has gradually expanded the North African products she carries since she founded Casablanca Foods seven years ago. A set of tagine sauces, each tailored to a different protein, is the latest addition. The sauces do not let the home cook completely off the hook, because the recipes call for additional ingredients, careful assembly and cooking. The tagine sauce for fish is thick, tomato-y and warmly spiced. With the fairly thin citric sauce for poultry, you are on you way to classic lemon chicken. The sauce for beef and lamb is complex and robust: Mina Tagine sauces, $6 for 12 ounces, casablancafoods.com.

title: Zains Ramadan Ad, With Images of Terrorism, Divides Twitter
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A suicide bomber straps on an explosive vest and boards a bus, but the passengers challenge him with exhortations to love and be tolerant.

title: VC Single Video
description: summary single video

title: The End of the Road for Some Apps
description: Q. Im getting a message on some of my iPad apps saying they wont work on the next version of iOS. What  and why  is this?

title: Black Taps Baroque Milkshakes Hit the Road
description: Black Tap, an expanding group of restaurants known for burgers and baroque milkshakes from the chef and co-owner Joe Isidori, has gone on the road. Two food trucks, called Shake by BT, will be on New York streets starting Friday. Signature shakes made with Nutella, coffee or strawberry, as well as towering Crazy Shakes, including the Bam Bam  which is topped with Fruity Pebbles, Rice Krispies Treats, whipped cream and a cherry  will be served in various locations. One truck will be around the South Street Seaport area; the other will be near Central Park, the West Side and Harlem. A third truck joins the year-round fleet later this summer: Shake by BT, locations on Instagram @blacktapnyc, blacktapnyc.com.

title: Hard-Line Moralist in Indonesia Faces Pornography Charges
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  In Indonesia, a public figure caught up in a scandal involving pornography or an extramarital affair would usually expect to be denounced by the Islamic Defenders Front, an influential hard-line Muslim organization.

title: He Tends Venices Jewish History. She Filmed Him.
description: VENICE  There are fewer than 500 Jews left in Venice, barely a handful compared with the 5,000 who filled the ghetto here at its height in the 17th century.

title: Daily Report: An Industrys Center of Influence Shifts
description: Sometimes a shift in power happens so subtly that you dont even notice it is occurring. Take the increasingly important field of artificial intelligence.

title: Destinations Await in the Summers Best Travel Books
description: In 1750, during the reign of Louis XV, a peripatetic Frenchman named Louis-Charles Fougeret de Monbron began his travel memoir, Le Cosmopolite, with the declaration: The universe is a kind of book; and if youve only seen your own country, youve only read the first page. A crowd of audacious and distinctive new books by spirited, inquisitive globe-trotters now expands our geographical lexicon, conveying what they saw, enjoyed and endured with humor and passion.

title: Bangladesh Cyclone Wreaks Havoc in Rohingya Refugee Camps
description: NEW DELHI  A cyclone tore through parts of Bangladesh on Tuesday, destroying the homes of thousands of Rohingya refugees who had fled the violence in Myanmar over the last several years.

title: Hot Tracks: Summers Big Books on Rock, Pop, Soul and Jazz
description: There are rock bands  the Rolling Stones and the Beach Boys come to mind  with deeper catalogs than the Beatles, whose recording career lasted less than a decade. But is there another rock band whose catalog merits a book like IN THEIR LIVES: Great Writers on Great Beatles Songs (Blue Rider, $23)?

title: Cleveland Police Officer Who Shot Tamir Rice Is Fired
description: The Cleveland police officer who fatally shot 12-year-old Tamir Rice in 2014 as he held a pellet gun, setting off national protests, was fired Tuesday, officials said.

title: New York Blood Center Reaches a Deal to Help Care for Research Chimps
description: Two years after the New York Blood Center set off a storm of protest from animal welfare advocates by withdrawing support for a colony of chimpanzees used for biomedical research, the organization has joined with the Humane Society of the United States to guarantee their future care, pledging $6 million.

title: Alexander Zverev and Johanna Konta Lose in French Open Upsets
description: PARIS  After a breakthrough title in Rome nine days ago, ninth-seeded Alexander Zverev lost in the first round of the French Open, falling, 6-4, 3-6, 6-4, 6-2, to Fernando Verdasco on Tuesday.

title: Tiger Woods Arrest Report
description: A Palm Beach County police report shows that Tiger Woods failed a sobriety test on Monday morning, but was not under the influence of alcohol.

title: Tiger Woods Was Asleep at the Wheel, Arrest Report Says
description: When an officer approached Tiger Woodss car before his arrest, he was asleep at the wheel, according to the police report released Tuesday.

title: Ariana Grande Announces Manchester Benefit Concert, With Special Guests
description: Ariana Grande is returning to perform in Manchester, England, almost two weeks after the attack at her show there killed 22 and wounded dozens more.

title: Gucci: Cruise 2018
description: The Gucci Cruise collection 2018.

title: On The Bachelorette for the Wrong Reasons? Whaboom.
description: Another season of The Bachelorette is underway, and unlike DeMario, The New York Times is still here for the right reasons. Our resident obsessives are following Rachel Lindsays love journey. Can we steal you for a sec?

title: Audible Creates $5 Million Fund for Emerging Playwrights
description: Audible, the digital audiobook giant, announced Tuesday that it would create a $5 million fund to commission new works from emerging playwrights  not for the stage, but for peoples headphones and speakers.

title: Packaging Food With Food to Reduce Waste
description: For the environmentally conscious eater, they are among the most inconvenient truths: Too much food goes to waste. Too much packaging comes with the food. And too much of the packaging is made to last for ages.

title: Pop Up Goes the Retail Scene as Store Vacancies Rise
description: As traditional retail stores close and vacancies mount, landlords across the country appear newly receptive to leases as short as a week, eschewing the typical 10-year time frame, even in locations that once shunned limited stays.

title: Man Faces Deportation After Failing to Pay Fare on Minneapolis Light Rail
description: A man who was arrested and charged with failing to pay his fare on a Minnesota light rail train is facing deportation after undergoing what the authorities described as inappropriate questioning about his immigration status by a transit police officer.

title: Liar, Liar: A Song Assailing Theresa May Tops the Charts in Britain
description: The song has a catchy chorus and a not-so-subtle message.

title: Phil & Annes Good Time Lounge Opens in Brooklyn
description: PHIL & ANNES GOOD TIME LOUNGE For several months, Phil Casaceli, who owns Daddy-O, a West Village bar, had his eye on the former Char No. 4 in Brooklyn. But it wasnt quite right, he felt, for another Daddy-O. Mutual friends suggested he reach out to the celebrity chef Anne Burrell, whom he already knew, and now theyre opening this restaurant. Ms. Burrell said that she was to ready make the move, though she would by no means be abandoning her television career. Inside, a stretch of bar leads to a dining room with tufted leather banquettes. Above the banquettes, there is shiny orange wallpaper patterned with vinyl records and microphones. Ms. Burrell said that all the dishes are the size of appetizers, and range from light (kale Caesar salad, cauliflower steak) to medium (bucatini allamatriciana, Korean short ribs with pickled vegetables) to heavy (a burger with two patties, an eight-ounce rib-eye). Theres also an intimate skylit rear dining room. (Opens Wednesday): 196 Smith Street (Baltic Street), Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, 929-337-7817, philandannesgoodtimelounge.com.

title: Walker Art Center Delays Opening of Sculpture Garden Following Controversy
description: The Walker Art Center has delayed the opening of the Minneapolis Sculpture Garden by a week as the museums executives plan the removal of a sculpture that has provoked a public outcry.

title: ISIS Blasts Kill Dozens at Family Gatherings, This Time in Iraq
description: The details are eerily familiar: a family outing, a suicide bomber, more than a dozen people  many of them children  killed in an attack later claimed by the Islamic State.

title: Keep Early Voting
description: To the Editor:

title: Supreme Court Roundup: Justices Rule on Excessive Force and in Immigration Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday ruled in favor of police officers who had been sued for using excessive force and an immigrant who had faced deportation for statutory rape. The justices also agreed to decide whether Ohio had been too aggressive in purging its voter rolls.

title: Is Hamas for Peace? Israel Doesnt Think So
description: To the Editor:

title: Confederate Monument, Shunned by One Kentucky City, Is Welcomed in Another
description: Even as some cities in the South are dismantling Confederate memorials that leaders say celebrate a shameful past, at least one is eager to host a statue that its leader calls an important historical marker.

title: Uber Fires Former Google Engineer at Heart of Self-Driving Dispute
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Uber said Tuesday that it had fired Anthony Levandowski, a star engineer brought in to lead the companys self-driving automobile efforts who was accused of stealing trade secrets when he left a job at Google.

title: Dutch Lawmakers Approve E.U. Trade Deal With Ukraine
description: BRUSSELS  In a decision laden with symbolic value, Dutch lawmakers agreed on Tuesday to closer ties and the creation of a free-trade area with Ukraine, completing a long and contentious negotiation that pushed Russia and the European Union to the edge of confrontation.

title: A Vocal Defender of Ethics Has Fans  and Foes
description: WASHINGTON  Walter M. Shaubs term as the governments top ethics watchdog does not expire until next January, but his corner office here, just a few blocks from the White House, looks unoccupied.

title: A $200 Million Bet on Brazilian Tech Start-Ups Amid Political Upheaval
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Latin American venture capital firm Kaszek Ventures has raised a $200 million fund, its largest, a major vote of confidence for internet start-ups in Brazil amid the political upheaval there.

title: Pinch Chinese
description: Dim sum that hops around several Chinese regions in SoHo.

title: Tim Ho Wan
description: Inexpensive dim sum from a popular Hong Kong-based restaurant chain.

title: New Dumplings to Hunt, by Way of Hong Kong
description: Visitors to Hong Kong who have an appreciation for dumplings, an eye toward low prices and faith that a single Michelin star reliably predicts quality will tend to eat at one of two places. Those who are more attracted to Cantonese dim sum classics will almost certainly end up at a location of the locally based Tim Ho Wan chain. The ones whose idea of a perfect dumpling is a xiao long bao with hot broth sealed inside will head to a branch of Din Tai Fung, which was founded in Taiwan. The very hungry ones will go to both.

title: In Venezuela, Goldman Sachs Found a Hot Deal and a Moral Mess
description: If a deal looks too good to be true, it may just be. Money managers at Goldman Sachs bought $2.8 billion face value of Petroleos de Venezuela bonds at a deep discount last week, attracting the ire of critics of President Nicols Maduro. Investments arent necessarily moral choices, but they can hit reputations.

title: Trump Interviewing 2 F.B.I. Candidates
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump will interview two more candidates for F.B.I. director on Tuesday as he resumes his search for a replacement for James B. Comey, who was dismissed earlier this month, the White House said.

title: Live Event: Nikole Hannah-Jones on the State of Education and Race
description: Welcome to Times Insider Events  live programming for Times Insiders and their guests. Times Insider offers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.

title: Supreme Court Rules Patent Laws Cant Be Used to Prevent Reselling
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday placed sharp limits on how much control patent holders have over how their products are used after they are sold.

title: Helping the Disadvantaged in New York Schools
description: To the Editor:

title: Are You in an Interracial Marriage? Share Your Story
description: The New York Times would like to hear from couples in mixed-race marriages about their experiences.

title: Indicting a President
description: To the Editor:

title: Send Us Your Back-to-School Photos
description: Youll be back in the classroom before you know it, and we want to know about the experience.

title: Review: Tainted Water, Bad Science and 8,000 Children Exposed to Lead
description: The resolution of the Flint, Mich., water crisis might seem like an unqualified victory for science at a time when its value is under attack. While politicians and bureaucrats denied that there was anything dangerous about the citys discolored, foul-smelling tap water, independent testing proved that people were being exposed to toxic levels of lead. Scientific sleuthing led to indictments and a program to replace some of Flints antiquated water-delivery system.

title: The South Faces a Summer With Fewer Peaches
description: ATLANTA  Peaches are such a part of Georgias identity that schools, streets and health care plans are named after them. Even the sticker you get when you vote is in the shape of the fruit. South Carolina, one state over, grows more peaches than Georgia. A giant statue of a peach is its most famous roadside attraction.

title: Kevin Spacey Is Holding Court. Really.
description: Kevin Spacey was alternately pacing like a panther and beaming like a proud parent at the back of a Juilliard classroom one recent Thursday morning. At the front of the lecture hall, students from the schools drama division, where he had once studied, were getting up one by one to perform short monologues while he watched and offered his feedback.

title: A Murder at College Park
description: Just a few days before his graduation, Richard Collins III  a black student and an Army lieutenant at Bowie State University, in Maryland  was visiting the nearby University of Maryland at College Park, when he was stabbed at a bus stop near campus by Sean Urbanski, a white student who was a senior there. Though investigators have not yet determined whether the killing was a hate crime, the perpetrator was a member of a now-deleted Facebook group called Alt-Reich: Nation, which published white supremacist content.

title: Jared Kushner Is New Focus of Russia Inquiry
description: To the Editor:

title: Turkey Acquits 2 Men in Berlin Honor Killing of Their Sister
description: ISTANBUL  Two Kurdish German men accused of helping to kill their sister in 2005 because of her Western lifestyle were acquitted Tuesday in a Turkish court, in the latest failed attempt to prosecute them in a case that became a benchmark for cultural tensions between Turkey and Germany.

title: Review: DanceAfrica Excels With Tradition. Why Go Beyond?
description: The Friday leading into Memorial Day weekend, for many New Yorkers, is a travel day. But a trek to the Hamptons has nothing on DanceAfrica. This annual showcase of music and dance at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, where tradition and abandon merge to the mesmerizing beat of a drum, radiates heat. Its another world.

title: Big City Book Club: Small Mercies by Eddie Joyce
description: A discussion of Eddie Joyces debut novel, Small Mercies, the story of a working-class Irish-Italian-American family dealing with their ghosts and demons on Staten Island, with Mr. Joyce and the actress Amy Ryan.

title: Fresh Finds at Romes Ancient Catacombs
description: ROME  Restorers on Tuesday put the finishing touches on a seven-year restoration of two underground burial rooms at the Catacombs of Domitilla, which revealed long-hidden frescoes commissioned some 1600 years ago by the citys bakers.

title: On a Portland Train, the Battlefield of American Values
description: America may seem leaderless, with nastiness and bullying ascendant, but the best of our nation materialized during a moral crisis on a commuter train in Portland, Ore.

title: Why Its O.K. to Lie About a Secret Channel. And When Its Not.
description: LONDON  The revelation that Jared Kushner, the presidents son-in-law, attempted to create a secret back channel to the Russian government in December has led to a feeding frenzy in the media. Yet there is nothing wrong per se with governments having a secret channel to an enemy. Most successful diplomatic negotiations are built on a secret initial phase. Think of the Iran nuclear talks and the Cuba negotiations under the last United States administration, both of which were begun through secret channels.

title: Jared Kushner, Russia, White House: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: 8 Summery Slip-On Shoes, for Men
description: In supple leathers and sturdy canvases, new iterations of the classic espadrille arent just for a trip to the beach.

title: Shetland Pony Grand National
description: A pony-riding quest for speed and glory.

title: The Stars of this Years Cannes Film Festival
description: A photographers diary of some of this seasons buzziest names, from Sofia Coppola to two very talked-about teenagers.

title: Street Stops by New York City Police Have Plummeted
description: Street stops by New York City police officers have plunged since 2011 and a new statistical analysis by a federal monitor concludes that the racial disparity in stops is narrowing.

title: By Staying Together, Arsenal and Arsne Wenger Stand Apart
description: LONDON  For a few minutes on Saturday evening, it seemed even Arsenal would succumb.

title: Alan Alda: The First Time I Was Stabbed in the Face
description: The dentist had the sharp end of the blade inches from my face.

title: Shetland Pony Grand National
description: The rules for racing in the Shetland Pony Grand National are simple: You have to be between 8 and 13 years old, and shorter than five feet. Thats it.

title: Can Meredith Monk Teach a Musical State of Mind?
description: What do you learn when you learn music? You learn notes, rhythms, words. If youre a pianist, you learn fingerings. If youre a trumpeter, you learn how to form your lips into the proper embouchure.

title: Her Longtime Dancer Died. Instead of Moving On, She Embraced Loss.
description: What happens when a choreographer loses her muse? During the past two and a half years, Ivy Baldwin has been wrestling with such a loss. In 2015, her close friend and longtime dancer Lawrence Cassella, an exuberant presence in her work since 2003, died at 38 after a three-month struggle with HLH, a rare immune system disease. For Ms. Baldwin, there was no moving past it.

title: Review: On Strivers Row, Where Snobbery Knows No Boundaries
description: There are a lot of things Dolly Van Striven doesnt like: kinky hair, people who eat pigs feet, her maids habit of borrowing her clothes. And shes horrified by her husbands insistence on putting a room for rent sign in the window of their Harlem townhouse. I mean, how does that look?

title: A Price Amazon Is Content to Keep High: $1,000 a Share
description: SEATTLE  On Monday, Amazon.coms share price briefly crossed the $1,000 mark for the first time in its 20-year history as a publicly traded company.

title: Urban Sprawl Up Kabuls Mountainsides, With Splashes of Color
description: What does a city do when housing needs grow so quickly that illegal settlements spread up steep hills and mountainsides? In Kabuls case, the municipality has decided to accept that reality and paint the homes in bright colors.

title: Macron Quickly Assumes a Presidential Attitude
description: PARIS  Frances boyish president already has faced down Donald J. Trump, lectured Vladimir V. Putin and confronted the formidable French labor unions  all in less than three weeks.

title: Amtrak Riders to Share in Penn Stations Summer of Hell
description: Amtrak and its customers will share some of the hardship with New York City commuters during several weeks of disruptive repair work at Pennsylvania Station this summer, according to a revised schedule Amtrak officials have drawn up.

title: The Answers Runs Down the Rabbit Hole of Love
description: THE ANSWERSBy Catherine Lacey291 pages. Farrar, Straus and Giroux. $26.

title: Analysis of N.Y.P.D. Stops
description: According to an analysis of New York Police Department stops from 2013 to 2015, street stops have plunged and the racial disparity in stops is narrowing. The report, undertaken as part of a federal court order, is the first to analyze trends in the departments data on stop-and-frisk tactics.

title: Despite Weak Inflation, Fed Is Likely to Raise Interest Rates in June
description: WASHINGTON  A speech by a Federal Reserve governor Tuesday underscored a basic shift in Fed policy: The central bank now needs to be convinced that quarterly rate increases are a bad idea.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: Missile Defense Test Succeeds, Pentagon Says, Amid Tensions With North Korea
description: WASHINGTON  A re-engineered American interceptor rocket collided with a mock intercontinental ballistic missile on Tuesday afternoon in the skies over the Pacific Ocean, the Pentagon said, in the first successful test of whether it could shoot down a warhead from North Korea racing toward the continental United States at speeds approaching true battle conditions.

title: The Beatles Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band at 50: Still Full of Joy and Whimsy
description: A half-century after its release, the Beatles Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band is a relic of a vanished era. Like a Faberg egg or a Persian miniature, it speaks of an irretrievable past, when time moved differently, craftsmanship involved bygone tools and art was experienced more rarely and with fewer distractions.

title: Meet the Musicians Who Modeled for Gucci
description: Theres something universal about Alessandro Micheles vision of fashion. Thats not to say its universally appealing  but rather that Micheles got his eyes on something bigger than just clothes. At Gucci, the designer crafts an entire creative cosmos, where each facet from designing new packaging featuring wild beasts and exotic flowers, to redecorating over 500 stores with plush tufted velvet panels and delicately turned bijouterie cases  flawlessly segues into a very particular vision of fashion.

title: Transgender Wisconsin Student May Use Boys Bathroom, Appeals Court Says
description: MADISON, Wis.  A transgender student who identifies as male should be able to use the boys bathroom at his Wisconsin high school, a federal appeals court ruled on Tuesday.

title: China Detains Activist Who Worked at Manufacturer of Ivanka Trump Shoes
description: BEIJING  A labor activist who had been working undercover at a Chinese factory that makes shoes for Ivanka Trump and other brands has been detained by the police, as concerns rise over a crackdown on the countrys advocacy groups.

title: Michael Dubke, White House, Chicago: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: What 8 Skater Types Wore to Their Lower East Side Coffee House
description: The fringes of Chinatown in Manhattan continue to be fertile ground for new insider-y hangouts. Joining of-the-moment haunts like Dimes and Kikis is Oliver Coffee, a one-table cafe at the triangle tip of Oliver Street and St. James Place with a newsstand that sells indie fashion and art magazines as well as global snacks from the company Import. While not quite the skateboard clubhouse that Supreme was in the 1990s, the coffeehouse does see a steady stream of skater types seeking midday pick-me-ups.  On a recent Monday, regulars shared their fashion outlook for spring.

title: How to Build the Best Preschools
description: As an education reporter and 30-something Brooklynite, I often field questions from friends about the citys free preschool program. What my college-educated peers seem to worry about most is that their 4-year-olds will be stifled by overly academic classrooms; after all, parents in my demographic tend to spend time at home reading and reviewing numbers and letters. At school, they want their children to play dress-up, make art and learn to cooperate with others.

title: Even as Wind Power Rises, It Falls Under a Political Cloud
description: Wind farms, with their rapid geographic spread and technological advances, are reshaping the electric system, defying skepticism that they are steady or reliable enough to displace conventional power plants.

title: Appeals Court Vacates Former State Senators Conviction and Fine
description: Nearly two years ago, Thomas W. Libous, a powerful New York state senator, was convicted of lying to F.B.I. agents in a corruption investigation. Mr. Libous, then suffering from prostate cancer, was sentenced to two years of probation, six months of home confinement and a $50,000 fine.

title: Are Todays Deep Throats Doing the Right Thing?
description: President Trump is upset over leaks about the F.B.I.s Russia investigation. And Im sure hes even more outraged now that his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, is a person of interest in the investigation.

title: Old Friends Cheer Pekka Rinne as Predators Make a Stanley Cup Run
description: For more than a decade, roughly a dozen members of the Karpat team that won back-to-back Finnish hockey league titles in 2004 and 2005 have reconvened every June for a cabin getaway. The retreats give the former teammates a weekend to remember old times and relive on-ice conquests.

title: Corrections: May 31, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Trumps Personal Lawyer Refuses to Cooperate With Congressional Inquiries
description: WASHINGTON  Michael D. Cohen, President Trumps personal lawyer, said on Tuesday that he was refusing to cooperate with House and Senate intelligence committee investigations into Russian election meddling. The move may prompt lawmakers to issue subpoenas, compelling him to provide documents, testimony or other records.

title: Scott Pelley Said to Be Leaving Post as CBS Evening News Anchor
description: Scott Pelley is leaving his anchor role with CBS Evening News, a position he has filled since 2011, two people familiar with the move said Tuesday.

title: Settlements With New Jersey Suburb Clear Way for Proposed Mosque
description: A proposed mosque that had been blocked by officials in a New Jersey suburb will now be allowed to move forward after settlements were reached on Tuesday in lawsuits that accused the township of discriminating against Muslims.

title: The Billionaire Gadfly in Exile Who Stared Down Beijing
description: The biggest political story in China this year isnt in Beijing. It isnt even in China. Its centered at a $68 million apartment overlooking Central Park in Manhattan.

title: Goldman Buys $2.8 Billion Worth of Venezuelan Bonds, and an Uproar Begins
description: Venezuelan bonds would seem to be an unlikely target for global investors.

title: Getting Used to New Surroundings
description: Dear Diary:

title: Quotation of the Day: Drop in Violence Gives a City Hope
description: Lets not throw a parade yet. To say were better than last year is good, but last year was disastrous, so its not a great benchmark. This is one weekend.

title: Cholera, Famine and Girls Sold Into Marriage for Food: Yemens Dire Picture
description: Cholera deaths in war-torn Yemen have surged into the hundreds, more than a quarter of Yemenis face famine, and parents are selling girls into marriage to buy food, the United Nations said on Tuesday.

title: Paul Sewald Becomes the Unlikely Anchor in the Mets Bullpen
description: Ask any hitter about changes in the modern game, and almost always, you will hear some version of this: Every reliever throws 99 miles an hour. The prevalence of hard throwers has far-reaching impact on health, roster construction, offense and more, but it is usually a bit overstated. Just look at Paul Sewald.

title: NBC Rolls Back Must See TV Revival by Leaving This Is Us on Tuesdays
description: In a surprising reversal, NBC announced on Tuesday that it was removing the centerpiece of its much-anticipated Must See TV revival on Thursday night.

title: Trump Advisers Wage Tug of War Before Decision on Climate Deal
description: WASHINGTON  A divided White House staff, anxious corporate executives, lawmakers and foreign leaders are fiercely competing for President Trumps ear this week as he nears a decision on whether to pull the United States out of the Paris climate accord, the landmark agreement that commits nearly every country to combat global warming.

title: Blind Spots in Trumps Trade Tirade Against Germany
description: WASHINGTON  The last time relations between the United States and Europe were this bad  in the spring of 2003, during the buildup to the invasion of Iraq  the administration of George W. Bush decided to punish France, ignore Germany and forgive Russia, in a phrase attributed to the national security adviser at the time, Condoleezza Rice.

title: Alistair Horne, War Historian and Onetime British Spy, Dies at 91
description: Alistair Horne, a British historian whose prizewinning works included a gripping account of the battle of Verdun and a keen analysis of the French-Algerian war that President George W. Bush read closely for insights into the American war in Iraq, died on Thursday at his home in Turville, Buckinghamshire, England. He was 91.

title: An N.B.A. Throwback: Ads on Jerseys
description: Starting next season, N.B.A. teams willbegin wearing small patchesadvertising a sponsor. Right there on the upper left of LeBron Jamess jersey will be the winged-foot logo of the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company.

title: Killed Navy Parachutist Lived Life to the Fullest
description: At five minutes out and 12,000 feet in the air, Remington J. Peters and the other members of his Navy parachute team began their final preparations to jump from their C-130 transport plane. At two minutes, the group members, firing one another up, huddled together and said a prayer. At one minute, they duckwalked their way to the now-open back hatch, a smile glued to Petty Officer Peterss face.

title: On Your Feet! to Close in August and Embark on National Tour
description: On Your Feet!, the Broadway musical based on the music and life of Emilio and Gloria Estefan, and featuring hits like Rhythm Is Gonna Get You, will close in August, the show announced on Tuesday. But starting in the fall, audience members will be able to shake their bodies and do the conga in other parts of the country.

title: Australia Plans to Revoke Child Sex Offenders Passports to Combat Sex Tourism
description: The Australian government plans to revoke the passports of registered child sex offenders in a significant effort to help combat the booming child sex trade in Asia, officials announced this week.

title: Warning for Easily Provoked Types
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Sometimes you just need to break up the week with a return to nature, and today Jacob Stulberg takes us on a field trip. Put on your waders, because were going fishing.

title: After Tiger Woods Stumbles, Solid Ground Beckons
description: DUBLIN, Ohio  In an update last week on his website, Tiger Woods painted a picture that did not at all resemble a mug shot that would surface five days later. One month after fusion surgery on his back, Woods wrote, I havent felt this good in years. He added, Im walking and doing my exercises and taking my kids to and from school.

title: De Blasio Honors Jimmy Breslin in Name, if Not in Spirit
description: Keith Joyner, who works in the sign shop of the citys Department of Transportation in Manhattan, stood on a step ladder and slid a white sheath over a new street sign honoring Jimmy Breslin, the irreverent newspaper columnist who worked for a number of New York newspapers  among them The Daily News.

title: Oregon Man Accused of Deadly Anti-Muslim Tirade Continues Rant in Court
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  An Oregon man charged with murdering two people who had tried to intercede during the mans anti-Muslim tirade spoke out at an arraignment on Tuesday, calling for death to the enemies of America while apparently defending his actions as a form of patriotism.

title: The Americans Season 5 Finale Recap: Deus ex Kimmy
description: Washington. Moscow. Washington. Moscow.

title: A Friendly Home Run Competition, With the Yankees as the Beneficiaries
description: BALTIMORE  As Brett Gardner raced around the bases after hitting his second home run of the night, and his 11th of the season, his thousand-mile stare was fixed on the visitors dugout near third base. His target: Matt Holliday.

title: Raymond J. Pfeifer, 9/11 Firefighter Who Sought Care for Survivors, Dies at 59
description: Raymond J. Pfeifer, who spent eight months digging through the toxic debris of the collapsed World Trade Center for the remains of fellow firefighters and other victims and years lobbying, successfully, for health benefits for those who survived, died on Sunday in a hospice in Port Washington, N.Y. He was 59.

title: Life on Mars: At Home in the Habitat
description: Six people are living in isolation for eight months on a volcano in Hawaii as part of a NASA-funded study to simulate human exploration of Mars. In the third episode of this 360-video series, take a tour of the home they have made for themselves after four months

title: Life on Mars
description: On the side of Mauna Loa volcano in Hawaii, six individuals are living in Mars-like conditions as part of a NASA-funded behavioral research study. We chronicle their mission in 360 video.

title: Mets Somehow Survive Another Night of Miscues
description: The Mets 5-4 win over the Milwaukee Brewers in 12 innings at Citi Field on Tuesday night will go down in the books as a triumph of perseverance and an example of a team rising above its mistakes.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Love & Mercy and The Carmichael Show
description: Love & Mercy mines the dark side of the summery sounds of the Beach Boys and the groups musical genius, Brian Wilson. And The Carmichael Show begins a third season with a debate about sexual consent.

title: Deadly Bombing in Kabul Is One of the Afghan Wars Worst Strikes
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A truck bomb devastated a central area of Kabul near the presidential palace and foreign embassies on Wednesday, one of the deadliest strikes in the long Afghan war and a reminder of how the capital itself has become a lethal battlefield.

title: Five Places to Go in Downtown Albuquerque
description: Downtown Albuquerqueused to be a derelict stretch with dodgy streets,closedcement warehouses and graffiti-scuffed railroad cars from the nearby train station. But revitalization efforts are luring field-to-fork chefs, hops-obsessed brewers, eco-chic designers, craft brewers, single-estate coffee roasters and a crop of contemporary artists who are pushing the citys artistic sensibility into the limelight. As the 12-block corridor surrounding Central Avenue takes on a more polished sheen, the atmosphere has remained original and proudly New Mexican, attracting legions of tourists andresidentsalike.

title: Parenting Skills
description: Should parents say no more often when their children ask for new things? How often did your parents say no? What effects do you think denying children material things might have on them, both short and long term?

title: Whats a Covfefe? Trump Tweet Unites a Bewildered Nation
description: WASHINGTON  And on the 132nd day, just after midnight, President Trump had at last delivered the nation to something approaching unity  in bewilderment, if nothing else.

title: Right and Left: Partisan Writing You Shouldnt Miss
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: Irving Penn Reinterpreted, by Irving Penn
description: Though Irving Penn made photographs with his printing process in mind, the most striking aspect of his oeuvre lies in his broad reinterpretation of commercial magazine work from decades earlier.

title: Gov. Walker Would Drug Test the Poor
description: As he prepares to run for a third term, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, ever the devotee of low-road, right-wing politicking, is hoping the Trump administration will allow his state to be the first in the nation to mandate the drug screening of childless individuals who apply for Medicaid help.

title: A Meaningful Move on Voting Rights in Alabama
description: Last week, more than 100 years late, Alabama took an important step toward excising a toxic slice of white supremacy from its Constitution and restoring voting rights to perhaps thousands of people, disproportionately black, with criminal records.

title: How We Really Die
description: Over recent years, without much media fanfare, something fascinating occurred, a reminder that for all the ways in which we seem to be sliding backward, were lurching forward, too.

title: The G.O.P. Health Care Bill Is Fixable
description: Throughout the 2016 campaign  and for months afterward  Donald Trump promised that his replacement for Obamacare would provide insurance for everybody. Last weeks Congressional Budget Office report makes clear that the House Republican health care bill falls well short of that goal.

title: Should the Presidents Words Matter in Court?
description: The most striking aspect of last Thursdays opinion by the United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit, which rejected the Trump administrations latest effort to revive its travel ban for individuals from six predominantly Muslim countries, was its reliance on Donald Trumps own words as candidate, president-elect and president. The court leaned particularly heavily on his now-famous campaign statement that he was calling for a total and complete shutdown of Muslims entering the United States.

title: Donald Trumps Insult to History
description: The tectonic plates of Europe are shifting, and President Trump is at the heart of this upheaval. Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany bluntly made that point on Sunday when she said, The times in which we could rely fully on others  they are somewhat over, and the result is that we Europeans must really take our fate into our own hands.

title: The Manchurian President?
description: In the film The Manchurian Candidate  the true and only John Frankenheimer version, not the misbegotten remake  an international operation conspires to place a Communist agent in the White House. The mechanism is complicated, involving brainwashing, fake heroism and an assassination scheme, but the core conceit has a distinctive genius: The agent of influence the Communists intend to raise to the presidency is basically a Joseph McCarthy figure  a right-wing politician named Johnny Iselin who rants about Red infiltrators even as hes actually being manipulated himself, by a Machiavellian wife who takes her orders from Moscow or Beijing.

title: Trying to Embrace a Cure
description: Lately, the online patient support group I am part of, the XLH Network  short for X-linked hypophosphatemia, the genetic illness I and two of my children share  has been blowing up with news of a soon-to-be-released treatment that could very well amount to a cure.

title: Trumps United American Emirate
description: SEOUL, South Korea  President Trumps trip to Europe was truly historic.

title: A Haven From Traumas Cruel Grip
description: San Francisco  The sun was preternaturally bright the day Clare Senchynas 26 year-old son Camilo, her only child, was shot and killed in a random act of violence in San Francisco.

title: China Woos South Koreas New Leader, but the U.S. Left Behind a Spoiler
description: BEIJING  When he assumed power in 2013, President Xi Jinping of China tried to court one of Americas main Asian allies, South Korea. It worked for a while. Then the relationship soured.

title: John Grishams Dos and Donts for Writing Popular Fiction
description: Since advice is usually ignored and rules are routinely broken, I refer to these little pearls as merely suggestions.

title: Summer Thrillers: Daring Escapes and Other Acts of Derring-Do
description: The 2000s were thrilling here in America, in the most strictly neutral sense of the word  sensation after sensation, the fall of the towers, two wars, financial collapse, natural disaster, fear. Adults responded, very sanely one could argue, by devoting the period to reading about teenage vampires. (Or waiting on Platform 9 for the next train to Hogwarts.) Then things slowly stabilized, and perhaps our mood shifted too. The immense success of Gone Girl in 2012 seemed to consolidate that sense: The most popular novels could be about grown-ups again. Less frightened that our houses might be taken, we began to wonder instead who might hurt us while we were inside them.

title: Plot Twist! John Grishams New Thriller Is Positively Lawyerless
description: John Grishams publisher, Doubleday, got a nice surprise last January. Grisham, whose yearly delivery of a legal thriller is as reliable as the sunrise, had written a little something extra on the sly: a lawyerless caper. It had a picturesque Florida setting, a fun-filled story about book lovers of many stripes (from those who write them to those who steal them) and a heroine who spent time in a bikini and sandals. Mr. Courtroom had written a beach book. His first.

title: What Do You Think You Would Learn From Traveling to All 50 States?
description: In your life, how much have you traveled? Have you traveled outside your state, or your country? Why and when did you go?

title: New Graphic Novels Detail Personal Journeys and Twists of Fate
description: Most cartoonists spend decades developing their craft in public before theyre prepared to take on the challenge of a major graphic novel. Not Emil Ferris, who has slammed her oversized, 386-page magnum opus, MY FAVORITE THING IS MONSTERS (Fantagraphics, paper, $39.99), down onto the table of comics by way of introduction. Drawn entirely on blue-lined notebook paper, its a startling demonstration of Ferriss range, power and ambition. She has a portraitists skill with tiny subtleties of expression and lighting and a New Objectivists eye for the raw grotesquerie of bodies and their surroundings, and her illustrative technique extends from impossibly delicate hairbreadth shading to passionate marker-mashing scribbles.

title: Where the Teachers Pet Sleeps in a Dog Bed
description: Room 125A at Public School 75 in Manhattan has all the usual trappings of an elementary school classroom. There are low tables and little chairs. There is student work on the wall, covered in crooked, wobbly letters and the occasional rainbow. There is a computer for the teacher and a colorful carpet.

title: Alan Gilbert Made the New York Philharmonic a Bigger Box
description: In the spring of 2010, near the end of Alan Gilberts first season as music director of the New York Philharmonic, the players in the orchestra pelted him with crumpled pieces of paper in the middle of a performance. This wasnt a mass jeer. In fact, Mr. Gilbert explained at a public interview at Lincoln Center recently, nothing could have pleased him more.

title: How the Golden State Warriors Became the N.B.A.s Villains
description: After securing his seventh consecutive appearance in the N.B.A. finals, LeBron James, considered by some to be approaching Michael Jordans level of greatness, spent his postgame interview last Thursday talking about getting ready for the juggernaut out West. Las Vegas has made his defending champion Cleveland Cavaliers heavy underdogs to the Golden State Warriors, and social media has exploded with discussions about whether the Cavaliers can avoid a sweep.

Police videos appeared to show the man turning away before officers fired. Their release had been preceded by a long history of police violence and followed by six days of protests. But defense lawyers thought they still had a chance  if they could get the right jury.

title: The Enduring Appeal of Seeing Trump as Chess Master in Chief
description: In the first months of his campaign, back when the press and his political opponents still regarded him as a curiosity or a nuisance, Donald Trump was accumulating online fans in surprising places. On the anarchic image board 4chan, he was celebrated as a fellow troll, while on Reddit, a pro-Trump community gained tens of thousands of members, shifting the entire political ecosystem on the platform. So when Trump actually began dominating the Republican primary contest, these two communities were among the first to feel a need to explain why he hadnt been stopped  and couldnt be.

title: Review: Wonder Woman Is a Blockbuster That Lets Itself Have Fun
description: Wonder Woman begins with ominous, lugubrious music (composed by Rupert Gregson-Williams), a voice-over invocation of darkness and an aerial view of the Louvre that seems full of sinister portent. The viewer may be forgiven a shudder of dread. Are we really going to pick up where Batman v Superman left off? Must we endure another dose of the grandiose self-pity and authoritarian belligerence that have characterized the DC-Warner Bros. synergy in the Dark Knight era? (This is the cue for unhinged fans to come @ me on Twitter and accuse me of being a shill for Marvel and Disney. The rest of you are invited to keep reading.)
