description: BERLIN  Exit President Trump, offending almost everyone. Enter China, eager to talk.

title: French Open: CiCi Bellis, Seizing the Moment, Advances to the Third Round
description: PARIS  Unfamiliar to French fans, CiCi Bellis received a well-meaning, if mangled, welcome during the biggest overseas victory of her young career.

title: Spared by Sandy, but Still Agonizing Over What Comes Next
description: Though they live just a half-mile from the Paerdegat Basin in Brooklyn, George and Laura Fishman were spared the kind of damage that upended their neighbors lives during Hurricane Sandy. (There were not, for instance, fish in their basement.)

title: Foreign Correspondents as They Live and Breathe
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. In this article that we originally published in March, Didi Kirsten Tatlow, a Beijing-based Times correspondent, compares notes and guilt trips with Times reporters around the world who have moved with their families to smog-laden news hubs.

description: In early November, Mr. Roof sent a handwritten letter to prosecutors.

description: At a competency hearing, Dylann Roof sought to represent himself at trial.

description: Ruling on the question of self-representation.

title: Psychological Evaluation
description: Report by Donna Maddox

title: Court Files Raise Question: Was Dylann Roof Competent to Defend Himself?
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  In early January, after a series of closed-court hearings, a federal judge in Charleston allowed Dylann S. Roof to represent himself as prosecutors sought his execution for a murderous 2015 rampage at a historic African-American church. Determined to block exposure of his mental health history, the 22-year-old white supremacist sidelined his expert defense team and presented no mitigating evidence. A jury took less than three hours to dispatch him to death row.

title: Et Al Replaces Experimental Cocktail Club on the Lower East Side
description: A costume party without a holiday fulcrum is tricky. But last Wednesday, there was a 1970s-themed shindig at a new lounge on Chrystie Street called Et Al. Guests in floral scarves and tie-dyes grooved to Ring My Bell, as light ricocheted off the disco ball, alongside more contemporary patrons in chokers and high-waisted stonewashed denim.

title: Do I Dare to Eat a Frozen Peach? Kim Severson on Georgias Fruit Crisis
description: I thought I knew peaches when I first moved to Georgia from New York to report on Southern news for The Timess National desk six years ago.

title: New York City Police Sergeant Charged With Murder in Bronx Womans Death
description: A New York City police sergeant who fatally shot a mentally ill woman in her Bronx apartment in October was charged on Wednesday with murder in the womans death.

title: Q. & A.: The Paris Climate Accord
description: President Trump is said to be considering withdrawing the United States from the Paris climate agreement, a landmark accord reached in 2015 between 195 countries that seeks to avoid some of the worst effects of climate change by curbing global greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Move Over, Royal Tenenbaums: Meet the Mighty Franks
description: Though steeped in glory and glamour, the Hollywood memoir is also typically sprinkled with enough excess, depravity and human wreckage to afford the gorged reader a righteous aftertaste. Call it the gluten-free cupcake of literary genres.

title: On The US-Germany Imbalance
description: [Yesterday the wifi at my then location was having an argument with the Times VPN, so I had to post to CUNY site. Here it is with proper hyperlinks]

title: Is Wisconsin Really That Hard to Spell?
description: Beautiful and pneumonia hardly go together, but they ranked as the top two words that Americans most sought how to spell in the first four months of this year, according to an analysis by Google Trends.

title: Exxon Mobil Shareholders Demand Accounting of Climate Change Policy Risks
description: A majority of Exxon Mobils shareholders, in a reversal, have voted in favor of more open and detailed analyses of the risks posed to its business by policies aimed at stemming climate change.

title: Lebanon Bans Wonder Woman Because Its Star Is From Israel
description: Wonder Woman may be the summers most anticipated film nationally, if not globally, but one country it wont be seen in is Lebanon, where on Wednesday it was banned because its lead actress, Gal Gadot, is from Israel.

title: Pelleys Shift at CBS News Breaks With Smooth Routine
description: It is a point of pride for CBS, which has long been viewed as the stable, no-drama network: When it makes a transition, it is done smoothly.

title: Donald Trumps Twitter Comedy
description: The president offered Americans a bit of levity on Wednesday morning amid his broadsides about the Russia investigation and complaints about fake news, closing out a busy day of tweeting with the message, Despite the constant negative press covfefe.

title: Kennedy Centers New Jazz Season Includes Q-Tip and Local Artists
description: The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington on Tuesday unveiled its 2017-18 jazz season, and announced that it has renewed its contract with the pianist Jason Moran as its artistic director for jazz.

title: Passengers Bomb Threat Forces Planes Return to Australia
description: A Malaysia Airlines plane returned to Australia on Wednesday after a disruptive passenger, who claimed to have a bomb, attempted to enter the cockpit, the authorities said.

description: To the Editor:

title: Bill Woods, New York Urban Planner and Hero of the Harbor, Dies at 78
description: Bill Woods, an Alabama-born urban planner who inspired insular New Yorkers to finally reclaim their forsaken waterfront, died on May 22 in Kingston, N.Y. He was 78.

title: Why Is Subway Service in New York Getting Worse?
description: It is a question on the minds of many frustrated New Yorkers: Why has subway service gotten so bad, and what is being done to fix it?

description: To the Editor:

title: Money Out of Your Pocket: New Yorkers Tell of Subway Delay Woes
description: It was 8:30 a.m. on a Tuesday during the height of the morning rush on the nations busiest subway. Suddenly, power went out at one station in Brooklyn, but that lone failure triggered a meltdown that crippled service across New York City, stranding countless commuters whose plans for the day were derailed.

title: United Faces $435,000 Fine, Accused of Flying Plane 23 Times Without Inspecting Repair, F.A.A. Says
description: United Airlines is facing a fine of $435,000 from the Federal Aviation Administration, which said Tuesday that the airline flew a Boeing 787 passenger airplane that was potentially unsafe nearly two dozen times on domestic and international flights in 2014.

title: CNN Fires Kathy Griffin From New Years Eve Broadcast Over Trump Photo
description: For a little while, it looked as if Kathy Griffin was getting exactly what she wanted.

title: Kelly Rohrbach, as C.J., Brings a New Swing to Baywatch
description: LOS ANGELES  When she was studying at the London Academy of Music & Dramatic Art, the actress Kelly Rohrbach got to play roles like Portia in The Merchant of Venice and Nora in A Dolls House. She is making her film debut in a different kind of classic vehicle. That would be the big-screen version of the long-running syndicated television show Baywatch, opposite Zac Efron and Dwayne Johnson, a.k.a. the Rock.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Wonder Woman
description: Patty Jenkins narrates a sequence featuring Gal Gadot and Chris Pine.

title: Psychiatric Evaluation
description: Psychiatric Evaluation

title: Balancing Politics and Pragmatism in Irish Bank I.P.O.
description: Allied Irish Banks initial public offering is as large as it is political.

title: Patty Jenkins Narrates a Scene From Wonder Woman
description: Just another day of deflecting bullets and beating up bad guys on the streets of London in this scene from Wonder Woman. In a recent interview, the director Patty Jenkins discussed how she would place the character in the middle of World War I and how this scene took inspiration from a much earlier superhero movie. Here are excerpts from the conversation.

title: LeBron James Responds to Racial Vandalism: Being Black in America Is Tough
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  As he has grown older, and as he has established himself as one of the great athletes in American history, LeBron James has become increasingly willing to address social and political issues. He has, for instance, denounced police killings of African-American men, and he took sides in the 2016 presidential campaign, endorsing Hillary Clinton and making a public appearance on her behalf.

title: Bleecker Streets Swerve From Luxe Shops to Vacant Stores
description: Someday urban planners and retail executives may want to debrief Robert Sietsema. As someone who has lived at the corner of Bleecker and Perry Streets for 27 years, he has witnessed the rise and fall of a luxury shopping district that grew out of workaday surroundings in the 1990s and has left empty storefronts in its wake.

title: What to Wear to a Summer Wedding
description: Love may be in the air, but so, too, is anxiety over what to wear to those joyous wedding celebrations. As it turns out, finding the perfect summer wedding ensemble is a bit like the search for the perfect mate: There are a lot of options on the market, but it can be frustratingly difficult to find the one that suits your particular wants and needs. If youre likely to spend the night on the dance floor, comfortable shoes are a priority; if youre headed to an outdoor ceremony, a cool, breathable outfit is a must. Theres the dress code, the weather  not to mention the pack of people one hopes to make envious (without upstaging the bride, of course). Here, some ideas to make the search a little easier. As for finding the perfect date, youre on your own.

title: Psychological Evaluation
description: Report by Rachel Loftin

title: Iran Drops Plan to Send Human Into Space, Citing Cost
description: When Irans scientists sent a monkey into space in 2013, the countrys president volunteered to be the first Iranian to blast aloft in a domestically built rocket, possibly as early as 2018.

title: Paris Agreement, Kabul, North Korea: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Boldly Saddling Up
description: William Shatner: Star Trek hero. Comedic actor. Song interpreter. Horseman?

title: Modern Love Podcast: Chris Messina Reads When Love Isnt as Simple as Standing by Your Man
description: On this weeks podcast, the actor Chris Messina reads When Love Isnt as Simple as Standing by Your Man, a story that shows how even the most enduring marriages are precarious.

title: Pakistani-American From California Blazes a Gay Leather and Fetish Trail
description: CHICAGO  It was the Friday before Memorial Day and Ali Mushtaq was in his room at the Congress Plaza Hotel, dressed like a votary in the church of Tom of Finland: skin-seizing bluejeans, lace-up cuffs called gauntlets, disciplinarian jackboots and a belted leather strap that crisscrossed the defined chest of his 5-foot-6-inch frame.

title: Dua Lipa Was Raised on Pop Bangers. Now She Writes Them.
description: Im on cloud nine! Dua Lipa said. Im having the best time!

title: A Week of Pop-Ups, Celebrations and Other Shopping Events
description: Dreaming of a summer getaway? On Thursday, Bergdorf Goodman will open a pop-up for Chufy, the globe-trotting art director Sofia Sanchez de Betaks ready-to-wear and accessories collection, which includes embroidered gaucho pants ($1,960) and espadrilles ($855). Take #inspo from her highly Instagrammable adventures, helpfully collected in a new Assouline book, Travels With Chufy ($50). At Bergdorf Goodman, third floor.

title: So Your Phone Ran Out of Juice. Here Are the Top Chargers for It.
description: We cant live without our cellphones and they cant live without battery power. So how best to keep them charged? Nick Guy, senior staff writer for The Wirecutter, The New York Timess site that evaluates products, plugged the devices into chargers and came up with some answers.

title: Halseys Second Album: Something New, but a Lot Borrowed
description: Halsey arrived as part of a slew of female pop rebels who emerged in the wake of Lordes early-2010s recalibration of the genres operating hierarchies. As had been clear many times before  but was forgotten in the early part of the 2000s  the reluctant girl in the corner or the punk rebel was just as capable of making world-shaping pop as the popular extrovert. Halsey, with her dyed pixie haircut and wild-child interviews, appeared to fit the bill.

title: Frances Sliwa, the Guardian Angels One-Woman Kitchen Cabinet, Dies at 93
description: Frances Sliwa, who helped her blustery son, Curtis, run the Guardian Angels neighborhood patrol group from a kitchen table in the Canarsie neighborhood of Brooklyn, died on May 23 in that borough. She was 93.

title: How the Fleet Foxes Frontman Got Out to Get Back In
description: SEATTLE  Between January and March of 2013, the Fleet Foxes frontman, Robin Pecknold, lived alone in a small house in Port Townsend, Wash., a wind-swept town on the northeast tip of the Olympic Peninsula  a two-hour ride from Seattle by car and ferry  that empties during the dark, chilly winters. He spent his days taking a 12-week woodworking course that emphasized labor-intensive traditional craftsmanship using hand tools. Most nights, he went for long runs through the towns hills, streets and marinas.

title: An Artist and Her Beautiful Boy
description: On a long subway ride three years ago, BJ Lillis decided to share something with his friend and co-worker, Lissa Rivera. Mr. Lillis, who describes himself as genderqueer, told her that he had spent most of his college years dressing, full-time, in womens clothing.

title: Making Music with Words
description: The singer Lisa Loeb chats with Deb Amlen.

title: Review: Shaws Heartbreak House Gets an Unexpected Visitor
description: HARTFORD  Even in ordinary productions of George Bernard Shaws Heartbreak House, the arrival of Boss Mangan in the middle of the first act changes the temperature of the play completely. Up to that point, Shaw has been busy exposing us to two breeds of ineffectual English elites, circa 1914: the cultured but idle bohemian class, represented by Hesione Hushabye (partly based on Virginia Woolf), and the horsy, empty-headed aristocracy represented by her sister, Lady Utterword. The bohemians have souls, the aristocrats power, and neither knows what to do with them.

title: Nine Plays, One Truth: Mfoniso Udofia on Her Immigrant Experience, and Ours
description: After moving to New York City nearly a decade ago, Mfoniso Udofia began to ask herself some hard questions: Who am I? and What does it mean to be both African and American? She was a recent graduate of the masters program at American Conservatory Theater in San Francisco, but the four to five auditions a week she was going to werent resulting in work. As the daughter of Nigerian immigrants, she found it puzzling to be repeatedly told that she wasnt African enough.

title: Looking for (Another) $1.1 Billion to Finish an Amusement Mall
description: A $1.1 billion bond offering to help complete construction of the American Dream mall in the New Jersey Meadowlands went forward this week, nine months after the sale was originally planned.

title: Biden to Create a Political Action Committee, a Possible Signal for 2020
description: WASHINGTON  Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. is planning to create a political action committee, the most concrete sign yet that he intends to remain active in the Democratic Party and is considering a presidential bid in 2020.

title: The Artist Sheena Rose Is Reaching Beyond Barbados
description: ST. PHILIP PARISH, BARBADOS  Almost every room in Sheena Roses family home, tucked away on a quiet street here, has played host to her paintings and live performance art.

title: The Long Haul Is a Truckers Slangy Tour of the Road
description: THE LONG HAULA Truckers Tales of Life on the RoadBy Finn Murphy229 pages. W.W Norton & Company. $26.95.

title: Emmett Tills Coffin, a Hangmans Scaffold and a Debate Over Cultural Appropriation
description: Protests over Sam Durants sculpture Scaffold, installed in the Minneapolis Sculpture Garden of the Walker Art Center, have drawn immediate parallels to the controversy this year over Dana Schutzs painting Open Casket in the Whitney Biennial.

title: Laura Biagiotti, Designer Called the Queen of Cashmere, Dies at 73
description: Laura Biagiotti, an Italian designer whose forgiving but elegant fashions made from fluffy goats wool defined her as the global queen of cashmere, died on Friday in Rome. She was 73.

title: Paris Agreement, Kabul, Kathy Griffin: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Ohio Sues Drug Makers, Saying They Aided Opioid Epidemic
description: The State of Ohio filed a lawsuit on Wednesday against the pharmaceutical industry over the opioid epidemic, accusing several drug companies of conducting marketing campaigns that misled doctors and patients about the danger of addiction and overdose.

title: Express Scripts Sues Maker of Overdose Drug, Intensifying Feud
description: This article is a collaboration between The Times and ProPublica, the independent nonprofit investigative-journalism organization.

title: Thar She Glows! How the Natural History Museum Cleans Its Blue Whale
description: This week the American Museum of Natural Historys blue whale  a life-size model 94 feet long and 21,000 pounds  had its annual bath. It takes one person, the exhibition maintenance manager Trenton Duerksen, two days with a cherry picker and a vacuum, and the results resemble before-and-after images from an infomercial: a thick layer of dust juxtaposed with a clean shine. For now, at least, the whale is blue again.

title: How Twitter Is Being Gamed to Feed Misinformation
description: After last years election, Facebook came in for a drubbing for its role in propagating misinformation  or fake news, as we called it back then, before the term became a catchall designation for any news you dont like. The criticism was well placed: Facebook is the worlds most popular social network, and millions of people look to it daily for news.

title: Trumps Budget Cuts? More Like Radical Surgery
description: With a week to sift through the Trump administrations first full-fledged budget proposal, two inescapable realities have come into sharper focus: the enormous magnitude of the desired cuts in many domestic programs and an utter disdain for numerical integrity.

title: For $499, a Drone for Beginners: DJIs Spark
description: If you thought those drones buzzing around on the beach were annoying, just wait and see what happens when they become cheaper than iPhones.

title: Newly Named NASA Spacecraft Will Aim Straight for the Sun
description: Last week, NASA teased that it would have an announcement about next years mission to send a spacecraft into the outer atmosphere of the sun. Commenters on Twitter joked that the space agency might be sending humans there.

title: Sean Spicer on Covfefe
description: The White House spokesman answered questions on President Trumps Twitter post.

title: Players Want Margaret Court Arena Renamed Over Remarks on Gays
description: PARIS  Show Court 1, one of the biggest stadiums at the Australian Open, was rechristened Margaret Court Arena in 2003 to honor the player who dominated womens tennis in the 1960s and still holds the record for the most Grand Slam titles.

title: U.S. Begins Arming Syrian Kurds for Final Assault on Raqqa
description: WASHINGTON  The United States has started arming Syrian Kurds with heavy machine guns, antitank weapons and other arms, a critical step in preparing a pivotal part of the force that will carry out the final assault on the Islamic States de facto capital of Raqqa, Pentagon officials said.

title: Trump Targets German Trade, and the South Grimaces
description: GREER, S.C.  No matter that this small Southern city sits squarely in the middle of Trump country: The president, with his criticism of German trade policy, was setting off alarm bells in the mind of Mayor Richard W. Danner.

title: Did Gucci Copy Dapper Dan? Or Was It Homage?
description: Who knocks off the knockers-off? Who bootlegs the bootleggers?

title: Trump Hosts Prime Minister Phuc of Vietnam and Announces Trade Deals
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump welcomed the prime minister of Vietnam to the Oval Office on Wednesday, cutting business deals and discussing the transfer of a Coast Guard cutter to a onetime enemy that the United States now views as a front-line defender against an expansionist China.

title: Noose Found Inside African American Museum in Washington
description: A noose was found Wednesday at an exhibition on segregation inside the National Museum of African American History and Culture in Washington, the Smithsonian Institution announced.

title: David Lewiston, Who Recorded Indigenous Music Far and Wide, Dies at 88
description: David Lewiston, whose recordings for Nonesuch records, beginning in the late 1960s, brought the indigenous music of Bali, Tibet, Guatemala and other ports of call to the ears of adventurous listeners, died on Monday in Wailuku, Hawaii. He was 88.

title: Review: Churchill Battling a War, and Himself
description: Winston Churchill the character has appeared in dozens of films, TV movies and mini-series over the years, and the portraits always hew to the gruff British bulldog conception of this 20th-century leader. Churchill, a new movie directed by Jonathan Teplitzky from a script by Alex von Tunzelmann, is laudable in its effort to shine a light on the Churchill who struggled in private with crippling depression  the black dog, he called it. His accuracy-in-metaphor was such that sufferers of subsequent generations have frequently adopted the term.

title: Corrections: June 1, 2017
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: For N.H.L.s Vegas Golden Knights, Hockey Should Never Be Boring
description: Mere weeks before they are to select 30 players in the N.H.L. expansion draft, the Vegas Golden Knights are operating at a breakneck pace.
